AI.method: InstruCoT 是一种模型增强方法，通过以下两个关键方面来防御 PI 攻击：1. 合成多样化的训练数据，以覆盖更广泛的恶意指令注入场景。2. 采用指令级别的链式思考（CoT）微调，引导 LLM 在处理输入时进行更深层次的推理，从而更容易区分合法指令和恶意指令。
AI.result: 在行为偏差、隐私泄露和有害输出三个关键维度上进行的评估表明，InstruCoT 在所有维度上都显著优于基线方法。实验结果表明，InstruCoT 在不损害模型效用性能的前提下，大幅提升了 LLM 的安全性。
AI.conclusion: InstruCoT 是一种有效的 LLM PI 防御方法，通过数据增强和指令 CoT 微调，能够显著提升 LLM 识别和拒绝恶意指令的能力，从而增强 LLM 应用的安全性。

title: CRANE: Causal Relevance Analysis of Language-Specific Neurons in Multilingual Large Language Models
summary: Multilingual large language models (LLMs) achieve strong performance across languages, yet how language capabilities are organized at the neuron level remains poorly understood. Prior work has identified language-related neurons mainly through activation-based heuristics, which conflate language preference with functional importance. Prior work has identified language-related neurons mainly through activation-based heuristics, which conflate language preference with functional importance. We propose CRANE, a relevance-based analysis framework that redefines language specificity in terms of functional necessity, identifying language-specific neurons through targeted neuron-level interventions. CRANE characterizes neuron specialization by their contribution to language-conditioned predictions rather than activation magnitude. Our implementation will be made publicly available. Neuron-level interventions reveal a consistent asymmetric pattern: masking neurons relevant to a target language selectively degrades performance on that language while preserving performance on other languages to a substantial extent, indicating language-selective but non-exclusive neuron specializations. Experiments on English, Chinese, and Vietnamese across multiple benchmarks, together with a dedicated relevance-based metric and base-to-chat model transfer analysis, show that CRANE isolates language-specific components more precisely than activation-based methods.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为CRANE的新框架，通过神经元级别的干预来分析多语言大语言模型（LLMs）中语言能力的神经元组织方式，区分了神经元的功能重要性而非仅仅是激活程度，发现了语言选择性但非排他性的神经元特化模式。
AI.motivation: 现有研究对多语言LLMs中语言能力在神经元层面的组织方式理解不足，主要依赖于激活度启发式方法，该方法将语言偏好与功能重要性混淆。本文旨在提出一种更精确的方法来识别和分析语言相关的神经元。
AI.method: 提出CRANE（Contrastive Relevance ANalysis framework），一个基于相关性的分析框架，通过在神经元层面进行目标性干预来重新定义语言特异性，将其视为功能上的必要性。CRANE通过衡量神经元对语言条件预测的贡献来表征神经元特化，而非激活幅度。通过掩码（masking）特定神经元来观察其对不同语言预测性能的影响。
AI.result: 神经元干预显示出一种不对称模式：掩码与目标语言相关的神经元会选择性地损害该语言的性能，同时能在很大程度上保留其他语言的性能，这表明存在语言选择性但非排他性的神经元特化。CRANE在英语、中文和越南语的多个基准测试上，连同专门的相关性指标和base到chat模型的迁移分析，证明其比基于激活度的方法能更精确地分离出语言特异性组件。
AI.conclusion: CRANE框架能够更精确地识别和分析多语言LLMs中语言相关的神经元，揭示了语言能力在神经元层面存在选择性但非完全独立的特化模式，为理解多语言模型的内部工作机制提供了新的视角。

title: DivAS: Interactive 3D Segmentation of NeRFs via Depth-Weighted Voxel Aggregation
summary: Existing methods for segmenting Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs) are often optimization-based, requiring slow per-scene training that sacrifices the zero-shot capabilities of 2D foundation models. We introduce DivAS (Depth-interactive Voxel Aggregation Segmentation), an optimization-free, fully interactive framework that addresses these limitations. Our method operates via a fast GUI-based workflow where 2D SAM masks, generated from user point prompts, are refined using NeRF-derived depth priors to improve geometric accuracy and foreground-background separation. The core of our contribution is a custom CUDA kernel that aggregates these refined multi-view masks into a unified 3D voxel grid in under 200ms, enabling real-time visual feedback. This optimization-free design eliminates the need for per-scene training. Experiments on Mip-NeRF 360° and LLFF show that DivAS achieves segmentation quality comparable to optimization-based methods, while being 2-2.5x faster end-to-end, and up to an order of magnitude faster when excluding user prompting time.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 DivAS 的 NeRF 分割框架，无需优化，使用 SAM 2D 掩码结合 NeRF 深度先验进行细化，并通过自定义 CUDA 核将其聚合到 3D 体素网格中，实现了实时交互式分割。该方法在不牺牲分割质量的情况下，比现有优化方法更快。
AI.motivation: 现有 NeRF 分割方法依赖于耗时的每场景优化训练，这削弱了 2D 基础模型的零样本能力。研究动机是开发一种无需优化、快速且交互式的 NeRF 分割方法。
AI.method: DivAS 采用交互式工作流程，首先使用 2D SAM（Segment Anything Model）和用户点提示生成 2D 掩码。然后，利用 NeRF 导出的深度先验对这些掩码进行几何精度和前景背景分离的细化。最后，通过自定义 CUDA 核将多视图的细化掩码聚合到一个统一的 3D 体素网格中，实现快速分割。
AI.result: DivAS 在 Mip-NeRF 360° 和 LLFF 数据集上进行了实验。结果表明，DivAS 的分割质量与基于优化的方法相当，但端到端速度快 2-2.5 倍，排除用户提示时间后速度可达优化方法的十倍。
AI.conclusion: DivAS 是一种优化无关、完全交互式的 NeRF 分割框架，通过结合 2D SAM 掩码和 NeRF 深度先验，并利用高效的 3D 体素聚合，实现了快速、高质量的 NeRF 分割，解决了现有方法的局限性。

title: ToolGate: Contract-Grounded and Verified Tool Execution for LLMs
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) augmented with external tools have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in complex reasoning tasks. However, existing frameworks rely heavily on natural language reasoning to determine when tools can be invoked and whether their results should be committed, lacking formal guarantees for logical safety and verifiability. We present \textbf{ToolGate}, a forward execution framework that provides logical safety guarantees and verifiable state evolution for LLM tool calling. ToolGate maintains an explicit symbolic state space as a typed key-value mapping representing trusted world information throughout the reasoning process. Each tool is formalized as a Hoare-style contract consisting of a precondition and a postcondition, where the precondition gates tool invocation by checking whether the current state satisfies the required conditions, and the postcondition determines whether the tool's result can be committed to update the state through runtime verification. Our approach guarantees that the symbolic state evolves only through verified tool executions, preventing invalid or hallucinated results from corrupting the world representation. Experimental validation demonstrates that ToolGate significantly improves the reliability and verifiability of tool-augmented LLM systems while maintaining competitive performance on complex multi-step reasoning tasks. This work establishes a foundation for building more trustworthy and debuggable AI systems that integrate language models with external tools.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 ToolGate 的新框架，用于增强大型语言模型（LLM）调用外部工具的能力，通过引入符号状态空间和基于 Hoare 风格合约的工具调用验证，确保了逻辑安全性和可验证性。
AI.motivation: 现有的 LLM 工具调用框架依赖于自然语言推理来决定何时调用工具以及是否确认其结果，缺乏形式化的逻辑安全和可验证性保证。
AI.method: ToolGate 维护一个显式的符号状态空间（类型化键值映射），并为每个工具形式化为包含前置条件和后置条件的 Hoare 风格合约。前置条件用于门控工具调用，后置条件通过运行时验证决定是否更新状态。
AI.result: ToolGate 保证了符号状态仅通过经过验证的工具执行进行演变，防止无效或幻觉结果污染世界表示。实验表明，ToolGate 在复杂的多步推理任务上，在保持性能的同时，显著提高了工具增强 LLM 系统的可靠性和可验证性。
AI.conclusion: ToolGate 为构建更值得信赖、可调试的集成语言模型与外部工具的 AI 系统奠定了基础。

title: LLM-Guided Quantified SMT Solving over Uninterpreted Functions
summary: Quantified formulas with Uninterpreted Functions (UFs) over non-linear real arithmetic pose fundamental challenges for Satisfiability Modulo Theories (SMT) solving. Traditional quantifier instantiation methods struggle because they lack semantic understanding of UF constraints, forcing them to search through unbounded solution spaces with limited guidance. We present AquaForte, a framework that leverages Large Language Models to provide semantic guidance for UF instantiation by generating instantiated candidates for function definitions that satisfy the constraints, thereby significantly reducing the search space and complexity for solvers. Our approach preprocesses formulas through constraint separation, uses structured prompts to extract mathematical reasoning from LLMs, and integrates the results with traditional SMT algorithms through adaptive instantiation. AquaForte maintains soundness through systematic validation: LLM-guided instantiations yielding SAT solve the original problem, while UNSAT results generate exclusion clauses for iterative refinement. Completeness is preserved by fallback to traditional solvers augmented with learned constraints. Experimental evaluation on SMT-COMP benchmarks demonstrates that AquaForte solves numerous instances where state-of-the-art solvers like Z3 and CVC5 timeout, with particular effectiveness on satisfiable formulas. Our work shows that LLMs can provide valuable mathematical intuition for symbolic reasoning, establishing a new paradigm for SMT constraint solving.

AI.tldr: AquaForte框架利用大型语言模型（LLM）为带非线性实数算术的未解释函数（UF）的量词实例化提供语义指导，从而解决了SMT求解的挑战，并通过实验证明其在处理复杂实例方面优于现有SOTA求解器。
AI.motivation: 传统SMT求解器在处理带非线性实数算术的未解释函数（UF）的量词实例化时面临挑战，因为它们缺乏语义理解，导致搜索空间过大。研究动机在于利用LLM的数学推理能力来改进UF实例化过程。
AI.method: AquaForte框架首先分离约束，然后使用结构化提示从LLM中提取数学推理，生成函数定义的实例化候选。这些候选通过自适应实例化被整合到传统的SMT算法中。 soundness通过系统验证保证，completeness则通过回退到传统求解器并增强学习到的约束来维持。
AI.result: 在SMT-COMP基准测试上的实验评估表明，AquaForte解决了大量现有SOTA求解器（如Z3和CVC5）超时的问题，尤其是在可满足公式方面效果显著。
AI.conclusion: AquaForte证明了LLM能够为符号推理提供有价值的数学直觉，为SMT约束求解开创了新的范式，显著提高了处理复杂UF实例化问题的能力。

title: AIVD: Adaptive Edge-Cloud Collaboration for Accurate and Efficient Industrial Visual Detection
summary: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) demonstrate exceptional capabilities in semantic understanding and visual reasoning, yet they still face challenges in precise object localization and resource-constrained edge-cloud deployment. To address this, this paper proposes the AIVD framework, which achieves unified precise localization and high-quality semantic generation through the collaboration between lightweight edge detectors and cloud-based MLLMs. To enhance the cloud MLLM's robustness against edge cropped-box noise and scenario variations, we design an efficient fine-tuning strategy with visual-semantic collaborative augmentation, significantly improving classification accuracy and semantic consistency. Furthermore, to maintain high throughput and low latency across heterogeneous edge devices and dynamic network conditions, we propose a heterogeneous resource-aware dynamic scheduling algorithm. Experimental results demonstrate that AIVD substantially reduces resource consumption while improving MLLM classification performance and semantic generation quality. The proposed scheduling strategy also achieves higher throughput and lower latency across diverse scenarios.

AI.tldr: 本文提出 AIVD 框架，通过轻量级边缘检测器和云端 MLLMs 协同，实现精确目标定位和高质量语义生成，并设计了高效的微调策略和资源感知动态调度算法，以降低资源消耗并提高性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）在目标定位和资源受限的边缘云部署方面存在挑战。
AI.method: 提出了 AIVD 框架，结合轻量级边缘检测器和云端 MLLMs。设计了包含视觉-语义协同增强的微调策略，以及异构资源感知动态调度算法。
AI.result: AIVD 框架显著降低了资源消耗，提升了 MLLM 的分类性能和语义生成质量。调度策略在不同场景下实现了更高的吞吐量和更低的延迟。
AI.conclusion: AIVD 框架有效地解决了 MLLMs 在精确目标定位和边缘云部署中的问题，通过协同设计和优化的策略，在性能和效率上均取得了显著提升。

title: ResMAS: Resilience Optimization in LLM-based Multi-agent Systems
summary: Large Language Model-based Multi-Agent Systems (LLM-based MAS), where multiple LLM agents collaborate to solve complex tasks, have shown impressive performance in many areas. However, MAS are typically distributed across different devices or environments, making them vulnerable to perturbations such as agent failures. While existing works have studied the adversarial attacks and corresponding defense strategies, they mainly focus on reactively detecting and mitigating attacks after they occur rather than proactively designing inherently resilient systems. In this work, we study the resilience of LLM-based MAS under perturbations and find that both the communication topology and prompt design significantly influence system resilience. Motivated by these findings, we propose ResMAS: a two-stage framework for enhancing MAS resilience. First, we train a reward model to predict the MAS's resilience, based on which we train a topology generator to automatically design resilient topology for specific tasks through reinforcement learning. Second, we introduce a topology-aware prompt optimization method that refines each agent's prompt based on its connections and interactions with other agents. Extensive experiments across a range of tasks show that our approach substantially improves MAS resilience under various constraints. Moreover, our framework demonstrates strong generalization ability to new tasks and models, highlighting its potential for building resilient MASs.

AI.tldr: 研究了大型语言模型（LLM）多智能体系统（MAS）在扰动下的鲁棒性，并提出了一个名为ResMAS的两阶段框架，通过学习奖励模型和生成鲁棒通信拓扑，以及进行拓扑感知的提示优化，来增强MAS的鲁棒性。
AI.motivation: 现有的MAS鲁棒性研究多是事后应对，缺乏主动设计鲁棒系统的策略。本研究旨在主动提升LLM-MAS在面对代理故障等扰动时的鲁棒性。
AI.method: 提出ResMAS框架，包含两个阶段：1. 训练奖励模型预测MAS鲁棒性，并利用强化学习训练拓扑生成器自动设计鲁棒拓扑。2. 引入拓扑感知的提示优化方法，根据代理间的连接和交互调整其提示。
AI.result: 在多种任务上的广泛实验表明，ResMAS显著提高了MAS在不同约束下的鲁棒性，并展现出对新任务和模型的良好泛化能力。
AI.conclusion: 通信拓扑和提示设计对LLM-MAS的鲁棒性至关重要。ResMAS通过自动设计鲁棒拓扑和优化提示，能够有效增强LLM-MAS的鲁棒性，并具备良好的泛化性。

title: Scaling Vision Language Models for Pharmaceutical Long Form Video Reasoning on Industrial GenAI Platform
comment: Submitted to the Industry Track of Top Tier Conference; currently under peer review
summary: Vision Language Models (VLMs) have shown strong performance on multimodal reasoning tasks, yet most evaluations focus on short videos and assume unconstrained computational resources. In industrial settings such as pharmaceutical content understanding, practitioners must process long-form videos under strict GPU, latency, and cost constraints, where many existing approaches fail to scale. In this work, we present an industrial GenAI framework that processes over 200,000 PDFs, 25,326 videos across eight formats (e.g., MP4, M4V, etc.), and 888 multilingual audio files in more than 20 languages. Our study makes three contributions: (i) an industrial large-scale architecture for multimodal reasoning in pharmaceutical domains; (ii) empirical analysis of over 40 VLMs on two leading benchmarks (Video-MME and MMBench) and proprietary dataset of 25,326 videos across 14 disease areas; and (iii) four findings relevant to long-form video reasoning: the role of multimodality, attention mechanism trade-offs, temporal reasoning limits, and challenges of video splitting under GPU constraints. Results show 3-8 times efficiency gains with SDPA attention on commodity GPUs, multimodality improving up to 8/12 task domains (especially length-dependent tasks), and clear bottlenecks in temporal alignment and keyframe detection across open- and closed-source VLMs. Rather than proposing a new "A+B" model, this paper characterizes practical limits, trade-offs, and failure patterns of current VLMs under realistic deployment constraints, and provide actionable guidance for both researchers and practitioners designing scalable multimodal systems for long-form video understanding in industrial domains.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一个用于处理长视频和多模态信息的工业级生成式AI框架，并评估了40多个视觉语言模型（VLM）在工业场景下的性能和效率，发现了多模态、注意力机制、时间推理和视频分割方面的实际限制和权衡。
AI.motivation: 现有的视觉语言模型（VLM）评估通常关注短视频且计算资源无限制，这与制药等工业领域在GPU、延迟和成本限制下处理长视频的需求不符，现有方法难以扩展。
AI.method: 构建了一个工业级大规模多模态推理架构，处理了超过20万份PDF、25,326个视频和888个音频文件。在Video-MME、MMBench和专有数据集上对超过40个VLM进行了实证分析，重点研究了多模态、注意力机制、时间推理和视频分割在GPU限制下的表现。
AI.result: 使用SDPA注意力机制在普通GPU上实现了3-8倍的效率提升。多模态能力在8/12个任务领域有所改善，尤其是在依赖长度的任务上。在时间对齐和关键帧检测方面，无论是开源还是闭源VLM都存在明显的瓶颈。
AI.conclusion: 该研究没有提出新的模型，而是揭示了当前VLM在工业长视频理解的实际部署限制、权衡和失败模式，并为研究人员和从业者设计可扩展的多模态系统提供了可行性指导。

title: See, Explain, and Intervene: A Few-Shot Multimodal Agent Framework for Hateful Meme Moderation
summary: In this work, we examine hateful memes from three complementary angles - how to detect them, how to explain their content and how to intervene them prior to being posted - by applying a range of strategies built on top of generative AI models. To the best of our knowledge, explanation and intervention have typically been studied separately from detection, which does not reflect real-world conditions. Further, since curating large annotated datasets for meme moderation is prohibitively expensive, we propose a novel framework that leverages task-specific generative multimodal agents and the few-shot adaptability of large multimodal models to cater to different types of memes. We believe this is the first work focused on generalizable hateful meme moderation under limited data conditions, and has strong potential for deployment in real-world production scenarios. Warning: Contains potentially toxic contents.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种基于生成式AI模型的新框架，用于在数据有限的情况下进行可泛化的仇恨表情包检测、解释和干预。
AI.motivation: 现实世界中的仇恨表情包处理需要同时考虑检测、解释和干预，而以往的研究通常将它们分开处理。此外，标注大型数据集成本高昂，限制了仇恨表情包的有效识别。
AI.method: 利用任务特定的生成式多模态代理和大型多模态模型的少样本适应性，构建了一个能够处理不同类型仇恨表情包的新框架，并集成了检测、解释和干预策略。
AI.result: 该框架在数据有限的条件下实现了可泛化的仇恨表情包管理，并且在现实世界的生产环境中具有部署潜力。
AI.conclusion: 该研究首次提出了在数据稀缺条件下进行通用仇恨表情包管理的方法，通过集成检测、解释和干预，并利用生成式AI模型的优势，为实际应用提供了有效的解决方案。

title: Rotation-Robust Regression with Convolutional Model Trees
summary: We study rotation-robust learning for image inputs using Convolutional Model Trees (CMTs) [1], whose split and leaf coefficients can be structured on the image grid and transformed geometrically at deployment time. In a controlled MNIST setting with a rotation-invariant regression target, we introduce three geometry-aware inductive biases for split directions -- convolutional smoothing, a tilt dominance constraint, and importance-based pruning -- and quantify their impact on robustness under in-plane rotations. We further evaluate a deployment-time orientation search that selects a discrete rotation maximizing a forest-level confidence proxy without updating model parameters. Orientation search improves robustness under severe rotations but can be harmful near the canonical orientation when confidence is misaligned with correctness. Finally, we observe consistent trends on MNIST digit recognition implemented as one-vs-rest regression, highlighting both the promise and limitations of confidence-based orientation selection for model-tree ensembles.

AI.tldr: 本文研究使用卷积模型树（CMTs）进行图像输入的旋转鲁棒学习，并提出并评估了三种几何感知归纳偏置以及一种部署时方向搜索方法，以提高模型在旋转情况下的鲁棒性。
AI.motivation: 图像分类任务中，模型对旋转变化敏感，这限制了其在现实世界应用中的泛化能力。研究者希望通过引入新的模型结构和训练策略来提高CMTs的旋转鲁棒性。
AI.method: 1. 构建卷积模型树（CMTs），其结构可适应图像网格并支持几何变换。 2. 引入三种几何感知归纳偏置：卷积平滑、倾斜主导约束和基于重要性的剪枝。 3. 评估一种部署时方向搜索方法，该方法在不更新模型参数的情况下，通过最大化森林级别的置信度代理来选择最佳离散旋转。 4. 在MNIST数据集上进行对照实验和分类任务评估。
AI.result: 1. 几何感知归纳偏置能够提高模型在平面内旋转下的鲁棒性。 2. 部署时方向搜索在严重旋转下能提升鲁棒性，但在接近标准方向时可能因置信度与正确率不匹配而产生负面影响。 3. 在MNIST数字识别任务中观察到与置信度相关的方向选择方法具有潜力和局限性。
AI.conclusion: 卷积模型树（CMTs）结合几何感知归纳偏置和部署时方向搜索，能够改善图像输入的旋转鲁棒性。然而，置信度度量在确定最佳方向时并非总是可靠，需要进一步研究以优化其性能。

title: Thunder-KoNUBench: A Corpus-Aligned Benchmark for Korean Negation Understanding
summary: Although negation is known to challenge large language models (LLMs), benchmarks for evaluating negation understanding, especially in Korean, are scarce. We conduct a corpus-based analysis of Korean negation and show that LLM performance degrades under negation. We then introduce Thunder-KoNUBench, a sentence-level benchmark that reflects the empirical distribution of Korean negation phenomena. Evaluating 47 LLMs, we analyze the effects of model size and instruction tuning, and show that fine-tuning on Thunder-KoNUBench improves negation understanding and broader contextual comprehension in Korean.

AI.tldr: 该研究评估了大型语言模型（LLMs）在理解韩语否定句方面的能力，并提出了一个名为Thunder-KoNUBench的新基准，用于衡量这一能力，同时表明通过在该基准上进行微调可以提升LLMs的韩语理解能力。
AI.motivation: 现有的评估大型语言模型（LLMs）理解否定句能力的基准，尤其是在韩语方面，非常缺乏。研究者注意到LLMs在处理否定句时表现不佳，并希望通过构建一个更具代表性的韩语否定句基准来解决这一问题。
AI.method: 研究者首先进行了韩语否定句的语料库分析，以了解其分布特点。在此基础上，他们构建了一个名为Thunder-KoNUBench的句子级基准。然后，他们使用该基准评估了47个LLMs，并分析了模型规模和指令微调对其性能的影响。最后，他们通过在Thunder-KoNUBench上进行微调，来验证该基准对提升LLMs韩语否定句理解能力的有效性。
AI.result: 研究发现，LLMs在处理韩语否定句时性能会下降。模型规模和指令微调对LLMs的否定句理解能力有一定影响。通过在Thunder-KoNUBench基准上进行微调，可以显著提高LLMs对韩语否定句的理解能力，并可能提升其更广泛的上下文理解能力。
AI.conclusion: 韩语否定句的理解是LLMs面临的一个挑战。Thunder-KoNUBench是一个反映韩语否定句实际分布的有效评估基准。对LLMs进行该基准的微调，能够有效提升其韩语否定句理解能力及整体语境理解能力。

title: Prototypicality Bias Reveals Blindspots in Multimodal Evaluation Metrics
summary: Automatic metrics are now central to evaluating text-to-image models, often substituting for human judgment in benchmarking and large-scale filtering. However, it remains unclear whether these metrics truly prioritize semantic correctness or instead favor visually and socially prototypical images learned from biased data distributions. We identify and study \emph{prototypicality bias} as a systematic failure mode in multimodal evaluation. We introduce a controlled contrastive benchmark \textsc{\textbf{ProtoBias}} (\textit{\textbf{Proto}typical \textbf{Bias}}), spanning Animals, Objects, and Demography images, where semantically correct but non-prototypical images are paired with subtly incorrect yet prototypical adversarial counterparts. This setup enables a directional evaluation of whether metrics follow textual semantics or default to prototypes. Our results show that widely used metrics, including CLIPScore, PickScore, and VQA-based scores, frequently misrank these pairs, while even LLM-as-Judge systems exhibit uneven robustness in socially grounded cases. Human evaluations consistently favour semantic correctness with larger decision margins. Motivated by these findings, we propose \textbf{\textsc{ProtoScore}}, a robust 7B-parameter metric that substantially reduces failure rates and suppresses misranking, while running at orders of magnitude faster than the inference time of GPT-5, approaching the robustness of much larger closed-source judges.

AI.tldr: 现有的自动文本到图像评估指标存在“原型偏差”问题，即它们倾向于选择视觉上更典型但可能语义不正确的图像。研究提出了一个名为 ProtoBias 的基准来评估此问题，并开发了一个名为 ProtoScore 的新指标，该指标在解决原型偏差方面表现更好，并且效率更高。
AI.motivation: 当前的自动评估指标在评估文本到图像模型时，并不清楚它们是真正关注语义的正确性，还是偏好从有偏见的数据分布中学到的视觉上和社会上典型的图像。研究者希望理解和解决这种“原型偏差”问题。
AI.method: 研究者提出了一个名为 ProtoBias 的受控对比基准，其中包含语义正确但非典型的图像和语义略有错误但典型的对抗性图像。他们使用这个基准来评估现有的指标（如 CLIPScore、PickScore、基于 VQA 的分数）以及 LLM-as-Judge 系统。在此基础上，他们提出了一个名为 ProtoScore 的新的 7B 参数度量标准。
AI.result: 现有的指标（CLIPScore、PickScore、VQA-based scores）和 LLM-as-Judge 系统在 ProtoBias 基准上经常错误地对成对图像进行排名。人类评估一致倾向于语义正确性。ProtoScore 度量标准显著降低了故障率，抑制了错误的排名，并且运行速度比 GPT-5 快很多数量级。
AI.conclusion: 现有的自动评估指标存在原型偏差，这阻碍了它们准确评估文本到图像模型。ProtoScore 是一种更鲁棒、更高效的替代方案，能够更好地遵循文本语义，减少不正确的排名。

title: Tape: A Cellular Automata Benchmark for Evaluating Rule-Shift Generalization in Reinforcement Learning
summary: We present Tape, a controlled reinforcement-learning benchmark designed to isolate out-of-distribution (OOD) failure under latent rule shifts.Tape is derived from one-dimensional cellular automata, enabling precise train/test splits where observation and action spaces are held fixed while transition rules change. Using a reproducible evaluation pipeline, we compare model-free baselines, model-based planning with learned world models, and task-inference (meta-RL) methods. A consistent pattern emerges: methods that are strong in-distribution (ID) can collapse under heldout-rule OOD, and high-variance OOD evaluation can make rankings unstable unless experiments are sufficiently replicated.We provide (i) standardized OOD protocols, (ii) statistical reporting requirements (seeds, confidence intervals, and hypothesis tests), and (iii) information-theoretic identities connecting entropy reduction to conditional mutual information and expected posterior KL divergence, clarifying what "uncertainty reduction" objectives can and cannot guarantee under rule shifts.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一个名为 Tape 的强化学习基准测试，用于研究模型在处理潜在规则变化（即分布外 OOD）时的失效情况。该基准测试基于一维细胞自动机，能够固定观测和动作空间，仅改变转换规则来实现训练/测试分离。研究评估了无模型基线、基于学习世界模型的模型规划以及任务推理（元 RL）方法，发现强大的模型内分布（ID）性能并不一定能保证分布外（OOD）的鲁棒性，并且 OOD 评估的变异性会影响结果的稳定性，需要充分的复制实验。此外，研究还提供了标准化的 OOD 协议、统计报告要求以及信息论身份，以澄清“不确定性约简”目标在规则变化下的局限性。
AI.motivation: 现有的强化学习基准测试在评估模型在面对分布外（OOD）数据，特别是潜在规则发生变化时的鲁棒性方面存在不足。研究者希望设计一个能够精确隔离 OOD 失败场景的基准，以深入理解和改进 RL 算法的泛化能力。
AI.method: 研究者提出了 Tape，一个基于一维细胞自动机的强化学习基准测试。Tape 的关键在于能够保持观测空间和动作空间不变，而仅改变环境的转换规则，从而创建严格的分布内（ID）和分布外（OOD）训练/测试集。他们使用标准化的评估流程，比较了无模型基线、基于学习世界模型的规划方法以及任务推理（元 RL）方法。
AI.result: 研究发现，在分布内（ID）表现优异的模型，在面对规则发生变化的分布外（OOD）场景时，性能会急剧下降。同时，高方差的 OOD 评估会使得模型性能排名不稳定，需要进行充分的实验复制才能获得可靠的结论。研究还揭示了信息论上的联系，明确了“不确定性约简”目标在规则变化下的理论保证范围。
AI.conclusion: Tape 提供了一个有用的平台来研究 RL 算法在潜在规则变化下的 OOD 泛化能力。研究结果表明，当前许多 RL 方法在 ID 表现良好，但在 OOD 场景下容易失效。为了获得可靠的 OOD 评估结果，需要标准化的协议、充分的统计报告（如随机种子、置信区间和假设检验）以及对模型不确定性约简机制的深入理解。

title: A Method for Constructing a Digital Transformation Driving Mechanism Based on Semantic Understanding of Large Models
summary: In the process of digital transformation, enterprises are faced with problems such as insufficient semantic understanding of unstructured data and lack of intelligent decision-making basis in driving mechanisms. This study proposes a method that combines a large language model (LLM) and a knowledge graph. First, a fine-tuned BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) model is used to perform entity recognition and relationship extraction on multi-source heterogeneous texts, and GPT-4 is used to generate semantically enhanced vector representations; secondly, a two-layer graph neural network (GNN) architecture is designed to fuse the semantic vectors output by LLM with business metadata to construct a dynamic and scalable enterprise knowledge graph; then reinforcement learning is introduced to optimize decision path generation, and the reward function is used to drive the mechanism iteration. In the case of the manufacturing industry, this mechanism reduced the response time for equipment failure scenarios from 7.8 hours to 3.7 hours, the F1 value reached 94.3%, and the compensation for decision errors in the annual digital transformation cost decreased by 45.3%. This method significantly enhances the intelligence level and execution efficiency of the digital transformation driving mechanism by integrating large model semantic understanding with structured knowledge.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合大语言模型（LLM）和知识图谱的方法，以解决企业数字化转型中数据理解不足和决策机制缺乏智能的问题。该方法通过BERT进行实体关系抽取，GPT-4生成语义向量，并利用GNN构建企业知识图谱，最后引入强化学习优化决策路径。
AI.motivation: 企业在数字化转型过程中面临非结构化数据语义理解不足和驱动机制缺乏智能决策基础的问题。
AI.method: 1. 使用微调的BERT进行实体识别和关系抽取，GPT-4生成语义增强向量。2. 设计两层GNN架构，融合LLM语义向量和业务元数据，构建动态可扩展的企业知识图谱。3. 引入强化学习优化决策路径生成，并使用奖励函数驱动机制迭代。
AI.result: 在制造业案例中，该机制将设备故障场景的响应时间从7.8小时缩短到3.7小时，F1值达到94.3%，年数字化转型成本的决策错误补偿降低了45.3%。
AI.conclusion: 该方法通过整合大模型语义理解和结构化知识，显著提升了数字化转型驱动机制的智能化水平和执行效率。

title: TEA: Temporal Adaptive Satellite Image Semantic Segmentation
comment: Under review. Code will be available at \href{https://github.com/KeplerKang/TEA}{this https URL}
summary: Crop mapping based on satellite images time-series (SITS) holds substantial economic value in agricultural production settings, in which parcel segmentation is an essential step. Existing approaches have achieved notable advancements in SITS segmentation with predetermined sequence lengths. However, we found that these approaches overlooked the generalization capability of models across scenarios with varying temporal length, leading to markedly poor segmentation results in such cases. To address this issue, we propose TEA, a TEmporal Adaptive SITS semantic segmentation method to enhance the model's resilience under varying sequence lengths. We introduce a teacher model that encapsulates the global sequence knowledge to guide a student model with adaptive temporal input lengths. Specifically, teacher shapes the student's feature space via intermediate embedding, prototypes and soft label perspectives to realize knowledge transfer, while dynamically aggregating student model to mitigate knowledge forgetting. Finally, we introduce full-sequence reconstruction as an auxiliary task to further enhance the quality of representations across inputs of varying temporal lengths. Through extensive experiments, we demonstrate that our method brings remarkable improvements across inputs of different temporal lengths on common benchmarks. Our code will be publicly available.

AI.tldr: 提出一种名为TEA（Temporal Adaptive SITS semantic segmentation）的方法，通过教师-学生模型知识迁移和全序列重建辅助任务，提高了遥感影像时间序列（SITS）语义分割模型在不同时间序列长度下的泛化能力。
AI.motivation: 现有SITS分割方法在固定序列长度下表现良好，但在序列长度变化时泛化能力不足，导致分割效果显著下降。
AI.method: TEA方法采用教师-学生模型框架。教师模型学习全局序列知识，并通过中间嵌入、原型和软标签等方式指导学生模型进行知识迁移。同时，采用动态聚合学生模型来缓解知识遗忘。此外，引入全序列重建作为辅助任务，以增强不同时间序列长度输入下的表示质量。
AI.result: 在常见数据集上的广泛实验表明，TEA方法在不同时间序列长度的输入下均取得了显著的改进。
AI.conclusion: TEA方法能够有效提升SITS语义分割模型在序列长度变化场景下的鲁棒性和泛化能力。

title: PRISM: A Unified Framework for Post-Training LLMs Without Verifiable Rewards
summary: Current techniques for post-training Large Language Models (LLMs) rely either on costly human supervision or on external verifiers to boost performance on tasks such as mathematical reasoning and code generation. However, as LLMs improve their problem-solving, any further improvement will potentially require high-quality solutions to difficult problems that are not available to humans. As a result, learning from unlabeled data is becoming increasingly attractive in the research community. Existing methods extract learning signal from a model's consistency, either by majority voting or by converting the model's internal confidence into reward. Although internal consistency metric such as entropy or self-certainty require no human intervention, as we show in this work, these are unreliable signals for large-scale and long-term training. To address the unreliability, we propose PRISM, a unified training framework that uses a Process Reward Model (PRM) to guide learning alongside model's internal confidence in the absence of ground-truth labels. We show that effectively combining PRM with self-certainty can lead to both stable training and better test-time performance, and also keep the model's internal confidence in check.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种名为PRISM的统一训练框架，通过结合过程奖励模型（PRM）和模型自身的置信度来指导大型语言模型（LLMs）的学习，以克服现有方法在没有人工标注数据时学习信号不可靠的问题。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLMs）后训练技术依赖于昂贵的人工监督或外部验证器。然而，随着LLMs解决问题的能力提升，未来可能需要高质量的困难问题解决方案，而这些方案人类难以获得。因此，从无标签数据中学习变得越来越有吸引力。
AI.method: 研究中提出的PRISM框架，使用过程奖励模型（PRM）来指导学习，并结合模型自身的置信度（self-certainty）。PRM通过评估模型解决问题的过程来提供奖励信号，而不需要地面真实标签。
AI.result: 实验表明，有效地结合PRM和模型自身的置信度可以实现稳定的训练，并提高模型在测试时的性能。同时，这种方法也能对模型的内部置信度进行约束。
AI.conclusion: PRISM框架能够有效地利用无标签数据进行LLMs的训练，解决了现有方法中内部一致性信号不可靠的问题，并取得了更好的训练稳定性和模型性能。

title: TourPlanner: A Competitive Consensus Framework with Constraint-Gated Reinforcement Learning for Travel Planning
summary: Travel planning is a sophisticated decision-making process that requires synthesizing multifaceted information to construct itineraries. However, existing travel planning approaches face several challenges: (1) Pruning candidate points of interest (POIs) while maintaining a high recall rate; (2) A single reasoning path restricts the exploration capability within the feasible solution space for travel planning; (3) Simultaneously optimizing hard constraints and soft constraints remains a significant difficulty. To address these challenges, we propose TourPlanner, a comprehensive framework featuring multi-path reasoning and constraint-gated reinforcement learning. Specifically, we first introduce a Personalized Recall and Spatial Optimization (PReSO) workflow to construct spatially-aware candidate POIs' set. Subsequently, we propose Competitive consensus Chain-of-Thought (CCoT), a multi-path reasoning paradigm that improves the ability of exploring the feasible solution space. To further refine the plan, we integrate a sigmoid-based gating mechanism into the reinforcement learning stage, which dynamically prioritizes soft-constraint satisfaction only after hard constraints are met. Experimental results on travel planning benchmarks demonstrate that TourPlanner achieves state-of-the-art performance, significantly surpassing existing methods in both feasibility and user-preference alignment.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了TourPlanner框架，通过多路径推理和约束门控强化学习来解决旅行规划中的挑战，包括候选兴趣点（POI）的筛选、推理路径的局限性以及硬软约束的协同优化。
AI.motivation: 现有旅行规划方法在候选兴趣点（POI）筛选、推理路径的单一性以及硬软约束的联合优化方面存在困难。
AI.method: 提出TourPlanner框架，包含两个主要部分：1) 个性化召回与空间优化（PReSO）工作流，用于构建空间感知的候选POI集合。2) 竞争共识思维链（CCoT），一种多路径推理范式。此外，在强化学习阶段引入基于Sigmoid的门控机制，以动态优化约束。
AI.result: TourPlanner在旅行规划基准测试中取得了最先进的性能，显著优于现有方法，尤其在可行性和用户偏好一致性方面。
AI.conclusion: TourPlanner框架通过多路径推理和约束门控强化学习，有效地解决了旅行规划中的关键挑战，提升了规划的可行性和用户满意度。

title: Prior-Informed Zeroth-Order Optimization with Adaptive Direction Alignment for Memory-Efficient LLM Fine-Tuning
summary: Fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) has achieved remarkable success across various NLP tasks, but the substantial memory overhead during backpropagation remains a critical bottleneck, especially as model scales grow. Zeroth-order (ZO) optimization alleviates this issue by estimating gradients through forward passes and Gaussian sampling, avoiding the need for backpropagation. However, conventional ZO methods suffer from high variance in gradient estimation due to their reliance on random perturbations, leading to slow convergence and suboptimal performance. We propose a simple plug-and-play method that incorporates prior-informed perturbations to refine gradient estimation. Our method dynamically computes a guiding vector from Gaussian samples, which directs perturbations toward more informative directions, significantly accelerating convergence compared to standard ZO approaches. We further investigate a greedy perturbation strategy to explore the impact of prior knowledge on gradient estimation. Theoretically, we prove that our gradient estimator achieves stronger alignment with the true gradient direction, enhancing optimization efficiency. Extensive experiments across LLMs of varying scales and architectures demonstrate that our proposed method could seamlessly integrate into existing optimization methods, delivering faster convergence and superior performance. Notably, on the OPT-13B model, our method outperforms traditional ZO optimization across all 11 benchmark tasks and surpasses gradient-based baselines on 9 out of 11 tasks, establishing a robust balance between efficiency and accuracy.

AI.tldr: 提出一种即插即用的方法，通过引入先验信息指导的扰动来改进零阶（ZO）优化的梯度估计，从而加速大语言模型（LLM）的微调，并取得比传统ZO和基于梯度的方法更好的性能。
AI.motivation: 大语言模型（LLM）的微调面临巨大的内存开销，主要是由于反向传播。现有的零阶（ZO）优化方法虽然避免了反向传播，但梯度估计方差大，收敛慢。
AI.method: 提出一种即插即用的方法，通过动态计算一个引导向量来指导高斯采样，从而使扰动方向更具信息量。此外，还研究了贪婪扰动策略。理论上证明了梯度估计器与真实梯度方向的一致性更强。
AI.result: 该方法可以无缝集成到现有优化方法中，实现更快的收敛和更高的性能。在OPT-13B模型上，与传统ZO优化方法相比，在所有11个基准任务上性能更优；与基于梯度的方法相比，在9个任务上性能更优。
AI.conclusion: 通过引入先验信息指导的扰动，可以显著提高ZO优化的梯度估计质量，从而在大语言模型的微调中实现效率和准确性的良好平衡。

title: SparseLaneSTP: Leveraging Spatio-Temporal Priors with Sparse Transformers for 3D Lane Detection
comment: Published at IEEE/CVF International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV) 2025
summary: 3D lane detection has emerged as a critical challenge in autonomous driving, encompassing identification and localization of lane markings and the 3D road surface. Conventional 3D methods detect lanes from dense birds-eye-viewed (BEV) features, though erroneous transformations often result in a poor feature representation misaligned with the true 3D road surface. While recent sparse lane detectors have surpassed dense BEV approaches, they completely disregard valuable lane-specific priors. Furthermore, existing methods fail to utilize historic lane observations, which yield the potential to resolve ambiguities in situations of poor visibility. To address these challenges, we present SparseLaneSTP, a novel method that integrates both geometric properties of the lane structure and temporal information into a sparse lane transformer. It introduces a new lane-specific spatio-temporal attention mechanism, a continuous lane representation tailored for sparse architectures as well as temporal regularization. Identifying weaknesses of existing 3D lane datasets, we also introduce a precise and consistent 3D lane dataset using a simple yet effective auto-labeling strategy. Our experimental section proves the benefits of our contributions and demonstrates state-of-the-art performance across all detection and error metrics on existing 3D lane detection benchmarks as well as on our novel dataset.

AI.tldr: 提出一种名为SparseLaneSTP的新型3D车道线检测方法，该方法结合了车道结构的几何特性和时序信息，利用稀疏Transformer进行检测，并引入了新的时空注意力机制、连续车道表示和时序正则化。同时，还发布了一个新的3D车道线数据集。实验证明该方法在多个3D车道线检测基准上取得了最先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有3D车道线检测方法存在不足：基于BEV的方法存在视图转换误差导致特征表示不准确；稀疏方法忽略了车道线先验信息；且均未能充分利用历史观测信息来解决低能见度下的检测模糊性。
AI.method: 提出SparseLaneSTP方法，采用稀疏Transformer架构，并引入：1) 新的车道线特定时空注意力机制；2) 针对稀疏架构的连续车道线表示；3) 时序正则化。此外，还开发了一种自动标注策略来构建新的3D车道线数据集。
AI.result: SparseLaneSTP在现有3D车道线检测基准和新数据集上，在所有检测和误差指标上均实现了最先进的性能。实验证明了所提出贡献（时空注意力、连续表示、时序正则化、新数据集）的有效性。
AI.conclusion: SparseLaneSTP通过集成几何先验和时序信息，有效地解决了现有3D车道线检测方法的局限性，并在多个基准上取得了SOTA性能，证明了所提出方法的有效性和通用性。

title: Beyond Monolithic Architectures: A Multi-Agent Search and Knowledge Optimization Framework for Agentic Search
summary: Agentic search has emerged as a promising paradigm for complex information seeking by enabling Large Language Models (LLMs) to interleave reasoning with tool use. However, prevailing systems rely on monolithic agents that suffer from structural bottlenecks, including unconstrained reasoning outputs that inflate trajectories, sparse outcome-level rewards that complicate credit assignment, and stochastic search noise that destabilizes learning. To address these challenges, we propose \textbf{M-ASK} (Multi-Agent Search and Knowledge), a framework that explicitly decouples agentic search into two complementary roles: Search Behavior Agents, which plan and execute search actions, and Knowledge Management Agents, which aggregate, filter, and maintain a compact internal context. This decomposition allows each agent to focus on a well-defined subtask and reduces interference between search and context construction. Furthermore, to enable stable coordination, M-ASK employs turn-level rewards to provide granular supervision for both search decisions and knowledge updates. Experiments on multi-hop QA benchmarks demonstrate that M-ASK outperforms strong baselines, achieving not only superior answer accuracy but also significantly more stable training dynamics.\footnote{The source code for M-ASK is available at https://github.com/chenyiqun/M-ASK.}

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为M-ASK（Multi-Agent Search and Knowledge）的框架，通过将LLM的搜索过程分解为搜索行为代理和知识管理代理，并引入了回合级奖励机制，以克服当前单体代理在推理、奖励分配和学习稳定性方面的瓶颈，实验证明其在多跳问答任务上表现更优且训练更稳定。
AI.motivation: 现有的agentic search方法依赖于单体代理，存在推理输出不约束、奖励稀疏导致信用分配困难、以及随机搜索噪声导致学习不稳定等结构性瓶颈。
AI.method: M-ASK框架将agentic search显式地分解为两个互补的角色：搜索行为代理（负责规划和执行搜索动作）和知识管理代理（负责聚合、过滤和维护内部上下文）。此外，引入了回合级奖励机制，为搜索决策和知识更新提供细粒度的监督。
AI.result: 在多跳问答基准测试中，M-ASK的表现优于强基线模型，不仅提高了答案的准确性，而且训练动态也显著更稳定。
AI.conclusion: M-ASK框架通过解耦代理角色和引入回合级奖励，有效地解决了现有agentic search方法的挑战，实现了更优的性能和更稳定的训练。

title: DSC2025 -- ViHallu Challenge: Detecting Hallucination in Vietnamese LLMs
summary: The reliability of large language models (LLMs) in production environments remains significantly constrained by their propensity to generate hallucinations -- fluent, plausible-sounding outputs that contradict or fabricate information. While hallucination detection has recently emerged as a priority in English-centric benchmarks, low-to-medium resource languages such as Vietnamese remain inadequately covered by standardized evaluation frameworks. This paper introduces the DSC2025 ViHallu Challenge, the first large-scale shared task for detecting hallucinations in Vietnamese LLMs. We present the ViHallu dataset, comprising 10,000 annotated triplets of (context, prompt, response) samples systematically partitioned into three hallucination categories: no hallucination, intrinsic, and extrinsic hallucinations. The dataset incorporates three prompt types -- factual, noisy, and adversarial -- to stress-test model robustness. A total of 111 teams participated, with the best-performing system achieving a macro-F1 score of 84.80\%, compared to a baseline encoder-only score of 32.83\%, demonstrating that instruction-tuned LLMs with structured prompting and ensemble strategies substantially outperform generic architectures. However, the gap to perfect performance indicates that hallucination detection remains a challenging problem, particularly for intrinsic (contradiction-based) hallucinations. This work establishes a rigorous benchmark and explores a diverse range of detection methodologies, providing a foundation for future research into the trustworthiness and reliability of Vietnamese language AI systems.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了 DSC2025 ViHallu 挑战赛，这是第一个大规模的越南语大语言模型幻觉检测共享任务，并发布了包含 10,000 个样本的 ViHallu 数据集，用于评估模型在不同类型幻觉（无幻觉、内在幻觉、外在幻觉）和提示类型（事实、噪声、对抗性）下的鲁棒性。比赛结果显示，经过指令微调的大语言模型结合结构化提示和集成策略，在幻觉检测方面取得了显著进步，但内在幻觉仍然是难点。
AI.motivation: 现有针对大语言模型幻觉的检测研究主要集中在英语，而越南语等低资源语言缺乏标准化的评估框架，这阻碍了该领域在这些语言上的发展和应用。
AI.method: 作者构建了 ViHallu 数据集，包含 10,000 个（上下文、提示、响应）三元组，并将其划分为无幻觉、内在幻觉和外在幻觉三类，同时引入了事实、噪声和对抗性三种提示类型。基于此数据集，举办了 DSC2025 ViHallu 挑战赛，并分析了参赛团队的模型架构、提示策略和集成方法。
AI.result: 在 DSC2025 ViHallu 挑战赛中，表现最佳的系统达到了 84.80% 的宏 F1 分数，远超基线模型 32.83% 的分数。这表明指令微调 LLM、结构化提示和集成策略能够显著提升幻觉检测性能。然而，内在幻觉（特别是基于矛盾的幻觉）的检测仍然具有挑战性。
AI.conclusion: 本文通过建立 ViHallu 数据集和 DSC2025 ViHallu 挑战赛，为越南语大语言模型的幻觉检测提供了一个重要的基准，并展示了当前技术水平和未来研究方向。研究结果强调了指令微调、结构化提示和集成策略在提升幻觉检测能力方面的重要性，同时也指出了内在幻觉检测的持续挑战，为提高越南语 AI 系统的可信度和可靠性奠定了基础。

title: Bridging Temporal and Textual Modalities: A Multimodal Framework for Automated Cloud Failure Root Cause Analysis
summary: Root cause analysis in modern cloud infrastructure demands sophisticated understanding of heterogeneous data sources, particularly time-series performance metrics that involve core failure signatures. While large language models demonstrate remarkable capabilities in textual reasoning, their discrete token-based architecture creates fundamental incompatibilities with continuous numerical sequences exhibiting temporal dependencies. Current methodologies inadequately address this modality mismatch, constraining the potential of language model-driven automation in incident management workflows. This paper presents a multimodal diagnostic framework that harmonizes time-series representations with pretrained language model embedding spaces. Our approach contributes three technical advances: (1) a semantic compression technique that distills temporal segments into single-token abstractions while preserving pattern semantics, (2) an alignment encoder utilizing gated cross-attention to project time-series features into language model latent space, and (3) a retrieval-augmented diagnostic pipeline that synthesizes aligned embeddings with historical incident knowledge for expert-level failure attribution. Comprehensive evaluation across six cloud system benchmarks demonstrates that our framework achieves leading performance, reaching 48.75% diagnostic accuracy with notable improvements on scenarios involving compound failure modes. The results validate embedding-space alignment as an effective strategy for enabling language models to reason over multimodal telemetry data in production incident response contexts.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种多模态诊断框架，通过语义压缩和对齐编码器将时间序列数据映射到语言模型的嵌入空间，并结合检索增强的方法，以提高云基础设施根因分析的准确性。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型在处理时间序列等连续数值数据时存在模态不匹配的问题，限制了其在云基础设施事件管理中的应用。需要一种方法来弥合文本和时间序列数据之间的差距。
AI.method: 该框架包含三个关键技术：1. 语义压缩：将时间序列段转化为单令牌抽象，保留模式语义。2. 对齐编码器：使用门控交叉注意力将时间序列特征映射到语言模型的潜在空间。3. 检索增强诊断管道：将对齐后的嵌入与历史事件知识结合，进行故障归因。
AI.result: 在六个云系统基准测试中，该框架达到了48.75%的诊断准确率，特别是在处理复合故障模式时表现出显著的改进。
AI.conclusion: 将嵌入空间对齐是一种有效的方法，可以使语言模型在生产环境事件响应中对多模态遥测数据进行推理，从而实现更智能的自动化。

title: OceanSplat: Object-aware Gaussian Splatting with Trinocular View Consistency for Underwater Scene Reconstruction
comment: Accepted to AAAI 2026. Project page: https://oceansplat.github.io
summary: We introduce OceanSplat, a novel 3D Gaussian Splatting-based approach for accurately representing 3D geometry in underwater scenes. To overcome multi-view inconsistencies caused by underwater optical degradation, our method enforces trinocular view consistency by rendering horizontally and vertically translated camera views relative to each input view and aligning them via inverse warping. Furthermore, these translated camera views are used to derive a synthetic epipolar depth prior through triangulation, which serves as a self-supervised depth regularizer. These geometric constraints facilitate the spatial optimization of 3D Gaussians and preserve scene structure in underwater environments. We also propose a depth-aware alpha adjustment that modulates the opacity of 3D Gaussians during early training based on their $z$-component and viewing direction, deterring the formation of medium-induced primitives. With our contributions, 3D Gaussians are disentangled from the scattering medium, enabling robust representation of object geometry and significantly reducing floating artifacts in reconstructed underwater scenes. Experiments on real-world underwater and simulated scenes demonstrate that OceanSplat substantially outperforms existing methods for both scene reconstruction and restoration in scattering media.

AI.tldr: OceanSplat是一种基于3D高斯泼溅的水下三维场景表示方法，通过引入三视点一致性和合成视差深度先验，有效解决了水下光学退化问题，提高了重建精度并减少了伪影。
AI.motivation: 水下场景由于光学退化（如散射、吸收）导致多视图不一致，现有的三维重建方法难以准确表示水下场景的几何结构并存在伪影。
AI.method: 提出OceanSplat方法，利用3D高斯泼溅技术，通过强制三视点一致性（水平和垂直平移视角）并结合逆向扭曲进行对齐，推导出合成视差深度先验作为自监督深度正则化项。同时，引入深度感知alpha调整策略，根据高斯点Z分量和视角调整不透明度，抑制介质引起的原始数据生成。
AI.result: OceanSplat成功将3D高斯泼溅从散射介质中解耦，实现了对物体几何结构的鲁棒表示，显著减少了水下重建场景中的浮动伪影。在真实水下和模拟场景的实验中，OceanSplat在场景重建和散射介质恢复方面均优于现有方法。
AI.conclusion: OceanSplat是一种有效的水下三维场景表示方法，通过创新的多视图一致性和深度约束技术，克服了水下光学退化的挑战，能够鲁棒地重建几何结构并减少伪影，在水下三维重建和恢复任务中展现出卓越性能。

title: Qwen3-VL-Embedding and Qwen3-VL-Reranker: A Unified Framework for State-of-the-Art Multimodal Retrieval and Ranking
summary: In this report, we introduce the Qwen3-VL-Embedding and Qwen3-VL-Reranker model series, the latest extensions of the Qwen family built on the Qwen3-VL foundation model. Together, they provide an end-to-end pipeline for high-precision multimodal search by mapping diverse modalities, including text, images, document images, and video, into a unified representation space. The Qwen3-VL-Embedding model employs a multi-stage training paradigm, progressing from large-scale contrastive pre-training to reranking model distillation, to generate semantically rich high-dimensional vectors. It supports Matryoshka Representation Learning, enabling flexible embedding dimensions, and handles inputs up to 32k tokens. Complementing this, Qwen3-VL-Reranker performs fine-grained relevance estimation for query-document pairs using a cross-encoder architecture with cross-attention mechanisms. Both model series inherit the multilingual capabilities of Qwen3-VL, supporting more than 30 languages, and are released in $\textbf{2B}$ and $\textbf{8B}$ parameter sizes to accommodate diverse deployment requirements. Empirical evaluations demonstrate that the Qwen3-VL-Embedding series achieves state-of-the-art results across diverse multimodal embedding evaluation benchmarks. Specifically, Qwen3-VL-Embedding-8B attains an overall score of $\textbf{77.8}$ on MMEB-V2, ranking first among all models (as of January 8, 2025). This report presents the architecture, training methodology, and practical capabilities of the series, demonstrating their effectiveness on various multimodal retrieval tasks, including image-text retrieval, visual question answering, and video-text matching.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了Qwen3-VL-Embedding和Qwen3-VL-Reranker模型系列，提供了一个端到端的解决方案，用于高精度的多模态搜索，支持文本、图像、文档图像和视频等多种模态，并将它们映射到统一的表示空间。
AI.motivation: 为了实现对文本、图像、文档图像和视频等多种模态的高精度多模态搜索，并提供一个统一的表示空间。
AI.method: Qwen3-VL-Embedding模型采用多阶段训练范式，包括大规模对比预训练和重排序模型蒸馏，支持Matryoshka表示学习，可灵活调整嵌入维度，并能处理长达32k token的输入。Qwen3-VL-Reranker模型使用交叉编码器架构和交叉注意力机制，对查询-文档对进行细粒度相关性估计。
AI.result: Qwen3-VL-Embedding系列在各种多模态嵌入评估基准上取得了最先进的结果，其中Qwen3-VL-Embedding-8B在MMEB-V2上获得77.8分的总体分数，位居所有模型第一（截至2025年1月8日）。
AI.conclusion: Qwen3-VL-Embedding和Qwen3-VL-Reranker模型系列能够有效地处理多种模态，并在图像-文本检索、视觉问答和视频-文本匹配等多种多模态检索任务中表现出色，它们支持超过30种语言，并提供2B和8B参数版本以满足不同部署需求。

title: Memory Matters More: Event-Centric Memory as a Logic Map for Agent Searching and Reasoning
summary: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed as intelligent agents that reason, plan, and interact with their environments. To effectively scale to long-horizon scenarios, a key capability for such agents is a memory mechanism that can retain, organize, and retrieve past experiences to support downstream decision-making. However, most existing approaches organize and store memories in a flat manner and rely on simple similarity-based retrieval techniques. Even when structured memory is introduced, existing methods often struggle to explicitly capture the logical relationships among experiences or memory units. Moreover, memory access is largely detached from the constructed structure and still depends on shallow semantic retrieval, preventing agents from reasoning logically over long-horizon dependencies. In this work, we propose CompassMem, an event-centric memory framework inspired by Event Segmentation Theory. CompassMem organizes memory as an Event Graph by incrementally segmenting experiences into events and linking them through explicit logical relations. This graph serves as a logic map, enabling agents to perform structured and goal-directed navigation over memory beyond superficial retrieval, progressively gathering valuable memories to support long-horizon reasoning. Experiments on LoCoMo and NarrativeQA demonstrate that CompassMem consistently improves both retrieval and reasoning performance across multiple backbone models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为CompassMem的事件中心记忆框架，该框架通过事件图谱组织记忆，并利用事件分割理论来捕捉经验之间的逻辑关系，从而实现结构化、目标导向的记忆导航，提升了长时序推理能力。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型智能体在处理长时序场景时，内存机制存在不足，难以有效保留、组织和检索过去的经验，并且在捕捉经验间的逻辑关系以及利用结构化记忆进行逻辑推理方面存在挑战。
AI.method: CompassMem将记忆组织成一个事件图谱（Event Graph），通过增量地将经验分割成事件，并通过明确的逻辑关系将它们连接起来。该图谱充当逻辑地图，允许智能体在记忆中进行结构化、目标导向的导航，超越浅层语义检索。
AI.result: 在LoCoMo和NarrativeQA数据集上的实验表明，CompassMem能够持续提升不同骨干模型在记忆检索和推理方面的性能。
AI.conclusion: CompassMem通过构建事件图谱并利用事件分割理论，有效解决了现有记忆机制在长时序推理和逻辑关系捕捉方面的局限性，为智能体提供了更强大的记忆和推理能力。

title: Patch-based Representation and Learning for Efficient Deformation Modeling
summary: In this paper, we present a patch-based representation of surfaces, PolyFit, which is obtained by fitting jet functions locally on surface patches. Such a representation can be learned efficiently in a supervised fashion from both analytic functions and real data. Once learned, it can be generalized to various types of surfaces. Using PolyFit, the surfaces can be efficiently deformed by updating a compact set of jet coefficients rather than optimizing per-vertex degrees of freedom for many downstream tasks in computer vision and graphics. We demonstrate the capabilities of our proposed methodologies with two applications: 1) Shape-from-template (SfT): where the goal is to deform the input 3D template of an object as seen in image/video. Using PolyFit, we adopt test-time optimization that delivers competitive accuracy while being markedly faster than offline physics-based solvers, and outperforms recent physics-guided neural simulators in accuracy at modest additional runtime. 2) Garment draping. We train a self-supervised, mesh- and garment-agnostic model that generalizes across resolutions and garment types, delivering up to an order-of-magnitude faster inference than strong baselines.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于局部曲面块上喷射函数拟合的曲面表示方法PolyFit，该方法可以从分析函数和真实数据中高效学习，并能泛化到不同类型的曲面。PolyFit允许通过更新少量喷射系数来高效变形曲面，适用于计算机视觉和图形学的多种下游任务。在形状模板重建（SfT）和服装仿真任务中，PolyFit均取得了优于现有方法的性能。
AI.motivation: 传统的曲面表示方法在变形和处理大规模数据时效率低下。研究者希望开发一种新的曲面表示方法，能够高效地学习、泛化和变形，以应用于计算机视觉和图形学的下游任务。
AI.method: 本文提出了一种名为PolyFit的patch-based曲面表示方法，通过在曲面块上局部拟合喷射函数来获得。该表示方法可以通过监督学习从分析函数和真实数据中学习，并能泛化到不同类型的曲面。曲面变形通过更新紧凑的喷射系数集合来实现。在Shape-from-template（SfT）任务中，使用test-time优化；在服装仿真任务中，训练了一个自监督、网格无关且服装无关的模型。
AI.result: PolyFit在SfT任务中，变形速度比基于物理的求解器快，精度不相上下，并且在精度上优于近期基于物理的神经模拟器。在服装仿真任务中，PolyFit的推理速度比现有基线快一个数量级，并且能够泛化到不同分辨率和服装类型。
AI.conclusion: PolyFit是一种高效的曲面表示方法，能够从数据中学习并泛化，通过更新少量参数实现高效变形，在形状模板重建和服装仿真等任务中展现出优越的性能和效率。

title: Automatic Classifiers Underdetect Emotions Expressed by Men
summary: The widespread adoption of automatic sentiment and emotion classifiers makes it important to ensure that these tools perform reliably across different populations. Yet their reliability is typically assessed using benchmarks that rely on third-party annotators rather than the individuals experiencing the emotions themselves, potentially concealing systematic biases. In this paper, we use a unique, large-scale dataset of more than one million self-annotated posts and a pre-registered research design to investigate gender biases in emotion detection across 414 combinations of models and emotion-related classes. We find that across different types of automatic classifiers and various underlying emotions, error rates are consistently higher for texts authored by men compared to those authored by women. We quantify how this bias could affect results in downstream applications and show that current machine learning tools, including large language models, should be applied with caution when the gender composition of a sample is not known or variable. Our findings demonstrate that sentiment analysis is not yet a solved problem, especially in ensuring equitable model behaviour across demographic groups.

AI.tldr: 研究发现，现有的自动情感和情绪分类器在处理男性作者的文本时，错误率普遍高于女性作者，即使是大型语言模型也存在这种性别偏见，因此在应用这些工具时需谨慎。
AI.motivation: 现有情感和情绪分类器评估方法依赖第三方标注，可能隐藏系统性偏见，亟需确保其在不同人群中的可靠性。
AI.method: 使用包含超过一百万条自我标注帖文的大型数据集，采用预注册的研究设计，分析了414种模型与情绪类别组合中的性别偏见。
AI.result: 在不同类型的自动分类器和各种情绪下，男性作者文本的错误率始终高于女性作者。这种偏见可能影响下游应用结果。
AI.conclusion: 当前机器学习工具（包括大型语言模型）在性别构成未知或可变的情况下应谨慎使用，情感分析并非已解决问题，尤其是在确保跨群体模型的公平性方面。

title: Miner:Mining Intrinsic Mastery for Data-Efficient RL in Large Reasoning Models
summary: Current critic-free RL methods for large reasoning models suffer from severe inefficiency when training on positive homogeneous prompts (where all rollouts are correct), resulting in waste of rollouts due to zero advantage estimates. We introduce a radically simple yet powerful solution to \uline{M}ine \uline{in}trinsic mast\uline{er}y (Miner), that repurposes the policy's intrinsic uncertainty as a self-supervised reward signal, with no external supervision, auxiliary models, or additional inference cost. Our method pioneers two key innovations: (1) a token-level focal credit assignment mechanism that dynamically amplifies gradients on critical uncertain tokens while suppressing overconfident ones, and (2) adaptive advantage calibration to seamlessly integrate intrinsic and verifiable rewards. Evaluated across six reasoning benchmarks on Qwen3-4B and Qwen3-8B base models, Miner achieves state-of-the-art performance among the other four algorithms, yielding up to \textbf{4.58} absolute gains in Pass@1 and \textbf{6.66} gains in Pass@K compared to GRPO. Comparison with other methods targeted at exploration enhancement further discloses the superiority of the two newly proposed innovations. This demonstrates that latent uncertainty exploitation is both necessary and sufficient for efficient and scalable RL training of reasoning models.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 Miner 的新方法，通过利用策略的内在不确定性作为自监督奖励信号，来解决当前免评估器 RL 方法在训练大型推理模型时效率低下的问题，并在多个推理基准上取得了最先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 当前免评估器 RL 方法在处理正向同质提示时效率低下，导致优势估计为零，浪费了大量样本。研究旨在提高训练效率。
AI.method: Miner 方法通过两个关键创新解决效率问题：1) 令牌级焦点信用分配机制，动态增强不确定令牌的梯度；2) 自适应优势校准，无缝集成内在奖励和可验证奖励。该方法不依赖外部监督、辅助模型或额外的推理成本。
AI.result: 在 Qwen3-4B 和 Qwen3-8B 模型上，Miner 在六个推理基准上表现优异，Pass@1 提升高达 4.58，Pass@K 提升高达 6.66，优于 GRPO 等其他算法。该方法证明了利用潜在不确定性对于高效可扩展的推理模型 RL 训练是必要且充分的。
AI.conclusion: Miner 方法通过利用内在不确定性作为奖励信号，显著提高了大型推理模型的 RL 训练效率，并在多个基准上实现了最先进的性能，证明了该方法的有效性和必要性。

title: AM$^3$Safety: Towards Data Efficient Alignment of Multi-modal Multi-turn Safety for MLLMs
summary: Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs) are increasingly deployed in interactive applications. However, their safety vulnerabilities become pronounced in multi-turn multi-modal scenarios, where harmful intent can be gradually reconstructed across turns, and security protocols fade into oblivion as the conversation progresses. Existing Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) alignment methods are largely developed for single-turn visual question-answer (VQA) task and often require costly manual preference annotations, limiting their effectiveness and scalability in dialogues. To address this challenge, we present InterSafe-V, an open-source multi-modal dialogue dataset containing 11,270 dialogues and 500 specially designed refusal VQA samples. This dataset, constructed through interaction between several models, is designed to more accurately reflect real-world scenarios and includes specialized VQA pairs tailored for specific domains. Building on this dataset, we propose AM$^3$Safety, a framework that combines a cold-start refusal phase with Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) fine-tuning using turn-aware dual-objective rewards across entire dialogues. Experiments on Qwen2.5-VL-7B-Instruct and LLaVA-NeXT-7B show more than 10\% decrease in Attack Success Rate (ASR) together with an increment of at least 8\% in harmless dimension and over 13\% in helpful dimension of MLLMs on multi-modal multi-turn safety benchmarks, while preserving their general abilities.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 InterSafe-V 的多模态对话数据集和 AM³Safety 框架，用于解决多轮多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）在交互式应用中的安全漏洞问题。AM³Safety 结合了冷启动拒绝阶段和基于 GRPO 的微调，通过对话级别的双目标奖励来提升模型的安全性和有用性。
AI.motivation: 现有的 RLHF 对齐方法主要针对单轮 VQA 任务，成本高且在多轮对话中效果不佳，难以解决 MLLMs 在多轮多模态交互中逐渐暴露的安全漏洞。
AI.method: 构建了包含 11,270 个对话和 500 个拒绝 VQA 样本的多模态对话数据集 InterSafe-V。提出了 AM³Safety 框架，包含冷启动拒绝阶段和使用 GRPO 结合对话级别双目标奖励的微调。
AI.result: 在 Qwen2.5-VL-7B-Instruct 和 LLaVA-NeXT-7B 模型上，AM³Safety 将多模态多轮安全基准的攻击成功率（ASR）降低了 10% 以上，同时将模型的无害性维度提高了 8%，有用性维度提高了 13%，并保持了模型的通用能力。
AI.conclusion: AM³Safety 框架和 InterSafe-V 数据集能够有效提升 MLLMs 在多轮多模态对话中的安全性，同时保持其原有能力，为解决 MLLMs 的安全问题提供了一种可扩展的解决方案。

title: From Understanding to Engagement: Personalized pharmacy Video Clips via Vision Language Models (VLMs)
comment: Contributed original research to top tier conference in VLM; currently undergoing peer review
summary:
Vision Language Models (VLMs) are poised to revolutionize the digital transformation of pharmacyceutical industry by enabling intelligent, scalable, and automated multi-modality content processing. Traditional manual annotation of heterogeneous data modalities (text, images, video, audio, and web links), is prone to inconsistencies, quality degradation, and inefficiencies in content utilization. The sheer volume of long video and audio data further exacerbates these challenges, (e.g. long clinical trial interviews and educational seminars).
  Here, we introduce a domain adapted Video to Video Clip Generation framework that integrates Audio Language Models (ALMs) and Vision Language Models (VLMs) to produce highlight clips. Our contributions are threefold: (i) a reproducible Cut & Merge algorithm with fade in/out and timestamp normalization, ensuring smooth transitions and audio/visual alignment; (ii) a personalization mechanism based on role definition and prompt injection for tailored outputs (marketing, training, regulatory); (iii) a cost efficient e2e pipeline strategy balancing ALM/VLM enhanced processing. Evaluations on Video MME benchmark (900) and our proprietary dataset of 16,159 pharmacy videos across 14 disease areas demonstrate 3 to 4 times speedup, 4 times cost reduction, and competitive clip quality. Beyond efficiency gains, we also report our methods improved clip coherence scores (0.348) and informativeness scores (0.721) over state of the art VLM baselines (e.g., Gemini 2.5 Pro), highlighting the potential of transparent, custom extractive, and compliance supporting video summarization for life sciences.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一个结合音频语言模型（ALM）和视觉语言模型（VLM）的视频到视频剪辑生成框架，用于自动化处理制药行业的长视频内容，以生成摘要剪辑。该框架通过可复现的剪辑合并算法、基于角色定义的个性化机制以及成本效益的端到端流水线策略，在效率和剪辑质量上均优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 传统制药行业的多模态内容（文本、图像、视频、音频等）手动标注效率低下、易出错且难以充分利用，特别是对于长视频和音频数据。这阻碍了数字化转型和自动化内容处理。
AI.method: 1. 开发了一个可复现的“剪辑与合并”（Cut & Merge）算法，包含淡入/淡出和时间戳归一化，以确保音频和视觉的平滑对齐。 2. 引入了一个基于角色定义和提示注入的个性化机制，以生成满足不同需求（营销、培训、法规）的定制化剪辑。 3. 采用了一种成本效益高的端到端流水线策略，优化了 ALM/VLM 的处理流程。
AI.result: 在 Video MME 基准（900 个视频）和专有数据集（16,159 个制药视频）上进行评估，该框架实现了 3-4 倍的速度提升和 4 倍的成本降低。在剪辑质量方面，该方法在剪辑连贯性得分（0.348）和信息性得分（0.721）上优于包括 Gemini 2.5 Pro 在内的现有 VLM 基线。
AI.conclusion: 该研究提出的视频到视频剪辑生成框架有效地解决了制药行业长视频内容处理的挑战，通过自动化和个性化摘要生成，显著提高了效率和成本效益，并产生了高质量、高信息量的剪辑，为生命科学领域的视频摘要提供了透明、定制化且合规的解决方案。

title: ThinkDrive: Chain-of-Thought Guided Progressive Reinforcement Learning Fine-Tuning for Autonomous Driving
summary: With the rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) technologies, their application in the domain of autonomous driving has become increasingly widespread. However, existing methods suffer from unstructured reasoning, poor generalization, and misalignment with human driving intent. While Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning enhances decision transparency, conventional supervised fine-tuning (SFT) fails to fully exploit its potential, and reinforcement learning (RL) approaches face instability and suboptimal reasoning depth. We propose ThinkDrive, a CoT guided progressive RL fine-tuning framework for autonomous driving that synergizes explicit reasoning with difficulty-aware adaptive policy optimization. Our method employs a two-stage training strategy. First, we perform SFT using CoT explanations. Then, we apply progressive RL with a difficulty-aware adaptive policy optimizer that dynamically adjusts learning intensity based on sample complexity. We evaluate our approach on a public dataset. The results show that ThinkDrive outperforms strong RL baselines by 1.45%, 1.95%, and 1.01% on exam, easy-exam, and accuracy, respectively. Moreover, a 2B-parameter model trained with our method surpasses the much larger GPT-4o by 3.28% on the exam metric.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为ThinkDrive的框架，通过结合链式思考（CoT）推理和强化学习（RL）来改进自动驾驶中的决策，克服了现有方法的局限性，并在实验中取得了优于基线模型和GPT-4o的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有自动驾驶LLM方法存在推理不结构化、泛化能力差以及与人类驾驶意图不一致等问题。CoT推理虽然提高了决策透明度，但SFT未能充分利用其潜力，而RL方法存在不稳定和推理深度不足的问题。
AI.method: 提出ThinkDrive框架，采用两阶段训练策略：1. 使用CoT解释进行监督微调（SFT）；2. 应用渐进式RL，结合难度感知自适应策略优化器，根据样本复杂度动态调整学习强度。
AI.result: 在公开数据集上，ThinkDrive在exam、easy-exam和accuracy指标上分别比强RL基线模型高出1.45%、1.95%和1.01%。经过ThinkDrive训练的2B参数模型在exam指标上比GPT-4o高出3.28%。
AI.conclusion: ThinkDrive通过CoT指导的渐进式RL框架，成功地将显式推理与难度感知策略优化相结合，显著提升了自动驾驶的性能，并展现出超越大型商业模型的潜力。

title: From Rays to Projections: Better Inputs for Feed-Forward View Synthesis
summary: Feed-forward view synthesis models predict a novel view in a single pass with minimal 3D inductive bias. Existing works encode cameras as Plücker ray maps, which tie predictions to the arbitrary world coordinate gauge and make them sensitive to small camera transformations, thereby undermining geometric consistency. In this paper, we ask what inputs best condition a model for robust and consistent view synthesis. We propose projective conditioning, which replaces raw camera parameters with a target-view projective cue that provides a stable 2D input. This reframes the task from a brittle geometric regression problem in ray space to a well-conditioned target-view image-to-image translation problem. Additionally, we introduce a masked autoencoding pretraining strategy tailored to this cue, enabling the use of large-scale uncalibrated data for pretraining. Our method shows improved fidelity and stronger cross-view consistency compared to ray-conditioned baselines on our view-consistency benchmark. It also achieves state-of-the-art quality on standard novel view synthesis benchmarks.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新的条件化方法——投影条件化，用于前馈式视图合成，以取代现有的基于射线图的方法，从而提高几何一致性和鲁棒性，并通过掩码自编码进行预训练。
AI.motivation: 现有的前馈式视图合成模型使用射线图编码相机，这使得预测对任意世界坐标系和相机变换敏感，影响了几何一致性。研究动机是寻找能提高鲁棒性和一致性的输入条件化方法。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为“投影条件化”的新方法，用目标视图的投影线索（一种稳定的2D输入）取代原始相机参数。将任务从射线空间中的几何回归问题转变为图像到图像的翻译问题。此外，引入了一种针对该线索的掩码自编码预训练策略，可以使用大规模未校准数据进行预训练。
AI.result: 与基于射线条件化的基线方法相比，该方法在视图一致性基准测试中表现出更高的保真度和更强的跨视图一致性。在标准的视图合成基准测试上也达到了最先进的质量。
AI.conclusion: 投影条件化是一种比射线条件化更优越的条件化方法，能够显著提高前馈式视图合成的几何一致性和鲁棒性，并且可以通过掩码自编码预训练进一步提升性能。

title: RiskAtlas: Exposing Domain-Specific Risks in LLMs through Knowledge-Graph-Guided Harmful Prompt Generation
summary: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly applied in specialized domains such as finance and healthcare, where they introduce unique safety risks. Domain-specific datasets of harmful prompts remain scarce and still largely rely on manual construction; public datasets mainly focus on explicit harmful prompts, which modern LLM defenses can often detect and refuse. In contrast, implicit harmful prompts-expressed through indirect domain knowledge-are harder to detect and better reflect real-world threats. We identify two challenges: transforming domain knowledge into actionable constraints and increasing the implicitness of generated harmful prompts. To address them, we propose an end-to-end framework that first performs knowledge-graph-guided harmful prompt generation to systematically produce domain-relevant prompts, and then applies dual-path obfuscation rewriting to convert explicit harmful prompts into implicit variants via direct and context-enhanced rewriting. This framework yields high-quality datasets combining strong domain relevance with implicitness, enabling more realistic red-teaming and advancing LLM safety research. We release our code and datasets at GitHub.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种端到端的框架，利用知识图谱生成领域相关的有害提示，并通过双路径混淆重写技术将其转换为隐式有害提示，以提升大型语言模型的安全性。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLMs）在金融和医疗等专业领域的应用带来了新的安全风险。然而，专门用于检测这些领域有害提示的数据集稀缺，且公开数据集主要关注显式有害提示，容易被LLM防御机制检测。与此相反，通过领域知识间接表达的隐式有害提示更难检测，也更能反映现实世界中的威胁。
AI.method: 该框架首先利用知识图谱指导有害提示的生成，以系统性地产生领域相关的提示。随后，采用双路径混淆重写技术，通过直接重写和上下文增强重写，将显式有害提示转化为隐式变体。
AI.result: 该框架能够生成高质量的数据集，这些数据集兼具领域相关性和隐式性，能够用于更现实的红队测试，从而推动LLM安全研究的进展。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的框架为生成领域相关的隐式有害提示提供了有效的方法，有助于构建更具挑战性的数据集，从而改进LLM在关键领域的安全性评估和防御能力。

title: UniLiPs: Unified LiDAR Pseudo-Labeling with Geometry-Grounded Dynamic Scene Decomposition
summary: Unlabeled LiDAR logs, in autonomous driving applications, are inherently a gold mine of dense 3D geometry hiding in plain sight - yet they are almost useless without human labels, highlighting a dominant cost barrier for autonomous-perception research. In this work we tackle this bottleneck by leveraging temporal-geometric consistency across LiDAR sweeps to lift and fuse cues from text and 2D vision foundation models directly into 3D, without any manual input. We introduce an unsupervised multi-modal pseudo-labeling method relying on strong geometric priors learned from temporally accumulated LiDAR maps, alongside with a novel iterative update rule that enforces joint geometric-semantic consistency, and vice-versa detecting moving objects from inconsistencies. Our method simultaneously produces 3D semantic labels, 3D bounding boxes, and dense LiDAR scans, demonstrating robust generalization across three datasets. We experimentally validate that our method compares favorably to existing semantic segmentation and object detection pseudo-labeling methods, which often require additional manual supervision. We confirm that even a small fraction of our geometrically consistent, densified LiDAR improves depth prediction by 51.5% and 22.0% MAE in the 80-150 and 150-250 meters range, respectively.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种无监督的多模态伪标签方法，利用激光雷达数据的时间几何一致性，将文本和2D视觉基础模型的线索直接融合到3D中，无需人工标注，从而生成3D语义标签、3D边界框和密集点云数据。
AI.motivation: 自动驾驶应用中的未标注激光雷达数据蕴含丰富的3D几何信息，但由于缺乏人工标注而难以利用，这构成了自动驾驶感知研究的主要成本障碍。
AI.method: 研究提出了一种无监督的多模态伪标签方法，该方法依赖于从时间累积的激光雷达地图中学习到的强大几何先验，并结合新颖的迭代更新规则，强制执行联合的几何-语义一致性，反之亦然，通过不一致性检测移动物体。
AI.result: 该方法能够同时生成3D语义标签、3D边界框和密集的激光雷达扫描，并在三个数据集上表现出鲁棒的泛化能力。与需要额外人工监督的现有语义分割和对象检测伪标签方法相比，该方法表现更优。此外，少量几何一致且密集化的激光雷达数据能显著提高深度预测精度，在80-150米和150-250米范围内，MAE分别降低了51.5%和22.0%。
AI.conclusion: 该方法成功解决了未标注激光雷达数据的使用瓶颈，通过无监督的多模态融合生成高质量的3D感知数据，并显著提升了深度预测性能。

title: KnowMe-Bench: Benchmarking Person Understanding for Lifelong Digital Companions
summary: Existing long-horizon memory benchmarks mostly use multi-turn dialogues or synthetic user histories, which makes retrieval performance an imperfect proxy for person understanding. We present \BenchName, a publicly releasable benchmark built from long-form autobiographical narratives, where actions, context, and inner thoughts provide dense evidence for inferring stable motivations and decision principles. \BenchName~reconstructs each narrative into a flashback-aware, time-anchored stream and evaluates models with evidence-linked questions spanning factual recall, subjective state attribution, and principle-level reasoning. Across diverse narrative sources, retrieval-augmented systems mainly improve factual accuracy, while errors persist on temporally grounded explanations and higher-level inferences, highlighting the need for memory mechanisms beyond retrieval. Our data is in \href{KnowMeBench}{https://github.com/QuantaAlpha/KnowMeBench}.

title: Tool-MAD: A Multi-Agent Debate Framework for Fact Verification with Diverse Tool Augmentation and Adaptive Retrieval
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) suffer from hallucinations and factual inaccuracies, especially in complex reasoning and fact verification tasks. Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) systems aim to improve answer accuracy by enabling multiple LLM agents to engage in dialogue, promoting diverse reasoning and mutual verification. However, existing MAD frameworks primarily rely on internal knowledge or static documents, making them vulnerable to hallucinations. While MADKE introduces external evidence to mitigate this, its one-time retrieval mechanism limits adaptability to new arguments or emerging information during the debate. To address these limitations, We propose Tool-MAD, a multi-agent debate framework that enhances factual verification by assigning each agent a distinct external tool, such as a search API or RAG module. Tool-MAD introduces three key innovations: (1) a multi-agent debate framework where agents leverage heterogeneous external tools, encouraging diverse perspectives, (2) an adaptive query formulation mechanism that iteratively refines evidence retrieval based on the flow of the debate, and (3) the integration of Faithfulness and Answer Relevance scores into the final decision process, allowing the Judge agent to quantitatively assess the coherence and question alignment of each response and effectively detect hallucinations. Experimental results on four fact verification benchmarks demonstrate that Tool-MAD consistently outperforms state-of-the-art MAD frameworks, achieving up to 5.5% accuracy improvement. Furthermore, in medically specialized domains, Tool-MAD exhibits strong robustness and adaptability across various tool configurations and domain conditions, confirming its potential for broader real-world fact-checking applications.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 Tool-MAD 的多智能体辩论框架，通过为每个智能体分配不同的外部工具（如搜索 API 或 RAG 模块），并引入自适应查询和忠实度/相关性评分，以提高事实验证的准确性，实验结果显示在事实验证基准测试中优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型在复杂推理和事实核查任务中存在幻觉和事实不准确的问题。现有的多智能体辩论（MAD）系统虽然引入了外部证据，但其一次性检索机制在应对辩论中出现的新论点或信息时不够灵活。
AI.method: 提出 Tool-MAD 框架，其特点包括：1）多智能体辩论，智能体使用异构外部工具以获得不同视角；2）自适应查询机制，根据辩论流程迭代优化证据检索；3）将忠实度和答案相关性评分纳入最终决策，以便审判智能体量化评估响应的连贯性和与问题的匹配度，从而有效检测幻觉。
AI.result: 在四个事实验证基准测试中，Tool-MAD 的准确性持续优于最先进的 MAD 框架，最高可提高 5.5%。在医学专业领域，Tool-MAD 在不同工具配置和领域条件下表现出强大的鲁棒性和适应性。
AI.conclusion: Tool-MAD 通过利用异构外部工具、自适应证据检索以及量化评估指标，显著提高了多智能体辩论在事实验证任务中的准确性和鲁棒性，证明了其在现实世界事实核查应用中的潜力。

title: Re-Align: Structured Reasoning-guided Alignment for In-Context Image Generation and Editing
summary: In-context image generation and editing (ICGE) enables users to specify visual concepts through interleaved image-text prompts, demanding precise understanding and faithful execution of user intent. Although recent unified multimodal models exhibit promising understanding capabilities, these strengths often fail to transfer effectively to image generation. We introduce Re-Align, a unified framework that bridges the gap between understanding and generation through structured reasoning-guided alignment. At its core lies the In-Context Chain-of-Thought (IC-CoT), a structured reasoning paradigm that decouples semantic guidance and reference association, providing clear textual target and mitigating confusion among reference images. Furthermore, Re-Align introduces an effective RL training scheme that leverages a surrogate reward to measure the alignment between structured reasoning text and the generated image, thereby improving the model's overall performance on ICGE tasks. Extensive experiments verify that Re-Align outperforms competitive methods of comparable model scale and resources on both in-context image generation and editing tasks.

AI.tldr: Re-Align 是一个统一框架，通过结构化推理引导的对齐来弥合理解与生成之间的差距，用于上下文图像生成和编辑。它使用 IC-CoT 来分离语义指导和参考关联，并结合 RL 训练方案来提高模型性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的统一多模态模型在理解用户意图方面表现良好，但在图像生成方面表现不佳。需要一种方法来有效地将理解能力转化为图像生成能力。
AI.method: 提出 Re-Align 框架，核心是 In-Context Chain-of-Thought (IC-CoT)，这是一种结构化推理范式，可以解耦语义指导和参考关联。此外，还引入了一种基于代理奖励的 RL 训练方案，用于衡量结构化推理文本与生成图像之间的对齐程度。
AI.result: Re-Align 在上下文图像生成和编辑任务上，在同等模型规模和资源下，表现优于现有的竞争方法。
AI.conclusion: Re-Align 通过结构化推理和对齐，有效地解决了上下文图像生成和编辑中的理解到生成的鸿沟，显著提高了模型性能。

title: Higher-Order Adversarial Patches for Real-Time Object Detectors
summary: Higher-order adversarial attacks can directly be considered the result of a cat-and-mouse game -- an elaborate action involving constant pursuit, near captures, and repeated escapes. This idiom describes the enduring circular training of adversarial attack patterns and adversarial training the best. The following work investigates the impact of higher-order adversarial attacks on object detectors by successively training attack patterns and hardening object detectors with adversarial training. The YOLOv10 object detector is chosen as a representative, and adversarial patches are used in an evasion attack manner. Our results indicate that higher-order adversarial patches are not only affecting the object detector directly trained on but rather provide a stronger generalization capacity compared to lower-order adversarial patches. Moreover, the results highlight that solely adversarial training is not sufficient to harden an object detector efficiently against this kind of adversarial attack. Code: https://github.com/JensBayer/HigherOrder

AI.tldr: 研究了高阶对抗性攻击对目标检测器的影响，发现高阶对抗性补丁比低阶补丁具有更强的泛化能力，但单独的对抗性训练不足以有效防御此类攻击。
AI.motivation: 高阶对抗性攻击与“猫捉老鼠”的游戏类似，研究其对目标检测器的影响及其防御方法。
AI.method: 使用YOLOv10目标检测器，通过连续训练攻击模式和使用对抗性训练来加强检测器，并使用对抗性补丁进行规避攻击。
AI.result: 高阶对抗性补丁不仅影响直接训练的检测器，而且比低阶对抗性补丁具有更强的泛化能力。单独的对抗性训练不足以有效防御此类攻击。
AI.conclusion: 高阶对抗性攻击对目标检测器有显著影响，其泛化能力强于低阶攻击，表明需要更有效的防御策略来应对高阶对抗性攻击。

title: When Single-Agent with Skills Replace Multi-Agent Systems and When They Fail
summary:
Multi-agent AI systems have proven effective for complex reasoning. These systems are compounded by specialized agents, which collaborate through explicit communication, but incur substantial computational overhead. A natural question arises: can we achieve similar modularity benefits with a single agent that selects from a library of skills? We explore this question by viewing skills as internalized agent behaviors. From this perspective, a multi-agent system can be compiled into an equivalent single-agent system, trading inter-agent communication for skill selection. Our preliminary experiments suggest this approach can substantially reduce token usage and latency while maintaining competitive accuracy on reasoning benchmarks. However, this efficiency raises a deeper question that has received little attention: how does skill selection scale as libraries grow?
  Drawing on principles from cognitive science, we propose that LLM skill selection exhibits bounded capacity analogous to human decision-making. We investigate the scaling behavior of skill selection and observe a striking pattern. Rather than degrading gradually, selection accuracy remains stable up to a critical library size, then drops sharply, indicating a phase transition reminiscent of capacity limits in human cognition. Furthermore, we find evidence that semantic confusability among similar skills, rather than library size alone, plays a central role in this degradation. This perspective suggests that hierarchical organization, which has long helped humans manage complex choices, may similarly benefit AI systems. Our initial results with hierarchical routing support this hypothesis. This work opens new questions about the fundamental limits of semantic-based skill selection in LLMs and offers a cognitive-grounded framework and practical guidelines for designing scalable skill-based agents.

AI.tldr: 研究提出将多智能体系统中的显式通信转化为单智能体内部的技能选择机制，以降低计算开销。发现技能选择存在类似人类认知的容量限制，当技能库规模超过临界点时，选择准确度会急剧下降，并且语义混淆是导致性能下降的关键因素。提出通过技能的层级化组织来缓解这一问题。
AI.motivation: 多智能体系统虽然擅长复杂推理，但其显式通信带来了高昂的计算成本。研究动机在于探索是否能通过单智能体选择内部技能库中的技能，来达到类似多智能体系统的模块化优势，同时降低计算开销。
AI.method: 将多智能体系统编译为等价的单智能体系统，用技能选择替代智能体间的通信。借鉴认知科学原理，将LLM的技能选择视为具有有界容量的决策过程。通过实验研究技能选择的扩展行为，分析语义混淆的影响，并初步探索了层级化组织策略。
AI.result: 初步实验表明，该方法在保持推理准确率的同时，能显著减少token使用量和延迟。研究发现LLM技能选择存在一个临界库大小，超过该大小后选择准确度会急剧下降，呈现类比人类认知的“相变”现象。语义混淆比库大小本身更能影响性能下降。层级化路由初步验证了通过组织化技能库可以提升性能。
AI.conclusion: 将多智能体通信转化为单智能体的技能选择是一种有效降低计算开销的策略。LLM的技能选择能力存在类比人类认知的容量限制，表现为临界库大小效应和语义混淆的影响。通过对技能进行层级化组织，有望提高技能选择的可扩展性，为设计可扩展的技能型AI代理提供了认知科学依据和实践指导。

title: Fame Fades, Nature Remains: Disentangling the Character Identity of Role-Playing Agents
summary: Despite the rapid proliferation of Role-Playing Agents (RPAs) based on Large Language Models (LLMs), the structural dimensions defining a character's identity remain weakly formalized, often treating characters as arbitrary text inputs. In this paper, we propose the concept of \textbf{Character Identity}, a multidimensional construct that disentangles a character into two distinct layers: \textbf{(1) Parametric Identity}, referring to character-specific knowledge encoded from the LLM's pre-training, and \textbf{(2) Attributive Identity}, capturing fine-grained behavioral properties such as personality traits and moral values. To systematically investigate these layers, we construct a unified character profile schema and generate both Famous and Synthetic characters under identical structural constraints. Our evaluation across single-turn and multi-turn interactions reveals two critical phenomena. First, we identify \textit{"Fame Fades"}: while famous characters hold a significant advantage in initial turns due to parametric knowledge, this edge rapidly vanishes as models prioritize accumulating conversational context over pre-trained priors. Second, we find that \textit{"Nature Remains"}: while models robustly portray general personality traits regardless of polarity, RPA performance is highly sensitive to the valence of morality and interpersonal relationships. Our findings pinpoint negative social natures as the primary bottleneck in RPA fidelity, guiding future character construction and evaluation.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了“角色身份”的概念，将其分为“参数身份”（LLM预训练知识）和“属性身份”（行为特征）。通过构建统一的角色档案模式，研究发现，虽然名人角色在初始对话中占优，但其优势会随着对话深入而消失（“名声渐失”），而角色的基本性格特征（“本性尚存”）则能被模型稳健地呈现，但模型的表现对道德和人际关系的极性非常敏感。负面的社会属性是当前RPA保真度的主要瓶颈。
AI.motivation: 现有基于LLM的角色扮演代理（RPAs）在定义角色身份时缺乏结构化，将角色视为任意文本输入。本研究旨在形式化地定义角色身份，并系统地研究其不同维度对RPA性能的影响。
AI.method: 提出“角色身份”概念，包含“参数身份”和“属性身份”两个层级。构建统一的角色档案模式，并生成名人角色和合成角色。通过单轮和多轮交互评估RPAs在不同角色身份下的表现。
AI.result: 识别出“名声渐失”现象：名人角色的参数身份优势在对话早期显著，但随着对话上下文的积累而迅速减弱。识别出“本性尚存”现象：模型能稳健地刻画一般性格特征，但对道德和人际关系的极性敏感。负面的社会属性是RPA保真度的主要限制因素。
AI.conclusion: 角色的身份可以通过参数身份和属性身份两个维度来理解。RPAs在处理具有负面社会属性的角色时存在挑战，这为未来的角色构建和评估提供了指导方向。

title: Orion-RAG: Path-Aligned Hybrid Retrieval for Graphless Data
summary: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has proven effective for knowledge synthesis, yet it encounters significant challenges in practical scenarios where data is inherently discrete and fragmented. In most environments, information is distributed across isolated files like reports and logs that lack explicit links. Standard search engines process files independently, ignoring the connections between them. Furthermore, manually building Knowledge Graphs is impractical for such vast data. To bridge this gap, we present Orion-RAG. Our core insight is simple yet effective: we do not need heavy algorithms to organize this data. Instead, we use a low-complexity strategy to extract lightweight paths that naturally link related concepts. We demonstrate that this streamlined approach suffices to transform fragmented documents into semi-structured data, enabling the system to link information across different files effectively. Extensive experiments demonstrate that Orion-RAG consistently outperforms mainstream frameworks across diverse domains, supporting real-time updates and explicit Human-in-the-Loop verification with high cost-efficiency. Experiments on FinanceBench demonstrate superior precision with a 25.2% relative improvement over strong baselines.

AI.tldr: Orion-RAG 是一种新的检索增强生成 (RAG) 方法，它通过提取低复杂度的轻量级路径来连接分散在孤立文件中的信息，从而有效处理离散和碎片化的数据，并在金融基准测试中取得了显著的性能提升。
