AI.motivation: 现有的 RAG 方法在处理数据离散、碎片化且缺乏显式链接的实际场景时面临挑战，手动构建知识图谱也不可行。因此，需要一种能够有效连接不同文件间信息的 RAG 方法。
AI.method: Orion-RAG 提出了一种低复杂度策略，提取轻量级路径来连接概念，从而将碎片化文档转化为半结构化数据，实现跨文件信息链接。该方法支持实时更新和人工验证，并具有高成本效益。
AI.result: Orion-RAG 在多个领域中一致优于主流 RAG 框架。在 FinanceBench 上的实验显示，其精度相对强基线模型提高了 25.2%。
AI.conclusion: Orion-RAG 是一种有效且成本效益高的 RAG 方法，能够成功处理碎片化数据，并显著提高知识合成的性能，尤其是在金融领域。

title: PILOT-Bench: A Benchmark for Legal Reasoning in the Patent Domain with IRAC-Aligned Classification Tasks
comment: Accepted at the NLLP Workshop at EMNLP 2025
summary: The Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) of the USPTO adjudicates thousands of ex parte appeals each year, requiring the integration of technical understanding and legal reasoning. While large language models (LLMs) are increasingly applied in patent and legal practice, their use has remained limited to lightweight tasks, with no established means of systematically evaluating their capacity for structured legal reasoning in the patent domain. In this work, we introduce PILOT-Bench, the first PTAB-centric benchmark that aligns PTAB decisions with USPTO patent data at the case-level and formalizes three IRAC-aligned classification tasks: Issue Type, Board Authorities, and Subdecision. We evaluate a diverse set of closed-source (commercial) and open-source LLMs and conduct analyses across multiple perspectives, including input-variation settings, model families, and error tendencies. Notably, on the Issue Type task, closed-source models consistently exceed 0.75 in Micro-F1 score, whereas the strongest open-source model (Qwen-8B) achieves performance around 0.56, highlighting a substantial gap in reasoning capabilities. PILOT-Bench establishes a foundation for the systematic evaluation of patent-domain legal reasoning and points toward future directions for improving LLMs through dataset design and model alignment. All data, code, and benchmark resources are available at https://github.com/TeamLab/pilot-bench.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了PILOT-Bench，一个用于评估大型语言模型（LLMs）在专利审查及上诉委员会（PTAB）法律推理能力的基准测试。研究发现，闭源模型在该基准测试上表现优于开源模型，并指出了未来改进LLMs的方向。
AI.motivation: 目前缺乏系统性的方法来评估大型语言模型在专利领域结构化法律推理方面的能力，尽管LLMs在法律实践中应用日益广泛。
AI.method: 构建了PILOT-Bench，一个包含PTAB判决和USPTO专利数据的案例级基准。该基准包含了三个与IRAC（Issue, Rule, Analysis, Conclusion）相符的分类任务：Issue Type, Board Authorities, 和 Subdecision。对多种闭源和开源LLMs进行了评估，并从输入变化、模型家族和错误倾向等方面进行了分析。
AI.result: 在Issue Type任务上，闭源模型普遍取得了超过0.75的Micro-F1分数，而表现最好的开源模型Qwen-8B仅达到约0.56，显示出模型在推理能力上的显著差距。
AI.conclusion: PILOT-Bench为系统评估专利领域的法律推理能力奠定了基础，并为通过数据集设计和模型对齐来改进LLMs指明了未来方向。

title: VERSE: Visual Embedding Reduction and Space Exploration. Clustering-Guided Insights for Training Data Enhancement in Visually-Rich Document Understanding
summary: This work introduces VERSE, a methodology for analyzing and improving Vision-Language Models applied to Visually-rich Document Understanding by exploring their visual embedding space. VERSE enables the visualization of latent representations, supporting the assessment of model feasibility. It also facilitates the identification of problematic regions and guides the generation of synthetic data to enhance performance in those clusters. We validate the methodology by training on the synthetic MERIT Dataset and evaluating on its real-world counterpart, MERIT Secret. Results show that VERSE helps uncover the visual features associated with error-prone clusters, and that retraining with samples containing these features substantially boosts F1 performance without degrading generalization. Furthermore, we demonstrate that on-premise models such as Donut and Idefics2, when optimized with VERSE, match or even surpass the performance of SaaS solutions like GPT-4 and Pixtral.

AI.tldr: VERSE 是一种用于分析和改进视觉-语言模型在视觉丰富文档理解任务中的应用的方法，通过探索其视觉嵌入空间，实现可视化、识别问题区域并生成合成数据以提升性能。该方法在 MERIT 数据集上进行了验证，证明了其有效性，并且通过 VERSE 优化的本地模型能够媲美甚至超越一些大型 SaaS 模型。
AI.motivation: 现有视觉-语言模型在视觉丰富的文档理解任务中存在性能瓶颈，需要一种方法来分析模型的弱点并进行改进，尤其是在其视觉嵌入空间层面。
AI.method: VERSE 方法通过可视化模型的潜在表示来评估模型可行性，识别易出错的区域，并生成针对这些区域的合成数据来提升模型性能。该方法通过在合成数据集（MERIT Dataset）上训练，并在真实数据集（MERIT Secret）上评估来验证。
AI.result: VERSE 方法能够揭示与错误集群相关的视觉特征，并显示通过包含这些特征的样本进行再训练可以显著提高 F1 分数，同时不损害泛化能力。经过 VERSE 优化的本地模型（如 Donut 和 Idefics2）在性能上能够达到甚至超过 SaaS 解决方案（如 GPT-4 和 Pixtral）。
AI.conclusion: VERSE 是一种有效的分析和改进视觉-语言模型在视觉丰富文档理解任务中表现的方法。通过探索和利用模型的视觉嵌入空间，可以识别和解决模型的弱点，并且通过合成数据增强可以有效提升性能。此外，该方法能够帮助本地部署的模型在性能上与领先的 SaaS 模型竞争。

title: Differential syntactic and semantic encoding in LLMs
summary: We study how syntactic and semantic information is encoded in inner layer representations of Large Language Models (LLMs), focusing on the very large DeepSeek-V3. We find that, by averaging hidden-representation vectors of sentences sharing syntactic structure or meaning, we obtain vectors that capture a significant proportion of the syntactic and semantic information contained in the representations. In particular, subtracting these syntactic and semantic ``centroids'' from sentence vectors strongly affects their similarity with syntactically and semantically matched sentences, respectively, suggesting that syntax and semantics are, at least partially, linearly encoded. We also find that the cross-layer encoding profiles of syntax and semantics are different, and that the two signals can to some extent be decoupled, suggesting differential encoding of these two types of linguistic information in LLM representations.

AI.tldr: 本研究分析了大型语言模型DeepSeek-V3的内部表征中句法和语义信息的编码方式，发现它们以线性方式部分编码，并在不同层级有不同的编码模式，且可部分解耦。
AI.motivation: 研究LLM内部表征如何编码句法和语义信息，以理解其语言理解机制。
AI.method: 通过平均具有相似句法结构或语义的句子表征向量（centroids），并将其与原句子向量相减，观察对句子相似度的影响。
AI.result: 平均句法/语义表征向量能捕捉到大量句法/语义信息；将这些“质心”向量从句子向量中减去，会显著影响句子与句法/语义匹配句子的相似度，表明句法和语义信息至少部分地以线性方式编码；句法和语义信息的跨层编码模式不同，且可被部分解耦。
AI.conclusion: LLMs中的句法和语义信息被部分地线性编码，并且在不同层级存在不同的编码方式，这两种信息在一定程度上可以被区分和解耦。

title: AT$^2$PO: Agentic Turn-based Policy Optimization via Tree Search
summary: LLM agents have emerged as powerful systems for tackling multi-turn tasks by interleaving internal reasoning and external tool interactions. Agentic Reinforcement Learning has recently drawn significant research attention as a critical post-training paradigm to further refine these capabilities. In this paper, we present AT$^2$PO (Agentic Turn-based Policy Optimization via Tree Search), a unified framework for multi-turn agentic RL that addresses three core challenges: limited exploration diversity, sparse credit assignment, and misaligned policy optimization. AT$^2$PO introduces a turn-level tree structure that jointly enables Entropy-Guided Tree Expansion for strategic exploration and Turn-wise Credit Assignment for fine-grained reward propagation from sparse outcomes. Complementing this, we propose Agentic Turn-based Policy Optimization, a turn-level learning objective that aligns policy updates with the natural decision granularity of agentic interactions. ATPO is orthogonal to tree search and can be readily integrated into any multi-turn RL pipeline. Experiments across seven benchmarks demonstrate consistent improvements over the state-of-the-art baseline by up to 1.84 percentage points in average, with ablation studies validating the effectiveness of each component. Our code is available at https://github.com/zzfoutofspace/ATPO.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了AT$^2$PO框架，一种用于多轮任务的代理强化学习方法，通过引入基于回合的树搜索和策略优化，解决了探索多样性不足、信用分配稀疏和策略优化不匹配的问题。
AI.motivation: 现有的LLM代理在多轮任务中存在探索多样性不足、信用分配稀疏和策略优化不匹配等挑战，需要一种新的强化学习范式来进一步提升其能力。
AI.method: AT$^2$PO框架引入了回合级别的树结构，结合了熵导引树扩展（用于探索）和回合制信用分配（用于奖励传播）。同时，提出了回合制策略优化（ATPO），一个与树搜索正交的回合级别学习目标。
AI.result: 在七个基准测试中，AT$^2$PO相较于现有最先进的方法平均提升了1.84个百分点。消融实验验证了每个组件的有效性。
AI.conclusion: AT$^2$PO框架能够有效地解决多轮代理强化学习中的核心挑战，显著提升代理在多轮任务上的表现，并且其提出的ATPO可以方便地集成到现有的多轮强化学习流程中。

title: Revisiting Judge Decoding from First Principles via Training-Free Distributional Divergence
summary: Judge Decoding accelerates LLM inference by relaxing the strict verification of Speculative Decoding, yet it typically relies on expensive and noisy supervision. In this work, we revisit this paradigm from first principles, revealing that the ``criticality'' scores learned via costly supervision are intrinsically encoded in the draft-target distributional divergence. We theoretically prove a structural correspondence between learned linear judges and Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence, demonstrating they rely on the same underlying logit primitives. Guided by this, we propose a simple, training-free verification mechanism based on KL divergence. Extensive experiments across reasoning and coding benchmarks show that our method matches or outperforms complex trained judges (e.g., AutoJudge), offering superior robustness to domain shifts and eliminating the supervision bottleneck entirely.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种训练无关的KL散度方法来加速LLM推理，它通过放松Speculative Decoding的验证并利用草稿-目标分布差异来取代昂贵的监督。
AI.motivation: 现有Judge Decoding方法依赖于昂贵且有噪声的监督信号，并且性能受限于这些监督信号的质量。
AI.method: 作者从理论上证明了线性和KL散度之间的结构对应关系，并基于此提出了一种基于KL散度的、无需训练的验证机制。
AI.result: 该方法在推理和代码生成任务上，性能与甚至优于训练过的复杂Judge方法（如AutoJudge），并且在领域迁移方面表现出更好的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: 通过利用草稿-目标分布差异中的内在信息，可以设计出无需监督的、高效且鲁棒的LLM推理加速方法。

title: VerseCrafter: Dynamic Realistic Video World Model with 4D Geometric Control
summary: Video world models aim to simulate dynamic, real-world environments, yet existing methods struggle to provide unified and precise control over camera and multi-object motion, as videos inherently operate dynamics in the projected 2D image plane. To bridge this gap, we introduce VerseCrafter, a 4D-aware video world model that enables explicit and coherent control over both camera and object dynamics within a unified 4D geometric world state. Our approach is centered on a novel 4D Geometric Control representation, which encodes the world state through a static background point cloud and per-object 3D Gaussian trajectories. This representation captures not only an object's path but also its probabilistic 3D occupancy over time, offering a flexible, category-agnostic alternative to rigid bounding boxes or parametric models. These 4D controls are rendered into conditioning signals for a pretrained video diffusion model, enabling the generation of high-fidelity, view-consistent videos that precisely adhere to the specified dynamics. Unfortunately, another major challenge lies in the scarcity of large-scale training data with explicit 4D annotations. We address this by developing an automatic data engine that extracts the required 4D controls from in-the-wild videos, allowing us to train our model on a massive and diverse dataset.

AI.tldr: VerseCrafter 是一种 4D 感知的视频世界模型，通过新颖的 4D 几何控制表示（包括静态背景点云和逐对象 3D 高斯轨迹）实现了对相机和多对象运动的统一精确控制，并利用自动数据引擎从野外视频中提取 4D 控制以进行大规模训练。
AI.motivation: 现有视频世界模型难以统一且精确地控制相机和多对象运动，因为视频动力学是在 2D 图像平面上投影的。需要一种能够明确、一致地控制 4D 几何世界状态中相机和对象动力学的方法。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为 VerseCrafter 的 4D 感知视频世界模型，其核心是新的 4D 几何控制表示。该表示使用静态背景点云和逐对象 3D 高斯轨迹来编码世界状态，捕捉对象的 3D 占用概率。将这些 4D 控制渲染成条件信号，用于预训练的视频扩散模型，以生成高保真、视图一致的视频。此外，开发了一个自动数据引擎，从野外视频中提取 4D 控制，以构建大规模训练数据集。
AI.result: VerseCrafter 能够生成高保真、视图一致的视频，并能精确控制指定的相机和对象动力学。该模型在大规模、多样化的数据集上进行了训练。
AI.conclusion: VerseCrafter 提供了一种统一的 4D 感知方法来控制视频生成中的相机和多对象运动，解决了现有方法的局限性，并通过自动数据引擎克服了数据稀缺的挑战。

title: A Lightweight and Explainable Vision-Language Framework for Crop Disease Visual Question Answering
summary: Visual question answering for crop disease analysis requires accurate visual understanding and reliable language generation. This work presents a lightweight vision-language framework for crop and disease identification from leaf images. The proposed approach combines a Swin Transformer vision encoder with sequence-to-sequence language decoders. A two-stage training strategy is adopted to improve visual representation learning and cross-modal alignment. The model is evaluated on a large-scale crop disease dataset using classification and natural language generation metrics. Experimental results show high accuracy for both crop and disease identification. The framework also achieves strong performance on BLEU, ROUGE and BERTScore. Our proposed models outperform large-scale vision-language baselines while using significantly fewer parameters. Explainability is assessed using Grad-CAM and token-level attribution. Qualitative results demonstrate robust performance under diverse user-driven queries. These findings highlight the effectiveness of task-specific visual pretraining for crop disease visual question answering.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种轻量级的视觉-语言框架，用于通过叶片图像识别作物和疾病，并生成相关的自然语言描述。该框架在大型数据集上取得了高准确率，并且优于其他基线模型，同时参数量更少。该模型还具备一定的可解释性。
AI.motivation: 为了实现对作物病害分析的准确视觉理解和可靠的语言生成，需要开发一个高效且准确的视觉-语言框架。
AI.method: 采用Swin Transformer作为视觉编码器，结合序列到序列的语言解码器。通过两阶段训练策略来增强视觉表示学习和跨模态对齐。使用Grad-CAM和token-level attribution评估模型的可解释性。
AI.result: 在大型作物病害数据集上，该模型在作物和病害识别方面取得了高准确率。在BLEU、ROUGE和BERTScore等指标上表现出色，优于大型视觉-语言基线模型，且参数量更少。
AI.conclusion: 该轻量级视觉-语言框架在作物病害识别和问题回答方面是有效的，并且通过任务特定的视觉预训练可以显著提升性能。模型在用户驱动的查询下表现出鲁棒性。

title: APEX: Academic Poster Editing Agentic Expert
summary: Designing academic posters is a labor-intensive process requiring the precise balance of high-density content and sophisticated layout. While existing paper-to-poster generation methods automate initial drafting, they are typically single-pass and non-interactive, often fail to align with complex, subjective user intent. To bridge this gap, we propose APEX (Academic Poster Editing agentic eXpert), the first agentic framework for interactive academic poster editing, supporting fine-grained control with robust multi-level API-based editing and a review-and-adjustment Mechanism. In addition, we introduce APEX-Bench, the first systematic benchmark comprising 514 academic poster editing instructions, categorized by a multi-dimensional taxonomy including operation type, difficulty, and abstraction level, constructed via reference-guided and reference-free strategies to ensure realism and diversity. We further establish a multi-dimensional VLM-as-a-judge evaluation protocol to assess instruction fulfillment, modification scope, and visual consistency & harmony. Experimental results demonstrate that APEX significantly outperforms baseline methods. Our implementation is available at https://github.com/Breesiu/APEX.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为APEX的学术海报交互式编辑代理框架，并构建了APEX-Bench基准来评估其性能。APEX通过多级API编辑和审查-调整机制实现精细化控制，实验结果表明其优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 现有的学术海报生成方法通常是单次生成且缺乏交互性，难以满足用户复杂且主观的设计意图。
AI.method: 提出APEX代理框架，支持多级API进行海报编辑，并引入审查-调整机制。同时，构建APEX-Bench基准，包含514条海报编辑指令，并建立基于VLM的评估协议。
AI.result: APEX在实验中显著优于基线方法，表明其在交互式学术海报编辑方面的有效性。
AI.conclusion: APEX是首个支持交互式学术海报编辑的代理框架，通过精细化控制和用户意图对齐，能够更有效地满足学术海报设计需求。APEX-Bench为该领域的研究提供了系统性的评估工具。

title: LANGSAE EDITING: Improving Multilingual Information Retrieval via Post-hoc Language Identity Removal
summary: Dense retrieval in multilingual settings often searches over mixed-language collections, yet multilingual embeddings encode language identity alongside semantics. This language signal can inflate similarity for same-language pairs and crowd out relevant evidence written in other languages. We propose LANGSAE EDITING, a post-hoc sparse autoencoder trained on pooled embeddings that enables controllable removal of language-identity signal directly in vector space. The method identifies language-associated latent units using cross-language activation statistics, suppresses these units at inference time, and reconstructs embeddings in the original dimensionality, making it compatible with existing vector databases without retraining the base encoder or re-encoding raw text. Experiments across multiple languages show consistent improvements in ranking quality and cross-language coverage, with especially strong gains for script-distinct languages.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为LANGSAE EDITING的后处理方法，用于去除多语言检索中多语言嵌入中的语言身份信号，以提高跨语言检索的准确性和覆盖范围。
AI.motivation: 现有的多语言密集检索方法在处理混合语言集合时，嵌入中的语言信号会夸大同语言对的相似性，并可能忽略其他语言中的相关信息。
AI.method: LANGSAE EDITING是一种基于池化嵌入训练的后处理稀疏自编码器。它通过跨语言激活统计识别与语言相关的潜在单元，并在推理时抑制这些单元，然后将嵌入重建到原始维度。此方法无需重新训练基础编码器或重新编码原始文本。
AI.result: 在多语言实验中，该方法在排名质量和跨语言覆盖率方面均取得了持续的改进，尤其是在脚本不同的语言对上表现尤为突出。
AI.conclusion: LANGSAE EDITING能够有效地去除多语言嵌入中的语言身份信号，从而提高多语言检索的性能，并且与现有向量数据库兼容。

title: Atlas 2 -- Foundation models for clinical deployment
summary: Pathology foundation models substantially advanced the possibilities in computational pathology -- yet tradeoffs in terms of performance, robustness, and computational requirements remained, which limited their clinical deployment. In this report, we present Atlas 2, Atlas 2-B, and Atlas 2-S, three pathology vision foundation models which bridge these shortcomings by showing state-of-the-art performance in prediction performance, robustness, and resource efficiency in a comprehensive evaluation across eighty public benchmarks. Our models were trained on the largest pathology foundation model dataset to date comprising 5.5 million histopathology whole slide images, collected from three medical institutions Charité - Universtätsmedizin Berlin, LMU Munich, and Mayo Clinic.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了三种新的病理学视觉基础模型（Atlas 2、Atlas 2-B 和 Atlas 2-S），它们在性能、鲁棒性和资源效率方面均优于现有模型，有望克服当前模型在临床应用中的限制。
AI.motivation: 现有的病理学基础模型在性能、鲁棒性和计算资源需求方面存在权衡，限制了其临床部署。研究旨在解决这些不足。
AI.method: 训练了三个病理学视觉基础模型（Atlas 2、Atlas 2-B 和 Atlas 2-S），使用了迄今为止最大的病理学基础模型数据集（包含 550 万张全切片图像），并在八十个公开基准测试中进行了全面评估。
AI.result: Atlas 2 系列模型在预测性能、鲁棒性和资源效率方面均取得了最先进的成果，全面优于现有模型。
AI.conclusion: Atlas 2 系列模型通过在性能、鲁棒性和资源效率上的改进，解决了现有病理学基础模型的局限性，为更广泛的临床应用铺平了道路。

title: Defense Against Indirect Prompt Injection via Tool Result Parsing
summary: As LLM agents transition from digital assistants to physical controllers in autonomous systems and robotics, they face an escalating threat from indirect prompt injection. By embedding adversarial instructions into the results of tool calls, attackers can hijack the agent's decision-making process to execute unauthorized actions. This vulnerability poses a significant risk as agents gain more direct control over physical environments. Existing defense mechanisms against Indirect Prompt Injection (IPI) generally fall into two categories. The first involves training dedicated detection models; however, this approach entails high computational overhead for both training and inference, and requires frequent updates to keep pace with evolving attack vectors. Alternatively, prompt-based methods leverage the inherent capabilities of LLMs to detect or ignore malicious instructions via prompt engineering. Despite their flexibility, most current prompt-based defenses suffer from high Attack Success Rates (ASR), demonstrating limited robustness against sophisticated injection attacks. In this paper, we propose a novel method that provides LLMs with precise data via tool result parsing while effectively filtering out injected malicious code. Our approach achieves competitive Utility under Attack (UA) while maintaining the lowest Attack Success Rate (ASR) to date, significantly outperforming existing methods. Code is available at GitHub.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种新的方法，通过工具结果解析为 LLM 提供精确数据，同时有效过滤注入的恶意代码，在保持较低的攻击成功率（ASR）的同时，实现了具有竞争力的攻击下的效用（UA）。
AI.motivation: 随着 LLM 代理越来越多地控制物理环境，来自间接提示注入的威胁不断升级，可能导致未经授权的操作。现有的防御方法要么计算成本高昂，要么鲁棒性不足。
AI.method: 提出了一种新的方法，为 LLM 提供精确的工具结果解析数据，并有效过滤注入的恶意代码。
AI.result: 该方法实现了具有竞争力的攻击下的效用（UA），同时保持了迄今为止最低的攻击成功率（ASR），显著优于现有方法。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的方法能够有效地防御间接提示注入攻击，并在保持代理效用的同时，显著降低攻击成功率。

title: NC2C: Automated Convexification of Generic Non-Convex Optimization Problems
summary: Non-convex optimization problems are pervasive across mathematical programming, engineering design, and scientific computing, often posing intractable challenges for traditional solvers due to their complex objective functions and constrained landscapes. To address the inefficiency of manual convexification and the over-reliance on expert knowledge, we propose NC2C, an LLM-based end-to-end automated framework designed to transform generic non-convex optimization problems into solvable convex forms using large language models. NC2C leverages LLMs' mathematical reasoning capabilities to autonomously detect non-convex components, select optimal convexification strategies, and generate rigorous convex equivalents. The framework integrates symbolic reasoning, adaptive transformation techniques, and iterative validation, equipped with error correction loops and feasibility domain correction mechanisms to ensure the robustness and validity of transformed problems. Experimental results on a diverse dataset of 100 generic non-convex problems demonstrate that NC2C achieves an 89.3\% execution rate and a 76\% success rate in producing feasible, high-quality convex transformations. This outperforms baseline methods by a significant margin, highlighting NC2C's ability to leverage LLMs for automated non-convex to convex transformation, reduce expert dependency, and enable efficient deployment of convex solvers for previously intractable optimization tasks.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为NC2C的基于大语言模型的框架，能够自动将非凸优化问题转化为凸优化问题，并在实验中取得了较高的成功率。
AI.motivation: 手动将非凸优化问题转化为凸优化问题效率低下且过度依赖专家知识。研究旨在解决这一问题，实现自动化转化。
AI.method: NC2C框架利用大语言模型（LLMs）的数学推理能力，自动检测非凸部分，选择凸化策略，并生成凸等价形式。框架结合了符号推理、自适应转化技术、迭代验证、误差修正和可行域修正。
AI.result: 在100个通用非凸优化问题数据集上，NC2C的执行率为89.3%，生成可行且高质量的凸转化的成功率为76%。
AI.conclusion: NC2C能够有效地利用LLMs实现非凸到凸的自动化转化，减少对专家的依赖，并使先前难以解决的优化问题能够高效地使用凸优化求解器。

title: Multi-Scale Local Speculative Decoding for Image Generation
summary: Autoregressive (AR) models have achieved remarkable success in image synthesis, yet their sequential nature imposes significant latency constraints. Speculative Decoding offers a promising avenue for acceleration, but existing approaches are limited by token-level ambiguity and lack of spatial awareness. In this work, we introduce Multi-Scale Local Speculative Decoding (MuLo-SD), a novel framework that combines multi-resolution drafting with spatially informed verification to accelerate AR image generation. Our method leverages a low-resolution drafter paired with learned up-samplers to propose candidate image tokens, which are then verified in parallel by a high-resolution target model. Crucially, we incorporate a local rejection and resampling mechanism, enabling efficient correction of draft errors by focusing on spatial neighborhoods rather than raster-scan resampling after the first rejection. We demonstrate that MuLo-SD achieves substantial speedups - up to $\mathbf{1.7\times}$ - outperforming strong speculative decoding baselines such as EAGLE-2 and LANTERN in terms of acceleration, while maintaining comparable semantic alignment and perceptual quality. These results are validated using GenEval, DPG-Bench, and FID/HPSv2 on the MS-COCO 5k validation split. Extensive ablations highlight the impact of up-sampling design, probability pooling, and local rejection and resampling with neighborhood expansion. Our approach sets a new state-of-the-art in speculative decoding for image synthesis, bridging the gap between efficiency and fidelity.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为多尺度局部推测解码 (MuLo-SD) 的新框架，通过多分辨率草稿和空间感知验证来加速自回归图像合成，实现了高达 1.7 倍的速度提升，同时保持了高质量的语义和感知效果。
AI.motivation: 现有的自回归图像合成模型虽然效果显著，但其顺序生成方式导致延迟较高。现有的推测解码方法在处理 token 级别的歧义和缺乏空间感知方面存在局限性。
AI.method: MuLo-SD 结合了多分辨率草稿和空间感知验证。使用低分辨率的草稿模型和学习到的上采样器生成候选图像 token，然后由高分辨率的目标模型并行验证。引入了局部拒绝和重采样机制，通过关注空间邻域而不是全局重采样来高效纠正草稿错误。
AI.result: MuLo-SD 实现了高达 1.7 倍的速度提升，优于 EAGLE-2 和 LANTERN 等推测解码基线。在语义对齐和感知质量方面，其表现与基线相当。通过 GenEval、DPG-Bench 和 FID/HPSv2 在 MS-COCO 5k 验证集上进行了验证。
AI.conclusion: MuLo-SD 是一种新的推测解码方法，通过多尺度草稿和局部空间感知验证，显著提高了自回归图像合成的效率，同时保持了高质量的生成结果，为提高图像合成效率和保真度之间提供了新的解决方案。

title: Belief in Authority: Impact of Authority in Multi-Agent Evaluation Framework
summary: Multi-agent systems utilizing large language models often assign authoritative roles to improve performance, yet the impact of authority bias on agent interactions remains underexplored. We present the first systematic analysis of role-based authority bias in free-form multi-agent evaluation using ChatEval. Applying French and Raven's power-based theory, we classify authoritative roles into legitimate, referent, and expert types and analyze their influence across 12-turn conversations. Experiments with GPT-4o and DeepSeek R1 reveal that Expert and Referent power roles exert stronger influence than Legitimate power roles. Crucially, authority bias emerges not through active conformity by general agents, but through authoritative roles consistently maintaining their positions while general agents demonstrate flexibility. Furthermore, authority influence requires clear position statements, as neutral responses fail to generate bias. These findings provide key insights for designing multi-agent frameworks with asymmetric interaction patterns.

AI.tldr: 本研究首次系统分析了自由形式的多主体评估中基于角色的权威偏见，发现专家和参照权力角色比合法权力角色影响更大，且权威偏见并非来自一般主体的被动遵从，而是权威角色坚持立场而一般主体表现出灵活性。
AI.motivation: 现有研究虽然常为提升性能而为大型语言模型驱动的多主体系统分配权威角色，但对权威偏见如何影响主体间互动缺乏深入研究。
AI.method: 作者在自由形式的多主体评估中使用ChatEval，应用法国和拉文的权力理论，将权威角色分为合法、参照和专家类型，并分析了其在12轮对话中的影响。实验使用了GPT-4o和DeepSeek R1模型。
AI.result: 实验表明，专家和参照权力角色的影响力强于合法权力角色。权威偏见不是通过一般主体的积极遵从产生的，而是权威角色坚持自己的立场，而一般主体则表现出灵活性。此外，权威影响的产生需要明确的立场声明，中立回应则无法产生偏见。
AI.conclusion: 研究结果为设计具有不对称交互模式的多主体框架提供了关键见解，强调了在多主体系统中明确角色和立场的重要性，以及理解不同权力类型的影响机制。

title: Vision-Language Introspection: Mitigating Overconfident Hallucinations in MLLMs via Interpretable Bi-Causal Steering
summary: Object hallucination critically undermines the reliability of Multimodal Large Language Models, often stemming from a fundamental failure in cognitive introspection, where models blindly trust linguistic priors over specific visual evidence. Existing mitigations remain limited: contrastive decoding approaches operate superficially without rectifying internal semantic misalignments, while current latent steering methods rely on static vectors that lack instance-specific precision. We introduce Vision-Language Introspection (VLI), a training-free inference framework that simulates a metacognitive self-correction process. VLI first performs Attributive Introspection to diagnose hallucination risks via probabilistic conflict detection and localize the causal visual anchors. It then employs Interpretable Bi-Causal Steering to actively modulate the inference process, dynamically isolating visual evidence from background noise while neutralizing blind confidence through adaptive calibration. VLI achieves state-of-the-art performance on advanced models, reducing object hallucination rates by 12.67% on MMHal-Bench and improving accuracy by 5.8% on POPE.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 VLI 的训练无关推理框架，通过模拟元认知自我纠正过程来解决多模态大语言模型的对象幻觉问题。VLI 通过属性内省识别幻觉风险并定位视觉锚点，然后通过可解释的双因果引导来动态调整推理过程，从而减少幻觉并提高准确性。
AI.motivation: 对象幻觉严重影响了多模态大语言模型的可靠性，其根源在于模型盲目依赖语言先验而非视觉证据。现有的缓解方法不足以解决深层语义不匹配问题，且缺乏实例特异性。
AI.method: VLI 框架包括两个主要步骤：1. 属性内省（Attributive Introspection）：通过概率冲突检测诊断幻觉风险并定位视觉锚点。2. 可解释的双因果引导（Interpretable Bi-Causal Steering）：动态隔离视觉证据，同时通过自适应校准消除盲目自信。
AI.result: VLI 在 MMHal-Bench 上将对象幻觉率降低了 12.67%，在 POPE 上将准确率提高了 5.8%，在先进模型上取得了最先进的性能。
AI.conclusion: VLI 是一种有效的训练无关推理框架，能够显著减少多模态大语言模型的对象幻觉，并提高其在视觉问答等任务上的准确性。

title: Thinking-Based Non-Thinking: Solving the Reward Hacking Problem in Training Hybrid Reasoning Models via Reinforcement Learning
summary: Large reasoning models (LRMs) have attracted much attention due to their exceptional performance. However, their performance mainly stems from thinking, a long Chain of Thought (CoT), which significantly increase computational overhead. To address this overthinking problem, existing work focuses on using reinforcement learning (RL) to train hybrid reasoning models that automatically decide whether to engage in thinking or not based on the complexity of the query. Unfortunately, using RL will suffer the the reward hacking problem, e.g., the model engages in thinking but is judged as not doing so, resulting in incorrect rewards. To mitigate this problem, existing works either employ supervised fine-tuning (SFT), which incurs high computational costs, or enforce uniform token limits on non-thinking responses, which yields limited mitigation of the problem. In this paper, we propose Thinking-Based Non-Thinking (TNT). It does not employ SFT, and sets different maximum token usage for responses not using thinking across various queries by leveraging information from the solution component of the responses using thinking. Experiments on five mathematical benchmarks demonstrate that TNT reduces token usage by around 50% compared to DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-1.5B/7B and DeepScaleR-1.5B, while significantly improving accuracy. In fact, TNT achieves the optimal trade-off between accuracy and efficiency among all tested methods. Additionally, the probability of reward hacking problem in TNT's responses, which are classified as not using thinking, remains below 10% across all tested datasets.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为TNT（Thinking-Based Non-Thinking）的新方法，旨在解决大型推理模型（LRM）由于过度思考（CoT）导致的高计算开销问题。TNT通过为不思考的响应设置动态的token上限，并利用思考组件的信息来规避强化学习中的奖励窃取问题，实现了在计算效率和准确性之间的最佳权衡。
AI.motivation: 大型推理模型（LRM）的性能虽好，但其长思维链（CoT）导致计算开销巨大。现有方法（如强化学习）在解决此问题时存在奖励窃取等弊端，而监督微调（SFT）成本高昂，统一的token限制效果有限。因此，需要一种更有效的方法来平衡LRM的推理效率和准确性。
AI.method: TNT方法不使用SFT，而是根据查询的复杂性，利用响应中思考组件的信息来动态设置非思考响应的最大token使用量，从而在不依赖SFT的情况下，有效降低计算开销并缓解奖励窃取问题。
AI.result: TNT在五个数学基准测试中，相比DeepSeek-R1-Distill-Qwen-1.5B/7B和DeepScaleR-1.5B，token使用量减少了约50%，同时显著提高了准确性，并在准确性和效率之间取得了最佳的权衡。此外，TNT的响应中奖励窃取问题的发生概率低于10%。
AI.conclusion: TNT是一种有效的方法，能够解决大型推理模型过度思考带来的计算开销问题，并在准确性和效率之间取得优异的平衡。该方法通过动态设置非思考响应的token上限，成功规避了强化学习中的奖励窃取问题，展现了其在实际应用中的潜力。

title: SciIF: Benchmarking Scientific Instruction Following Towards Rigorous Scientific Intelligence
summary: As large language models (LLMs) transition from general knowledge retrieval to complex scientific discovery, their evaluation standards must also incorporate the rigorous norms of scientific inquiry. Existing benchmarks exhibit a critical blind spot: general instruction-following metrics focus on superficial formatting, while domain-specific scientific benchmarks assess only final-answer correctness, often rewarding models that arrive at the right result with the wrong reasons. To address this gap, we introduce scientific instruction following: the capability to solve problems while strictly adhering to the constraints that establish scientific validity. Specifically, we introduce SciIF, a multi-discipline benchmark that evaluates this capability by pairing university-level problems with a fixed catalog of constraints across three pillars: scientific conditions (e.g., boundary checks and assumptions), semantic stability (e.g., unit and symbol conventions), and specific processes(e.g., required numerical methods). Uniquely, SciIF emphasizes auditability, requiring models to provide explicit evidence of constraint satisfaction rather than implicit compliance. By measuring both solution correctness and multi-constraint adherence, SciIF enables finegrained diagnosis of compositional reasoning failures, ensuring that LLMs can function as reliable agents within the strict logical frameworks of science.

AI.tldr: 本研究引入了一个新的基准 SciIF，用于评估大型语言模型（LLMs）在科学研究中的“科学指令遵循”能力，该能力要求模型在解决问题时严格遵守科学有效性约束，并提供证据证明其合规性。
AI.motivation: 现有的 LLM 评估标准无法满足科学探索的严谨性需求，要么侧重于表面的指令遵循，要么仅评估最终答案的正确性，忽略了推理过程的科学性。这导致 LLMs 在科学领域无法作为可靠的工具。
AI.method: 引入 SciIF 基准，该基准包含跨学科的大学水平问题，并结合了三个核心支柱的约束：科学条件（如边界检查、假设）、语义稳定性（如单位和符号约定）以及特定过程（如数值方法）。SciIF 强调审计性，要求模型提供满足约束的明确证据。
AI.result: SciIF 通过衡量解决方案的正确性和多约束的遵守情况，能够对 LLMs 的组合推理能力进行细粒度的诊断。
AI.conclusion: SciIF 基准填补了当前 LLM 科学评估的空白，通过强制执行科学的严格约束，确保 LLMs 能够在科学的逻辑框架内可靠地运行，并实现更深入的科学发现。

title: When AI Settles Down: Late-Stage Stability as a Signature of AI-Generated Text Detection
summary: Zero-shot detection methods for AI-generated text typically aggregate token-level statistics across entire sequences, overlooking the temporal dynamics inherent to autoregressive generation. We analyze over 120k text samples and reveal Late-Stage Volatility Decay: AI-generated text exhibits rapidly stabilizing log probability fluctuations as generation progresses, while human writing maintains higher variability throughout. This divergence peaks in the second half of sequences, where AI-generated text shows 24--32\% lower volatility. Based on this finding, we propose two simple features: Derivative Dispersion and Local Volatility, which computed exclusively from late-stage statistics. Without perturbation sampling or additional model access, our method achieves state-of-the-art performance on EvoBench and MAGE benchmarks and demonstrates strong complementarity with existing global methods.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为“后期波动衰减”的检测AI生成文本的新方法，通过分析文本生成后半段的波动性来区分AI和人类写作，并在基准测试中取得了先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的零样本AI生成文本检测方法通常忽略了自回归生成过程中的时间动态，仅仅依赖于全局的token统计信息，这限制了其检测能力。
AI.method: 分析了超过12万个文本样本，发现了“后期波动衰减”现象：AI生成文本的对数概率波动在生成过程中迅速稳定，而人类写作的波动性则在整个过程中保持较高水平。基于此，提出了两种仅使用后期统计信息的新特征：导数离散度和局部波动度。
AI.result: 提出的两种新特征在EvoBench和MAGE基准测试中取得了最先进的性能，并且与现有的全局方法具有良好的互补性。在生成文本的后半段，AI生成文本的波动性比人类写作低24%--32%。
AI.conclusion: AI生成文本在生成后期表现出独特的波动性衰减特征，这可以作为一种有效的检测信号。所提出的基于后期统计信息的新特征简单有效，无需扰动采样或额外的模型访问，即可实现高性能的AI生成文本检测。

title: CoV: Chain-of-View Prompting for Spatial Reasoning
summary:
Embodied question answering (EQA) in 3D environments often requires collecting context that is distributed across multiple viewpoints and partially occluded. However, most recent vision--language models (VLMs) are constrained to a fixed and finite set of input views, which limits their ability to acquire question-relevant context at inference time and hinders complex spatial reasoning. We propose Chain-of-View (CoV) prompting, a training-free, test-time reasoning framework that transforms a VLM into an active viewpoint reasoner through a coarse-to-fine exploration process. CoV first employs a View Selection agent to filter redundant frames and identify question-aligned anchor views. It then performs fine-grained view adjustment by interleaving iterative reasoning with discrete camera actions, obtaining new observations from the underlying 3D scene representation until sufficient context is gathered or a step budget is reached.
  We evaluate CoV on OpenEQA across four mainstream VLMs and obtain an average +11.56\% improvement in LLM-Match, with a maximum gain of +13.62\% on Qwen3-VL-Flash. CoV further exhibits test-time scaling: increasing the minimum action budget yields an additional +2.51\% average improvement, peaking at +3.73\% on Gemini-2.5-Flash. On ScanQA and SQA3D, CoV delivers strong performance (e.g., 116 CIDEr / 31.9 EM@1 on ScanQA and 51.1 EM@1 on SQA3D). Overall, these results suggest that question-aligned view selection coupled with open-view search is an effective, model-agnostic strategy for improving spatial reasoning in 3D EQA without additional training.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为Chain-of-View (CoV)的训练无关、测试时推理框架，通过主动探索3D环境来增强视觉语言模型（VLM）在具身问答（EQA）任务中的空间推理能力，实验证明该方法在多个主流VLM上均取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有的视觉语言模型在处理3D环境中的EQA任务时，受限于固定、有限的输入视角，难以获取分布式且部分遮挡的关键上下文信息，从而限制了其复杂空间推理能力。
AI.method: CoV首先使用一个视图选择代理来过滤冗余帧并识别与问题相关的锚点视图。然后，通过迭代推理与离散相机动作相结合的方式进行细粒度视图调整，从3D场景表示中获取新观测，直到收集到足够的上下文或达到步数限制。
AI.result: 在OpenEQA数据集上，CoV在四个主流VLM上平均提升了11.56%的LLM-Match得分，在Qwen3-VL-Flash上最高提升13.62%。增加最小动作预算可以进一步带来平均2.51%的提升。在ScanQA和SQA3D数据集上，CoV也展现出强大的性能。
AI.conclusion: 问题对齐的视图选择结合开放式视图搜索是一种有效的、与模型无关的策略，可以在无需额外训练的情况下，显著提升3D EQA中的空间推理能力。

title: AECV-Bench: Benchmarking Multimodal Models on Architectural and Engineering Drawings Understanding
summary: AEC drawings encode geometry and semantics through symbols, layout conventions, and dense annotation, yet it remains unclear whether modern multimodal and vision-language models can reliably interpret this graphical language. We present AECV-Bench, a benchmark for evaluating multimodal and vision-language models on realistic AEC artefacts via two complementary use cases: (i) object counting on 120 high-quality floor plans (doors, windows, bedrooms, toilets), and (ii) drawing-grounded document QA spanning 192 question-answer pairs that test text extraction (OCR), instance counting, spatial reasoning, and comparative reasoning over common drawing regions. Object-counting performance is reported using per-field exact-match accuracy and MAPE results, while document-QA performance is reported using overall accuracy and per-category breakdowns with an LLM-as-a-judge scoring pipeline and targeted human adjudication for edge cases. Evaluating a broad set of state-of-the-art models under a unified protocol, we observe a stable capability gradient; OCR and text-centric document QA are strongest (up to 0.95 accuracy), spatial reasoning is moderate, and symbol-centric drawing understanding - especially reliable counting of doors and windows - remains unsolved (often 0.40-0.55 accuracy) with substantial proportional errors. These results suggest that current systems function well as document assistants but lack robust drawing literacy, motivating domain-specific representations and tool-augmented, human-in-the-loop workflows for an efficient AEC automation.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了AECV-Bench基准，用于评估多模态和视觉语言模型在建筑、工程和施工（AEC）图纸上的理解能力。评估涵盖物体计数和基于图纸的问答。研究发现，现有模型在文本提取和基于文本的问答方面表现良好，但在空间推理和符号理解（尤其是精确计数）方面仍存在显著不足，表明需要领域特定的表征和工具增强的工作流程。
AI.motivation: 现有研究不清楚现代多模态和视觉语言模型是否能可靠地解释建筑、工程和施工（AEC）图纸中编码的几何和语义信息。因此，需要一个基准来评估和理解这些模型在AEC图纸上的能力。
AI.method: 提出AECV-Bench基准，包含两个评估用例：(i) 在120张高质量平面图上进行物体计数（门、窗、卧室、卫生间）；(ii) 跨越192对问答的基于图纸的文档问答，测试文本提取（OCR）、实例计数、空间推理和常见图纸区域的比较推理。物体计数性能使用精确匹配准确率和MAPE报告，文档问答性能使用整体准确率和类别细分，并采用LLM-as-a-judge评分流程和人工裁决。
AI.result: 在一系列先进模型上进行的评估表明，OCR和以文本为中心的文档问答表现最佳（准确率高达0.95），空间推理表现中等，而以符号为中心的图纸理解，特别是门窗的可靠计数，仍未解决（准确率常在0.40-0.55），且比例误差较大。
AI.conclusion: 当前的多模态和视觉语言模型在AEC图纸理解方面，虽然能很好地充当文档助手，但在图纸理解方面缺乏鲁棒性。这表明需要开发领域特定的表征以及增强型的、带有用户参与的（human-in-the-loop）工作流程，以实现AEC领域的自动化。

title: VideoAuto-R1: Video Auto Reasoning via Thinking Once, Answering Twice
summary: Chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning has emerged as a powerful tool for multimodal large language models on video understanding tasks. However, its necessity and advantages over direct answering remain underexplored. In this paper, we first demonstrate that for RL-trained video models, direct answering often matches or even surpasses CoT performance, despite CoT producing step-by-step analyses at a higher computational cost. Motivated by this, we propose VideoAuto-R1, a video understanding framework that adopts a reason-when-necessary strategy. During training, our approach follows a Thinking Once, Answering Twice paradigm: the model first generates an initial answer, then performs reasoning, and finally outputs a reviewed answer. Both answers are supervised via verifiable rewards. During inference, the model uses the confidence score of the initial answer to determine whether to proceed with reasoning. Across video QA and grounding benchmarks, VideoAuto-R1 achieves state-of-the-art accuracy with significantly improved efficiency, reducing the average response length by ~3.3x, e.g., from 149 to just 44 tokens. Moreover, we observe a low rate of thinking-mode activation on perception-oriented tasks, but a higher rate on reasoning-intensive tasks. This suggests that explicit language-based reasoning is generally beneficial but not always necessary.

AI.tldr: 研究表明，对于RL训练的视频模型，直接回答在视频理解任务上与链式思考（CoT）效果相当甚至更好，但CoT计算成本更高。为此，提出了VideoAuto-R1框架，采用“必要时推理”策略，通过“一次思考，两次回答”范式进行训练，并在推理时根据初始答案的置信度决定是否进行推理，达到了SOTA精度和效率的提升。
AI.motivation: 链式思考（CoT）在视频理解任务中被广泛使用，但其必要性和相较于直接回答的优势尚未得到充分研究。研究者发现，对于RL训练的视频模型，直接回答有时优于CoT，而CoT的计算成本更高。
AI.method: 提出了VideoAuto-R1框架，采用“必要时推理”策略。训练时遵循“一次思考，两次回答”范式：生成初始答案，进行推理，最后输出修正后的答案，并通过可验证奖励进行监督。推理时，根据初始答案的置信度决定是否进行推理。
AI.result: VideoAuto-R1在视频QA和视频定位基准测试中取得了SOTA精度，同时显著提高了效率，平均响应长度减少了约3.3倍。研究还发现，感知导向型任务的推理模式激活率较低，而推理密集型任务的激活率较高。
AI.conclusion: 明确的基于语言的推理是有益的，但并非总是必需的。VideoAuto-R1框架在保持甚至超越CoT性能的同时，显著提高了效率，并能根据任务的性质自适应地进行推理。

title: Cutting AI Research Costs: How Task-Aware Compression Makes Large Language Model Agents Affordable
summary: When researchers deploy large language models for autonomous tasks like reviewing literature or generating hypotheses, the computational bills add up quickly. A single research session using a 70-billion parameter model can cost around $127 in cloud fees, putting these tools out of reach for many academic labs. We developed AgentCompress to tackle this problem head-on. The core idea came from a simple observation during our own work: writing a novel hypothesis clearly demands more from the model than reformatting a bibliography. Why should both tasks run at full precision? Our system uses a small neural network to gauge how hard each incoming task will be, based only on its opening words, then routes it to a suitably compressed model variant. The decision happens in under a millisecond. Testing across 500 research workflows in four scientific fields, we cut compute costs by 68.3% while keeping 96.2% of the original success rate. For labs watching their budgets, this could mean the difference between running experiments and sitting on the sidelines

AI.tldr: AgentCompress 是一种通过根据任务难度动态选择不同精度模型来显著降低大型语言模型在科研任务中计算成本的系统，可节省高达 68.3% 的成本，同时仅损失 3.8% 的成功率。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）在自主科研任务（如文献综述、假设生成）中的高昂计算成本限制了许多学术实验室的使用。
AI.method: 开发了 AgentCompress 系统，利用一个小型神经网络根据任务的起始词判断任务难度，并将任务路由到相应压缩精度的模型变体。决策时间低于 1 毫秒。
AI.result: 在跨越四个科学领域的 500 个科研工作流测试中，AgentCompress 将计算成本降低了 68.3%，同时保持了原始成功率的 96.2%。
AI.conclusion: AgentCompress 有效地解决了 LLMs 在科研应用中的成本问题，为预算有限的实验室提供了可行的解决方案，使其能够更广泛地利用这些工具进行研究。

title: Orchestrating Intelligence: Confidence-Aware Routing for Efficient Multi-Agent Collaboration across Multi-Scale Models
summary: While multi-agent systems (MAS) have demonstrated superior performance over single-agent approaches in complex reasoning tasks, they often suffer from significant computational inefficiencies. Existing frameworks typically deploy large language models (LLMs) uniformly across all agent roles, failing to account for the varying cognitive demands of different reasoning stages. We address this inefficiency by proposing OI-MAS framework, a novel multi-agent framework that implements an adaptive model-selection policy across a heterogeneous pool of multi-scale LLMs. Specifically, OI-MAS introduces a state-dependent routing mechanism that dynamically selects agent roles and model scales throughout the reasoning process. In addition, we introduce a confidence-aware mechanism that selects appropriate model scales conditioned on task complexity, thus reducing unnecessary reliance on large-scale models. Experimental results show that OI-MAS consistently outperforms baseline multi-agent systems, improving accuracy by up to 12.88\% while reducing cost by up to 79.78\%.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为OI-MAS的新型多智能体框架，通过动态选择不同规模的语言模型来提高复杂推理任务的效率和准确性。
AI.motivation: 现有的多智能体系统（MAS）在处理复杂推理任务时计算效率低下，通常对所有智能体角色都使用相同的语言模型（LLM），未能考虑不同推理阶段不同的认知需求。
AI.method: OI-MAS框架引入了一种依赖状态的路由机制，可以动态选择智能体角色和模型规模。此外，还引入了一个置信度感知机制，根据任务复杂性选择合适的模型规模，从而减少对大型模型的过度依赖。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，OI-MAS在准确性方面比基线多智能体系统提高了12.88%，同时成本降低了79.78%。
AI.conclusion: OI-MAS通过在异构多尺度LLM池中实施自适应模型选择策略，有效地解决了MAS的计算效率问题，并在复杂推理任务中取得了显著的性能提升。

title: DR-LoRA: Dynamic Rank LoRA for Mixture-of-Experts Adaptation
summary: Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) has become a prominent paradigm for scaling Large Language Models (LLMs). Parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT), such as LoRA, is widely adopted to adapt pretrained MoE LLMs to downstream tasks. However, existing approaches assign identical LoRA ranks to all experts, overlooking the intrinsic functional specialization within MoE LLMs. This uniform allocation leads to resource mismatch, task-relevant experts are under-provisioned while less relevant ones receive redundant parameters. We propose a Dynamic Rank LoRA framework named DR-LoRA, which dynamically grows expert LoRA ranks during fine-tuning based on task-specific demands. DR-LoRA employs an Expert Saliency Scoring mechanism that integrates expert routing frequency and LoRA rank importance to quantify each expert's demand for additional capacity. Experts with higher saliency scores are prioritized for rank expansion, enabling the automatic formation of a heterogeneous rank distribution tailored to the target task. Experiments on multiple benchmarks demonstrate that DR-LoRA consistently outperforms standard LoRA and static allocation strategies under the same parameter budget, achieving superior task performance with more efficient parameter utilization.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为DR-LoRA的动态秩LoRA框架，通过根据下游任务的需求动态调整Mixture-of-Experts（MoE）模型的专家LoRA秩，以解决现有LoRA方法在MoE模型微调中资源分配不均的问题，并实现了比标准LoRA更优的性能和参数利用率。
AI.motivation: 现有的参数高效微调（PEFT）方法（如LoRA）在微调Mixture-of-Experts（MoE）大型语言模型（LLMs）时，会给所有专家分配相同的LoRA秩，忽略了MoE模型内部各专家在功能上的专业化差异。这种统一分配导致资源错配，任务相关专家的参数不足，而不相关专家的参数却冗余。
AI.method: 提出DR-LoRA框架，通过“专家显著性评分”机制动态增长专家LoRA秩。该机制结合了专家路由频率和LoRA秩的重要性来量化每个专家对额外容量的需求。对显著性得分高的专家优先增加秩，从而自动形成针对目标任务的异构秩分布。
AI.result: 在多个基准测试上的实验表明，DR-LoRA在相同的参数预算下，性能持续优于标准的LoRA和静态分配策略，实现了更优的任务性能和更高效的参数利用。
AI.conclusion: DR-LoRA能够根据任务的具体需求动态调整MoE模型的专家LoRA秩，有效解决资源分配不均的问题，从而在参数效率和模型性能之间取得更好的平衡。

title: Token Maturation: Autoregressive Language Generation via Continuous Token Dynamics
summary:
Autoregressive language models are conventionally defined over discrete token sequences, committing to a specific token at every generation step. This early discretization forces uncertainty to be resolved through token-level sampling, often leading to instability, repetition, and sensitivity to decoding heuristics.
  In this work, we introduce a continuous autoregressive formulation of language generation in which tokens are represented as continuous vectors that \emph{mature} over multiple update steps before being discretized. Rather than sampling tokens, the model evolves continuous token representations through a deterministic dynamical process, committing to a discrete token only when the representation has sufficiently converged. Discrete text is recovered via hard decoding, while uncertainty is maintained and resolved in the continuous space.
  We show that this maturation process alone is sufficient to produce coherent and diverse text using deterministic decoding (argmax), without reliance on token-level sampling, diffusion-style denoising, or auxiliary stabilization mechanisms. Additional perturbations, such as stochastic dynamics or history smoothing, can be incorporated naturally but are not required for the model to function.
  To our knowledge, this is the first autoregressive language model that generates text by evolving continuous token representations to convergence prior to discretization, enabling stable generation without token-level sampling.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种连续自回归语言生成方法，其中 token 以连续向量表示，并在离散化之前经过多次更新步骤“成熟”。这种方法通过确定性的动态过程演化连续 token 表示，从而在不依赖 token 级采样的情况下生成连贯且多样化的文本。
AI.motivation: 传统的自回归语言模型在离散 token 序列上定义，每个生成步骤都确定一个 token。这种早期离散化强制不确定性通过 token 级采样来解决，常常导致不稳定、重复和对解码启发式的敏感性。
AI.method: 作者引入了一种连续自回归语言生成公式，将 token 表示为连续向量，这些向量在离散化之前会经过多个更新步骤进行“成熟”。模型通过一个确定的动态过程演化连续 token 表示，直到表示充分收敛后才确定离散 token。
AI.result: 研究表明，仅通过这种成熟过程，就可以使用确定的解码（argmax）生成连贯且多样化的文本，而无需依赖 token 级采样、扩散式去噪或辅助稳定机制。即使加入随机动态或历史平滑等额外扰动，模型也能正常工作。
AI.conclusion: 该工作首次提出了通过演化连续 token 表示至收敛后再进行离散化来生成文本的自回归语言模型，从而实现了无需 token 级采样即可稳定生成文本。

title: MisSpans: Fine-Grained False Span Identification in Cross-Domain Fake News
summary: Online misinformation is increasingly pervasive, yet most existing benchmarks and methods evaluate veracity at the level of whole claims or paragraphs using coarse binary labels, obscuring how true and false details often co-exist within single sentences. These simplifications also limit interpretability: global explanations cannot identify which specific segments are misleading or differentiate how a detail is false (e.g., distorted vs. fabricated). To address these gaps, we introduce MisSpans, the first multi-domain, human-annotated benchmark for span-level misinformation detection and analysis, consisting of paired real and fake news stories. MisSpans defines three complementary tasks: MisSpansIdentity for pinpointing false spans within sentences, MisSpansType for categorising false spans by misinformation type, and MisSpansExplanation for providing rationales grounded in identified spans. Together, these tasks enable fine-grained localisation, nuanced characterisation beyond true/false and actionable explanations. Expert annotators were guided by standardised guidelines and consistency checks, leading to high inter-annotator agreement. We evaluate 15 representative LLMs, including reasoning-enhanced and non-reasoning variants, under zero-shot and one-shot settings. Results reveal the challenging nature of fine-grained misinformation identification and analysis, and highlight the need for a deeper understanding of how performance may be influenced by multiple interacting factors, including model size and reasoning capabilities, along with domain-specific textual features. This project will be available at https://github.com/lzw108/MisSpans.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了 MisSpans，一个用于细粒度错误信息检测和分析的多领域基准，能够定位句子中的错误片段、对其类型进行分类并提供解释，并评估了 15 种大型语言模型在零样本和单样本设置下的表现。
AI.motivation: 现有方法在评估在线错误信息时过于粗糙，通常只关注整个声明或段落，无法区分同一句子中真实和虚假细节的共存，也限制了对错误信息的细粒度解释。
AI.method: 引入 MisSpans 基准，包含成对的真实和虚假新闻故事。设计了三个任务：MisSpansIdentity（定位错误片段）、MisSpansType（错误片段分类）和 MisSpansExplanation（基于片段的解释）。对 15 种代表性的大型语言模型进行了零样本和单样本评估。
AI.result: 细粒度的错误信息识别和分析具有挑战性。模型性能受模型大小、推理能力和领域特定文本特征等多种因素的综合影响。
AI.conclusion: MisSpans 基准为细粒度错误信息检测和分析提供了基础，研究结果表明当前大型语言模型在处理此类任务方面仍有提升空间，需要对影响模型性能的多种因素进行更深入的理解。

title: Key-Value Pair-Free Continual Learner via Task-Specific Prompt-Prototype
summary: Continual learning aims to enable models to acquire new knowledge while retaining previously learned information. Prompt-based methods have shown remarkable performance in this domain; however, they typically rely on key-value pairing, which can introduce inter-task interference and hinder scalability. To overcome these limitations, we propose a novel approach employing task-specific Prompt-Prototype (ProP), thereby eliminating the need for key-value pairs. In our method, task-specific prompts facilitate more effective feature learning for the current task, while corresponding prototypes capture the representative features of the input. During inference, predictions are generated by binding each task-specific prompt with its associated prototype. Additionally, we introduce regularization constraints during prompt initialization to penalize excessively large values, thereby enhancing stability. Experiments on several widely used datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method. In contrast to mainstream prompt-based approaches, our framework removes the dependency on key-value pairs, offering a fresh perspective for future continual learning research.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种新的持续学习方法，利用任务特定的Prompt-Prototype（ProP）来克服现有基于提示的方法中的任务间干扰和可扩展性问题，无需键值对。
AI.motivation: 现有基于提示的持续学习方法依赖于键值对，这会导致任务间干扰并限制可扩展性。研究旨在克服这些局限性。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为Prompt-Prototype（ProP）的新方法。该方法使用任务特定的提示来促进当前任务的特征学习，并使用相应的原型来捕捉输入的代表性特征。在推理时，通过将任务特定的提示与其原型绑定来生成预测。此外，引入了正则化约束来限制提示初始值的大小，以提高稳定性。
AI.result: 在多个常用数据集上的实验证明了所提出方法的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的ProP框架消除了对键值对的依赖，为未来的持续学习研究提供了新的视角，并克服了现有基于提示方法的局限性。

title: A Navigational Approach for Comprehensive RAG via Traversal over Proposition Graphs
summary: Standard RAG pipelines based on chunking excel at simple factual retrieval but fail on complex multi-hop queries due to a lack of structural connectivity. Conversely, initial strategies that interleave retrieval with reasoning often lack global corpus awareness, while Knowledge Graph (KG)-based RAG performs strongly on complex multi-hop tasks but suffers on fact-oriented single-hop queries. To bridge this gap, we propose a novel RAG framework: ToPG (Traversal over Proposition Graphs). ToPG models its knowledge base as a heterogeneous graph of propositions, entities, and passages, effectively combining the granular fact density of propositions with graph connectivity. We leverage this structure using iterative Suggestion-Selection cycles, where the Suggestion phase enables a query-aware traversal of the graph, and the Selection phase provides LLM feedback to prune irrelevant propositions and seed the next iteration. Evaluated on three distinct QA tasks (Simple, Complex, and Abstract QA), ToPG demonstrates strong performance across both accuracy- and quality-based metrics. Overall, ToPG shows that query-aware graph traversal combined with factual granularity is a critical component for efficient structured RAG systems. ToPG is available at https://github.com/idiap/ToPG.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 ToPG 的新 RAG 框架，它将知识库建模为命题、实体和段落的异构图，并通过迭代的“建议-选择”循环来处理复杂的多跳查询，同时保持了对简单事实检索的优势。
AI.motivation: 标准的 RAG 方法在处理多跳查询时存在不足，而现有的结合推理的 RAG 或基于知识图谱的 RAG 在某些方面也存在局限性。研究旨在弥合这些差距，以提高 RAG 在各种问答任务上的性能。
AI.method: ToPG 框架将知识库表示为包含命题、实体和段落的异构图。利用“建议-选择”循环，其中“建议”阶段进行查询感知的图遍历，“选择”阶段利用 LLM 反馈来修剪不相关的命题并启动下一轮迭代。
AI.result: 在简单、复杂和抽象 QA 三种不同的问答任务上，ToPG 都展现出了优于现有方法的准确率和质量指标。
AI.conclusion: ToPG 表明，查询感知的图遍历与事实的粒度相结合是构建高效结构化 RAG 系统的关键组成部分。

title: MoE3D: A Mixture-of-Experts Module for 3D Reconstruction
summary: MoE3D is a mixture-of-experts module designed to sharpen depth boundaries and mitigate flying-point artifacts (highlighted in red) of existing feed-forward 3D reconstruction models (left side). MoE3D predicts multiple candidate depth maps and fuses them via dynamic weighting (visualized by MoE weights on the right side). When integrated with a pre-trained 3D reconstruction backbone such as VGGT, it substantially enhances reconstruction quality with minimal additional computational overhead. Best viewed digitally.

AI.tldr: MoE3D 是一种用于提升 3D 重建模型（如 VGGT）的深度边界锐化和减少飞行点伪影的混合专家模块。它通过预测多个候选深度图并进行动态加权融合来实现，并且在不显著增加计算开销的情况下提高了重建质量。
AI.motivation: 现有的前馈 3D 重建模型在锐化深度边界和减少飞行点伪影方面存在不足，这促使研究人员开发 MoE3D。
AI.method: MoE3D 采用混合专家（Mixture-of-Experts）模块，通过预测多个候选深度图，并利用动态权重对这些深度图进行融合，从而提高重建的准确性。
AI.result: 将 MoE3D 集成到预训练的 3D 重建骨干网络（如 VGGT）后，可以显著提高重建质量，同时额外计算开销极小。
AI.conclusion: MoE3D 是一种有效的模块，可以增强现有 3D 重建模型的性能，特别是在处理深度边界和减少伪影方面，且计算效率高。

title: Mechanisms of Prompt-Induced Hallucination in Vision-Language Models
summary: Large vision-language models (VLMs) are highly capable, yet often hallucinate by favoring textual prompts over visual evidence. We study this failure mode in a controlled object-counting setting, where the prompt overstates the number of objects in the image (e.g., asking a model to describe four waterlilies when only three are present). At low object counts, models often correct the overestimation, but as the number of objects increases, they increasingly conform to the prompt regardless of the discrepancy. Through mechanistic analysis of three VLMs, we identify a small set of attention heads whose ablation substantially reduces prompt-induced hallucinations (PIH) by at least 40% without additional training. Across models, PIH-heads mediate prompt copying in model-specific ways. We characterize these differences and show that PIH ablation increases correction toward visual evidence. Our findings offer insights into the internal mechanisms driving prompt-induced hallucinations, revealing model-specific differences in how these behaviors are implemented.

AI.tldr: 研究了大型视觉语言模型（VLM）在提示信息与视觉证据不符时容易出现幻觉的问题，特别是在物体计数场景下。发现通过移除一小部分特定的注意力头，可以在不进行额外训练的情况下，显著减少模型对提示信息的过度依赖，提高模型对视觉证据的遵从度。
AI.motivation: 大型视觉语言模型（VLMs）尽管能力强大，但常常因为过度依赖文本提示而产生幻觉，尤其是在提示信息与图像内容不符的情况下。研究旨在理解和解决这种“提示诱导幻觉”（Prompt-Induced Hallucination, PIH）的失败模式。
AI.method: 作者在一个受控的物体计数场景下，人为制造提示信息（例如，图像中实际有三个睡莲，但提示模型有四个）来测试VLMs的行为。通过对三种不同的VLM进行机械性分析，识别出导致PIH的一小部分注意力头，并尝试通过移除（ablation）这些注意力头来观察其对模型行为的影响。同时，对PIH-heads在不同模型中介导提示信息复制的方式进行了表征。
AI.result: 在低物体数量时，模型倾向于纠正提示信息的错误；但随着物体数量的增加，模型越来越倾向于遵从提示信息，即使与视觉证据不符。通过移除约1%-3%的注意力头（PIH-heads），可以显著减少（高达40%以上）提示诱导幻觉，并且不需要额外的训练。这种消融操作增加了模型向视觉证据进行纠正的比例。
AI.conclusion: 提示诱导幻觉是VLMs中的一个重要失败模式，尤其在物体数量增多时更为明显。通过对模型内部机制的分析，发现一小部分特定的注意力头（PIH-heads）对PIH负有主要责任。移除这些注意力头是一种有效的、无需训练的减轻PIH的方法，并且不同模型中PIH-heads介导提示复制的方式存在模型特异性差异。

title: Higher-Order Knowledge Representations for Agentic Scientific Reasoning
summary: Scientific inquiry requires systems-level reasoning that integrates heterogeneous experimental data, cross-domain knowledge, and mechanistic evidence into coherent explanations. While Large Language Models (LLMs) offer inferential capabilities, they often depend on retrieval-augmented contexts that lack structural depth. Traditional Knowledge Graphs (KGs) attempt to bridge this gap, yet their pairwise constraints fail to capture the irreducible higher-order interactions that govern emergent physical behavior. To address this, we introduce a methodology for constructing hypergraph-based knowledge representations that faithfully encode multi-entity relationships. Applied to a corpus of ~1,100 manuscripts on biocomposite scaffolds, our framework constructs a global hypergraph of 161,172 nodes and 320,201 hyperedges, revealing a scale-free topology (power law exponent ~1.23) organized around highly connected conceptual hubs. This representation prevents the combinatorial explosion typical of pairwise expansions and explicitly preserves the co-occurrence context of scientific formulations. We further demonstrate that equipping agentic systems with hypergraph traversal tools, specifically using node-intersection constraints, enables them to bridge semantically distant concepts. By exploiting these higher-order pathways, the system successfully generates grounded mechanistic hypotheses for novel composite materials, such as linking cerium oxide to PCL scaffolds via chitosan intermediates. This work establishes a "teacherless" agentic reasoning system where hypergraph topology acts as a verifiable guardrail, accelerating scientific discovery by uncovering relationships obscured by traditional graph methods.

AI.tldr: 研究提出了一种基于超图的知识表示方法，用于整合异构科学数据，并开发了一种基于超图遍历的智能体系统，以加速科学发现。
AI.motivation: 现有的LLMs在处理结构化科学知识方面存在不足，传统的知识图谱也无法捕捉多实体间的复杂高阶交互，这阻碍了科学发现的系统性推理。
AI.method: 该研究构建了一个能够忠实编码多实体关系的超图知识表示框架。该框架应用于生物复合材料领域的约1100篇论文，构建了一个包含161,172个节点和320,201个超边的全局超图。在此基础上，开发了基于超图遍历（特别是节点交叉约束）的智能体系统。
AI.result: 构建的超图表现出无标度网络拓扑结构，围绕高连接度的概念中心进行组织。该方法避免了传统成对展开的组合爆炸问题，并显式保留了科学表述的共现上下文。智能体系统通过利用高阶通路，成功生成了新颖复合材料的机理假设，例如将氧化铈与PCL支架通过壳聚糖中间体联系起来。
AI.conclusion: 该研究建立了一个“无教师”的智能体推理系统，其中超图拓扑作为可验证的护栏，通过揭示传统图方法难以发现的关系，加速了科学发现。

title: EvolSQL: Structure-Aware Evolution for Scalable Text-to-SQL Data Synthesis
summary: Training effective Text-to-SQL models remains challenging due to the scarcity of high-quality, diverse, and structurally complex datasets. Existing methods either rely on limited human-annotated corpora, or synthesize datasets directly by simply prompting LLMs without explicit control over SQL structures, often resulting in limited structural diversity and complexity. To address this, we introduce EvolSQL, a structure-aware data synthesis framework that evolves SQL queries from seed data into richer and more semantically diverse forms. EvolSQL starts with an exploratory Query-SQL expansion to broaden question diversity and improve schema coverage, and then applies an adaptive directional evolution strategy using six atomic transformation operators derived from the SQL Abstract Syntax Tree to progressively increase query complexity across relational, predicate, aggregation, and nesting dimensions. An execution-grounded SQL refinement module and schema-aware deduplication further ensure the creation of high-quality, structurally diverse mapping pairs. Experimental results show that a 7B model fine-tuned on our data outperforms one trained on the much larger SynSQL dataset using only 1/18 of the data.

AI.tldr: EvolSQL是一个结构感知的数据合成框架，通过从种子数据演化SQL查询来生成更丰富、更具语义多样性的Text-to-SQL训练数据，克服了现有方法在数据多样性和复杂性方面的局限性。实验证明，使用EvolSQL合成的数据可以显著提升Text-to-SQL模型的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有的Text-to-SQL模型训练面临高质量、多样化和结构复杂的训练数据集稀缺的问题。人工标注数据集有限，而直接提示LLM生成的数据缺乏结构控制，导致多样性和复杂性不足。
AI.method: EvolSQL采用结构感知的数据合成框架。首先，通过探索性的Query-SQL扩展来拓宽问题多样性并提高模式覆盖率。然后，利用基于SQL抽象语法树的六种原子变换算子，采用自适应方向演化策略，在关系、谓词、聚合和嵌套维度上逐步增加查询复杂度。最后，通过执行验证的SQL优化模块和模式感知的去重来保证数据质量和结构多样性。
AI.result: 与使用更大规模SynSQL数据集训练的模型相比，一个7B参数的模型在EvolSQL生成的数据上进行微调后，性能更优，且数据量仅为SynSQL的1/18。
AI.conclusion: EvolSQL框架能够有效地合成高质量、结构多样且语义丰富的Text-to-SQL训练数据，显著提升模型的性能，克服了现有数据合成方法的不足。

title: FlowLet: Conditional 3D Brain MRI Synthesis using Wavelet Flow Matching
summary: Brain Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) plays a central role in studying neurological development, aging, and diseases. One key application is Brain Age Prediction (BAP), which estimates an individual's biological brain age from MRI data. Effective BAP models require large, diverse, and age-balanced datasets, whereas existing 3D MRI datasets are demographically skewed, limiting fairness and generalizability. Acquiring new data is costly and ethically constrained, motivating generative data augmentation. Current generative methods are often based on latent diffusion models, which operate in learned low dimensional latent spaces to address the memory demands of volumetric MRI data. However, these methods are typically slow at inference, may introduce artifacts due to latent compression, and are rarely conditioned on age, thereby affecting the BAP performance. In this work, we propose FlowLet, a conditional generative framework that synthesizes age-conditioned 3D MRIs by leveraging flow matching within an invertible 3D wavelet domain, helping to avoid reconstruction artifacts and reducing computational demands. Experiments show that FlowLet generates high-fidelity volumes with few sampling steps. Training BAP models with data generated by FlowLet improves performance for underrepresented age groups, and region-based analysis confirms preservation of anatomical structures.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为FlowLet的条件生成框架，利用流匹配和三维小波变换来生成年龄条件化的三维脑部MRI图像，以解决现有数据集不均衡的问题，并提升脑龄预测模型的性能，尤其是在代表性不足的年龄组中。
AI.motivation: 现有的大规模三维脑部MRI数据集在人口统计学上存在偏差，这限制了公平性和泛化能力，而获取新数据成本高昂且受伦理限制。因此，需要一种生成式数据增强方法来合成新的、具有年龄条件的三维MRI数据。
AI.method: FlowLet框架利用流匹配（flow matching）技术，并在可逆的三维小波域中操作。这种方法避免了传统潜在空间模型可能引入的重建伪影，并降低了计算需求。通过年龄条件化，生成的MRI数据与特定年龄相关联。
AI.result: 实验表明，FlowLet能够生成高保真度的三维MRI图像，并且采样步数较少。使用FlowLet生成的数据训练的脑龄预测模型，在代表性不足的年龄组中的性能有所提高。此外，基于区域的分析证实了其能够保留解剖结构。
AI.conclusion: FlowLet是一种有效的条件生成框架，通过在三维小波域中利用流匹配，能够生成高质量、年龄条件化的三维MRI数据。该方法有助于缓解数据集偏差问题，提升脑龄预测模型的性能，并保持解剖结构的准确性。

title: Precomputing Multi-Agent Path Replanning using Temporal Flexibility: A Case Study on the Dutch Railway Network
summary: Executing a multi-agent plan can be challenging when an agent is delayed, because this typically creates conflicts with other agents. So, we need to quickly find a new safe plan. Replanning only the delayed agent often does not result in an efficient plan, and sometimes cannot even yield a feasible plan. On the other hand, replanning other agents may lead to a cascade of changes and delays. We show how to efficiently replan by tracking and using the temporal flexibility of other agents while avoiding cascading delays. This flexibility is the maximum delay an agent can take without changing the order of or further delaying more agents. Our algorithm, FlexSIPP, precomputes all possible plans for the delayed agent, also returning the changes for the other agents, for any single-agent delay within the given scenario. We demonstrate our method in a real-world case study of replanning trains in the densely-used Dutch railway network. Our experiments show that FlexSIPP provides effective solutions, relevant to real-world adjustments, and within a reasonable timeframe.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为FlexSIPP的算法，用于在多智能体计划中一个智能体延迟时进行高效的重新规划，通过利用其他智能体的时序灵活性来避免级联延迟，并在荷兰铁路网络案例研究中验证了其有效性。
AI.motivation: 在多智能体协作中，当一个智能体发生延迟时，通常会导致与其他智能体产生冲突，需要快速找到新的安全计划。仅重新规划延迟的智能体可能效率不高甚至不可行，而重新规划其他智能体可能引发连锁反应。因此，研究如何高效地在智能体延迟时进行重新规划，同时避免级联延迟，是研究的动机。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为FlexSIPP的算法。该算法通过跟踪和利用其他智能体的时序灵活性（即在不改变任务顺序或进一步延迟其他智能体的情况下，允许的最大延迟量）来高效地重新规划。FlexSIPP预先计算出针对延迟智能体的所有可能计划，并确定其他智能体的相应调整，以应对任何单智能体延迟。
AI.result: FlexSIPP算法能够在合理的时间内提供有效的解决方案，并且能够应对真实世界中的调整。在荷兰繁忙的铁路网络案例研究中，该方法得到了验证。
AI.conclusion: FlexSIPP算法能够高效地处理多智能体计划中的单智能体延迟问题，通过利用其他智能体的时序灵活性有效避免级联延迟，并能为实际应用提供可行的解决方案。

title: RAAR: Retrieval Augmented Agentic Reasoning for Cross-Domain Misinformation Detection
summary: Cross-domain misinformation detection is challenging, as misinformation arises across domains with substantial differences in knowledge and discourse. Existing methods often rely on single-perspective cues and struggle to generalize to challenging or underrepresented domains, while reasoning large language models (LLMs), though effective on complex tasks, are limited to same-distribution data. To address these gaps, we introduce RAAR, the first retrieval-augmented agentic reasoning framework for cross-domain misinformation detection. To enable cross-domain transfer beyond same-distribution assumptions, RAAR retrieves multi-perspective source-domain evidence aligned with each target sample's semantics, sentiment, and writing style. To overcome single-perspective modeling and missing systematic reasoning, RAAR constructs verifiable multi-step reasoning paths through specialized multi-agent collaboration, where perspective-specific agents produce complementary analyses and a summary agent integrates them under verifier guidance. RAAR further applies supervised fine-tuning and reinforcement learning to train a single multi-task verifier to enhance verification and reasoning capabilities. Based on RAAR, we trained the RAAR-8b and RAAR-14b models. Evaluation on three cross-domain misinformation detection tasks shows that RAAR substantially enhances the capabilities of the base models and outperforms other cross-domain methods, advanced LLMs, and LLM-based adaptation approaches. The project will be released at https://github.com/lzw108/RAAR.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为RAAR的跨域虚假信息检测框架，它利用检索增强的代理推理，通过多视角证据和多智能体协作来克服现有方法的局限性，并在三个跨域任务上取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有跨域虚假信息检测方法依赖单一视角，泛化能力差，难以处理知识和语篇差异大的领域；基于LLM的推理方法仅限于同分布数据。因此，需要一个能够跨越领域差异并进行系统性推理的框架。
AI.method: RAAR框架包含以下关键组件：1. 检索模块：检索与目标样本在语义、情感和写作风格上相关的多视角源域证据，以实现跨域迁移。2. 代理推理模块：通过专业化的多智能体协作构建可验证的多步推理路径，视角特定的智能体生成互补分析，汇总智能体在验证器的指导下整合分析。3. 验证器训练：通过监督微调和强化学习训练一个单一的多任务验证器，以增强验证和推理能力。
AI.result: 基于RAAR训练的RAAR-8b和RAAR-14b模型在三个跨域虚假信息检测任务上的评估结果显示，RAAR显著增强了基础模型的性能，并且优于其他跨域方法、先进的LLM和基于LLM的适应性方法。
AI.conclusion: RAAR是首个用于跨域虚假信息检测的检索增强代理推理框架，它通过多视角证据检索和多智能体协作，有效解决了现有方法的局限性，并在跨域任务上取得了SOTA性能。

title: ObjectForesight: Predicting Future 3D Object Trajectories from Human Videos
summary: Humans can effortlessly anticipate how objects might move or change through interaction--imagining a cup being lifted, a knife slicing, or a lid being closed. We aim to endow computational systems with a similar ability to predict plausible future object motions directly from passive visual observation. We introduce ObjectForesight, a 3D object-centric dynamics model that predicts future 6-DoF poses and trajectories of rigid objects from short egocentric video sequences. Unlike conventional world or dynamics models that operate in pixel or latent space, ObjectForesight represents the world explicitly in 3D at the object level, enabling geometrically grounded and temporally coherent predictions that capture object affordances and trajectories. To train such a model at scale, we leverage recent advances in segmentation, mesh reconstruction, and 3D pose estimation to curate a dataset of 2 million plus short clips with pseudo-ground-truth 3D object trajectories. Through extensive experiments, we show that ObjectForesight achieves significant gains in accuracy, geometric consistency, and generalization to unseen objects and scenes, establishing a scalable framework for learning physically grounded, object-centric dynamics models directly from observation. objectforesight.github.io

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为ObjectForesight的3D物体中心动力学模型，能够根据短视频序列预测刚性物体的未来6-DoF姿态和轨迹，显著提高了预测的准确性、几何一致性以及泛化能力。
AI.motivation: 使计算系统具备像人类一样预测物体运动和变化的能力，直接从被动视觉观察中实现。
AI.method: 开发了一个3D物体中心动力学模型ObjectForesight，该模型显式地以3D物体为中心表示世界，能够进行几何基础和时间连贯的预测。利用先进的分割、网格重建和3D姿态估计技术，构建了一个包含200万+短视频剪辑及其伪地面真实3D物体轨迹的数据集进行训练。
AI.result: ObjectForesight在准确性、几何一致性以及对未见过的物体和场景的泛化能力方面取得了显著提升。
AI.conclusion: ObjectForesight建立了一个可扩展的框架，能够直接从观察中学习物理基础的、以物体为中心的动力学模型。

title: Mind2Report: A Cognitive Deep Research Agent for Expert-Level Commercial Report Synthesis
summary: Synthesizing informative commercial reports from massive and noisy web sources is critical for high-stakes business decisions. Although current deep research agents achieve notable progress, their reports still remain limited in terms of quality, reliability, and coverage. In this work, we propose Mind2Report, a cognitive deep research agent that emulates the commercial analyst to synthesize expert-level reports. Specifically, it first probes fine-grained intent, then searches web sources and records distilled information on the fly, and subsequently iteratively synthesizes the report. We design Mind2Report as a training-free agentic workflow that augments general large language models (LLMs) with dynamic memory to support these long-form cognitive processes. To rigorously evaluate Mind2Report, we further construct QRC-Eval comprising 200 real-world commercial tasks and establish a holistic evaluation strategy to assess report quality, reliability, and coverage. Experiments demonstrate that Mind2Report outperforms leading baselines, including OpenAI and Gemini deep research agents. Although this is a preliminary study, we expect it to serve as a foundation for advancing the future design of commercial deep research agents. Our code and data are available at https://github.com/Melmaphother/Mind2Report.

AI.tldr: Mind2Report 是一个无需训练的认知型深度研究代理，它通过模仿商业分析师来生成高质量、可靠且全面的商业报告，优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 现有深度研究代理生成的商业报告在质量、可靠性和覆盖范围上存在局限，无法满足高风险商业决策的需求。
AI.method: Mind2Report 采用一种训练免费的代理工作流，首先解析细粒度意图，然后在网络上搜索并实时提取信息，接着迭代地合成报告。它通过为大型语言模型（LLMs）增加动态内存来支持长篇幅的认知过程。
AI.result: Mind2Report 在 QRC-Eval（包含 200 个真实商业任务）的评估中，在报告质量、可靠性和覆盖范围方面优于包括 OpenAI 和 Gemini 在内的领先基线。
AI.conclusion: Mind2Report 作为一个初步研究，展示了其在生成专家级商业报告方面的潜力，并有望为未来商业深度研究代理的设计奠定基础。

title: Flexible Manufacturing Systems Intralogistics: Dynamic Optimization of AGVs and Tool Sharing Using Coloured-Timed Petri Nets and Actor-Critic RL with Actions Masking
summary: Flexible Manufacturing Systems (FMS) are pivotal in optimizing production processes in today's rapidly evolving manufacturing landscape. This paper advances the traditional job shop scheduling problem by incorporating additional complexities through the simultaneous integration of automated guided vehicles (AGVs) and tool-sharing systems. We propose a novel approach that combines Colored-Timed Petri Nets (CTPNs) with actor-critic model-based reinforcement learning (MBRL), effectively addressing the multifaceted challenges associated with FMS. CTPNs provide a formal modeling structure and dynamic action masking, significantly reducing the action search space, while MBRL ensures adaptability to changing environments through the learned policy. Leveraging the advantages of MBRL, we incorporate a lookahead strategy for optimal positioning of AGVs, improving operational efficiency. Our approach was evaluated on small-sized public benchmarks and a newly developed large-scale benchmark inspired by the Taillard benchmark. The results show that our approach matches traditional methods on smaller instances and outperforms them on larger ones in terms of makespan while achieving a tenfold reduction in computation time. To ensure reproducibility, we propose a gym-compatible environment and an instance generator. Additionally, an ablation study evaluates the contribution of each framework component to its overall performance.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种结合彩色时序 Petri 网（CTPN）和基于模型强化学习（MBRL）的新方法，用于解决集成自动化导引车（AGV）和工具共享系统的柔性制造系统（FMS）调度问题，该方法在保证精度的同时显著缩短了计算时间。
AI.motivation: 传统作业车间调度问题在实际生产中存在局限性，本研究旨在通过同时集成AGV和工具共享系统来解决更复杂的FMS调度问题。
AI.method: 研究者提出了一个结合CTPN和actor-critic MBRL的新方法。CTPN用于建模和提供动态动作掩码以减小动作空间，MBRL用于适应环境变化并通过学习到的策略进行调度。此外，还引入了AGV最优定位的前瞻策略。
AI.result: 该方法在小型公开基准和新开发的超大型基准上进行了评估。结果表明，该方法在小规模实例上表现与传统方法相当，但在大规模实例上，其在完工时间（makespan）方面优于传统方法，同时计算时间减少了十倍。
AI.conclusion: 本研究提出的CTPN与MBRL相结合的方法能够有效地解决复杂的FMS调度问题，并在效率和计算时间方面均表现出优势。为保证可复现性，研究者提供了一个gym兼容的环境和实例生成器，并通过消融研究验证了各个组件的贡献。

title: CuMA: Aligning LLMs with Sparse Cultural Values via Demographic-Aware Mixture of Adapters
summary: As Large Language Models (LLMs) serve a global audience, alignment must transition from enforcing universal consensus to respecting cultural pluralism. We demonstrate that dense models, when forced to fit conflicting value distributions, suffer from \textbf{Mean Collapse}, converging to a generic average that fails to represent diverse groups. We attribute this to \textbf{Cultural Sparsity}, where gradient interference prevents dense parameters from spanning distinct cultural modes. To resolve this, we propose \textbf{\textsc{CuMA}} (\textbf{Cu}ltural \textbf{M}ixture of \textbf{A}dapters), a framework that frames alignment as a \textbf{conditional capacity separation} problem. By incorporating demographic-aware routing, \textsc{CuMA} internalizes a \textit{Latent Cultural Topology} to explicitly disentangle conflicting gradients into specialized expert subspaces. Extensive evaluations on WorldValuesBench, Community Alignment, and PRISM demonstrate that \textsc{CuMA} achieves state-of-the-art performance, significantly outperforming both dense baselines and semantic-only MoEs. Crucially, our analysis confirms that \textsc{CuMA} effectively mitigates mean collapse, preserving cultural diversity. Our code is available at https://github.com/Throll/CuMA.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为 CuMA 的新框架，通过分解和隔离不同文化背景下的对齐梯度，解决了大型语言模型（LLM）在面对多元文化价值观时出现的“均值坍塌”问题，显著提升了模型对不同文化群体的代表性。
AI.motivation: 随着 LLM 面临全球用户，需要将对齐方式从强制统一共识转变为尊重文化多元性。然而，现有模型在处理冲突价值观时会面临“均值坍塌”问题，即模型倾向于一个无法代表任何特定群体的通用平均值。
AI.method: 提出 CuMA (Cultural Mixture of Adapters) 框架，将对齐视为一个“条件容量分离”问题。该框架通过引入感知人口统计信息的路由机制，内化“潜在文化拓扑”，将冲突的梯度显式地分解到专门的专家子空间中。
AI.result: 在 WorldValuesBench、Community Alignment 和 PRISM 等基准测试中，CuMA 取得了最先进的性能，显著优于密集模型基线和仅基于语义的混合专家模型（MoEs）。分析证实 CuMA 有效缓解了均值坍塌，保留了文化多样性。
AI.conclusion: CuMA 框架成功地解决了 LLM 在多元文化对齐中的挑战，通过条件容量分离有效保留了文化多样性，为构建更具包容性的 LLM 提供了新的解决方案。

title: SmartSearch: Process Reward-Guided Query Refinement for Search Agents
summary: Large language model (LLM)-based search agents have proven promising for addressing knowledge-intensive problems by incorporating information retrieval capabilities. Existing works largely focus on optimizing the reasoning paradigms of search agents, yet the quality of intermediate search queries during reasoning remains overlooked. As a result, the generated queries often remain inaccurate, leading to unexpected retrieval results and ultimately limiting search agents' overall effectiveness. To mitigate this issue, we introduce SmartSearch, a framework built upon two key mechanisms: (1) Process rewards, which provide fine-grained supervision for the quality of each intermediate search query through Dual-Level Credit Assessment. (2) Query refinement, which promotes the optimization of query generation by selectively refining low-quality search queries and regenerating subsequent search rounds based on these refinements. To enable the search agent to progressively internalize the ability to improve query quality under the guidance of process rewards, we design a three-stage curriculum learning framework. This framework guides the agent through a progression from imitation, to alignment, and ultimately to generalization. Experimental results show that SmartSearch consistently surpasses existing baselines, and additional quantitative analyses further confirm its significant gains in both search efficiency and query quality. The code is available at https://github.com/MYVAE/SmartSearch.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为SmartSearch的框架，通过引入过程奖励和查询精炼机制，来提升大型语言模型（LLM）搜索代理生成中间搜索查询的质量，从而提高搜索效率和效果。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM搜索代理在推理范式上进行了大量优化，但忽略了中间搜索查询的质量，导致生成查询不准确，检索结果不理想，限制了搜索代理的整体有效性。
AI.method: SmartSearch框架包含两个核心机制：1. 过程奖励：通过双层信用评估，为每个中间搜索查询提供细粒度的监督。2. 查询精炼：选择性地精炼低质量的搜索查询，并基于精炼结果重新生成后续搜索轮次，以优化查询生成。此外，还设计了一个三阶段的课程学习框架（模仿、对齐、泛化），引导代理学习和内化提升查询质量的能力。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，SmartSearch在搜索效率和查询质量方面均显著优于现有基线方法。
AI.conclusion: SmartSearch通过改进中间搜索查询的生成质量，有效提升了LLM搜索代理在知识密集型问题上的表现，并取得了显著的搜索效率和查询质量的提升。

title: Plenoptic Video Generation
summary: Camera-controlled generative video re-rendering methods, such as ReCamMaster, have achieved remarkable progress. However, despite their success in single-view setting, these works often struggle to maintain consistency across multi-view scenarios. Ensuring spatio-temporal coherence in hallucinated regions remains challenging due to the inherent stochasticity of generative models. To address it, we introduce PlenopticDreamer, a framework that synchronizes generative hallucinations to maintain spatio-temporal memory. The core idea is to train a multi-in-single-out video-conditioned model in an autoregressive manner, aided by a camera-guided video retrieval strategy that adaptively selects salient videos from previous generations as conditional inputs. In addition, Our training incorporates progressive context-scaling to improve convergence, self-conditioning to enhance robustness against long-range visual degradation caused by error accumulation, and a long-video conditioning mechanism to support extended video generation. Extensive experiments on the Basic and Agibot benchmarks demonstrate that PlenopticDreamer achieves state-of-the-art video re-rendering, delivering superior view synchronization, high-fidelity visuals, accurate camera control, and diverse view transformations (e.g., third-person to third-person, and head-view to gripper-view in robotic manipulation). Project page: https://research.nvidia.com/labs/dir/plenopticdreamer/

AI.tldr: PlenopticDreamer是一个新的框架，通过同步生成性幻觉来解决多视角视频重新渲染中的时空一致性问题，并取得了最先进的成果。
AI.motivation: 现有的单视角视频重新渲染方法在多视角场景下难以保持时空一致性，尤其是在生成区域。这是由于生成模型的固有随机性。
AI.method: PlenopticDreamer训练一个多输入单输出的视频条件模型，采用自回归方式。它结合了相机引导的视频检索策略，以适应性地从先前生成的内容中选择重要的视频作为条件输入。此外，它还采用了渐进式上下文缩放、自条件化和长视频条件机制来提高收敛性、鲁棒性和生成能力。
AI.result: 在Basic和Agibot基准测试上，PlenopticDreamer在视频重新渲染方面取得了最先进的性能，在视角同步、视觉保真度、相机控制和视角转换（如第三人称到第三人称，头部视角到机器人操作夹爪视角）方面表现优异。
AI.conclusion: PlenopticDreamer通过同步生成性幻觉，成功解决了多视角视频重新渲染中的时空一致性挑战，并在多个方面实现了最先进的性能。

title: Faithful Summarisation under Disagreement via Belief-Level Aggregation
summary: Opinion and multi-document summarisation often involve genuinely conflicting viewpoints, yet many existing approaches, particularly LLM-based systems, implicitly smooth disagreement and over-represent majority opinions. This limits the faithfulness of generated summaries in opinion-heavy settings. We introduce a disagreement-aware synthesis pipeline that separates belief-level aggregation from language generation. Documents are first represented as structured belief sets and aggregated using distance-based belief merging operators that explicitly model conflict. Large language models are then used only to realise the aggregated beliefs as natural language summaries. We evaluate the approach across multiple model families and scales, comparing it to methods that perform explicit aggregation during generation. Our results show that while sufficiently large models can match belief-level aggregation when aggregation is handled at generation time, this behaviour is not stable across architectures or capacities. In contrast, belief-level aggregation combined with simple prompting yields consistently strong disagreement-aware performance across models, while maintaining fluent and grounded summaries.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种分离信念聚合与语言生成过程的、能够意识到分歧的摘要生成方法，该方法通过显式建模冲突来处理多文档摘要中的意见分歧，并在多项实验中表现出比现有方法更稳定和更强的分歧感知能力。
AI.motivation: 现有的意见和多文档摘要方法（尤其是基于 LLM 的方法）倾向于平滑分歧并过度代表多数意见，这限制了摘要在意见密集场景下的忠实度。
AI.method: 该方法首先将文档表示为结构化的信念集，然后使用距离基的信念合并算子（显式地建模冲突）进行聚合。最后，利用大型语言模型将聚合后的信念转化为自然语言摘要。将这种方法与在生成过程中进行显式聚合的方法进行了比较。
AI.result: 研究结果表明，足够大的模型在生成时处理聚合时可以匹配信念级聚合，但这种行为在不同架构或容量之间不稳定。相比之下，信念级聚合结合简单的提示，在各种模型上都能持续提供强大的分歧感知性能，同时保持流畅和有依据的摘要。
AI.conclusion: 信念级聚合与语言生成的分离是实现稳定、分歧感知摘要生成的一种有效策略，优于在生成过程中处理聚合的方法，尤其是在模型能力变化的情况下。

title: GREx: Generalized Referring Expression Segmentation, Comprehension, and Generation
summary: Referring Expression Segmentation (RES) and Comprehension (REC) respectively segment and detect the object described by an expression, while Referring Expression Generation (REG) generates an expression for the selected object. Existing datasets and methods commonly support single-target expressions only, i.e., one expression refers to one object, not considering multi-target and no-target expressions. This greatly limits the real applications of REx (RES/REC/REG).
