This paper introduces three new benchmarks called Generalized Referring Expression Segmentation (GRES), Comprehension (GREC), and Generation (GREG), collectively denoted as GREx, which extend the classic REx to allow expressions to identify an arbitrary number of objects. We construct the first large-scale GREx dataset gRefCOCO that contains multi-target, no-target, and single-target expressions and their corresponding images with labeled targets. GREx and gRefCOCO are designed to be backward-compatible with REx, facilitating extensive experiments to study the performance gap of the existing REx methods on GREx tasks. One of the challenges of GRES/GREC is complex relationship modeling, for which we propose a baseline ReLA that adaptively divides the image into regions with sub-instance clues and explicitly models the region-region and region-language dependencies. The proposed ReLA achieves the state-of-the-art results on the both GRES and GREC tasks. The proposed gRefCOCO dataset and method are available at https://henghuiding.github.io/GREx.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了用于处理多目标、无目标和单目标指代表达的新基准（GRES, GREC, GREG）和大规模数据集（gRefCOCO），并提出了一个名为ReLA的基线模型来解决复杂关系建模的挑战，并在GRES和GREC任务上取得了最先进的成果。
AI.motivation: 现有指代表达分割（RES）、理解（REC）和生成（REG）方法和数据集通常仅支持单目标表达，限制了其在实际应用中的潜力。因此，需要扩展到支持多目标和无目标表达。
AI.method: 提出了广义指代表达分割（GRES）、理解（GREC）和生成（GREG）的新任务，并构建了一个包含多目标、无目标和单目标表达的大规模数据集gRefCOCO。为了解决GRES/GREC中的复杂关系建模问题，提出了一种名为ReLA的基线模型，该模型能够将图像划分为具有子实例线索的区域，并显式地建模区域-区域和区域-语言依赖关系。
AI.result: 在GRES和GREC任务上，所提出的ReLA模型均达到了最先进的性能。gRefCOCO数据集包含了多目标、无目标和单目标表达及其对应的图像标注。
AI.conclusion: 提出的GREx任务、gRefCOCO数据集和ReLA模型为处理更广泛的指代表达场景提供了新的研究方向和工具，并证明了其在解决复杂关系建模方面的有效性。

title: DVD: A Robust Method for Detecting Variant Contamination in Large Language Model Evaluation
summary: Evaluating large language models (LLMs) is increasingly confounded by \emph{variant contamination}: the training corpus contains semantically equivalent yet lexically or syntactically altered versions of test items. Unlike verbatim leakage, these paraphrased or structurally transformed variants evade existing detectors based on sampling consistency or perplexity, thereby inflating benchmark scores via memorization rather than genuine reasoning. We formalize this problem and introduce \textbf{DVD} (\textbf{D}etection via \textbf{V}ariance of generation \textbf{D}istribution), a single-sample detector that models the local output distribution induced by temperature sampling. Our key insight is that contaminated items trigger alternation between a \emph{memory-adherence} state and a \emph{perturbation-drift} state, yielding abnormally high variance in the synthetic difficulty of low-probability tokens; uncontaminated items remain in drift with comparatively smooth variance. We construct the first benchmark for variant contamination across two domains Omni-MATH and SuperGPQA by generating and filtering semantically equivalent variants, and simulate contamination via fine-tuning models of different scales and architectures (Qwen2.5 and Llama3.1). Across datasets and models, \textbf{DVD} consistently outperforms perplexity-based, Min-$k$\%++, edit-distance (CDD), and embedding-similarity baselines, while exhibiting strong robustness to hyperparameters. Our results establish variance of the generation distribution as a principled and practical fingerprint for detecting variant contamination in LLM evaluation.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种名为 DVD 的新方法来检测大型语言模型（LLM）评估中的变体污染问题。变体污染是指训练数据包含与测试集语义相同但表达不同的内容，这会虚高模型性能。DVD 方法通过分析模型在不同温度采样下的输出分布方差来检测这种污染。
AI.motivation: 现有的 LLM 评估方法无法有效检测变体污染，即训练数据中包含与测试集语义相同但表达不同的内容（例如，释义或结构变换）。这种污染会通过模型记忆而非真正推理来提高性能，导致评估分数虚高。
AI.method: 研究人员提出了一种名为 DVD（Detection via Variance of generation Distribution）的单样本检测器。该方法通过模拟温度采样，建模局部输出分布，并分析生成分布的方差。核心思想是，污染过的样本会在“记忆依从”状态和“扰动漂移”状态之间切换，导致低概率 token 的合成难度出现异常高的方差；未污染的样本则保持相对平滑的方差。
AI.result: 研究人员构建了 Omni-MATH 和 SuperGPQA 两个基准数据集来测试变体污染，并模拟了不同规模和架构的模型（Qwen2.5 和 Llama3.1）的污染情况。实验结果表明，DVD 方法在检测变体污染方面 consistently 优于基于困惑度、Min-k%++、编辑距离（CDD）和嵌入相似度的基线方法，并且对超参数具有良好的鲁棒性。
AI.conclusion: 生成分布的方差可以作为检测 LLM 评估中变体污染的原则性且实用的方法。DVD 提供了一种有效且通用的解决方案来解决这一日益严峻的评估挑战。

title: Pixel-Perfect Visual Geometry Estimation
summary: Recovering clean and accurate geometry from images is essential for robotics and augmented reality. However, existing geometry foundation models still suffer severely from flying pixels and the loss of fine details. In this paper, we present pixel-perfect visual geometry models that can predict high-quality, flying-pixel-free point clouds by leveraging generative modeling in the pixel space. We first introduce Pixel-Perfect Depth (PPD), a monocular depth foundation model built upon pixel-space diffusion transformers (DiT). To address the high computational complexity associated with pixel-space diffusion, we propose two key designs: 1) Semantics-Prompted DiT, which incorporates semantic representations from vision foundation models to prompt the diffusion process, preserving global semantics while enhancing fine-grained visual details; and 2) Cascade DiT architecture that progressively increases the number of image tokens, improving both efficiency and accuracy. To further extend PPD to video (PPVD), we introduce a new Semantics-Consistent DiT, which extracts temporally consistent semantics from a multi-view geometry foundation model. We then perform reference-guided token propagation within the DiT to maintain temporal coherence with minimal computational and memory overhead. Our models achieve the best performance among all generative monocular and video depth estimation models and produce significantly cleaner point clouds than all other models.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了Pixel-Perfect视觉几何模型（PPD和PPVD），利用像素空间生成模型（扩散Transformer）来生成高质量、无飞点、细节丰富的点云，解决了现有模型的不足。
AI.motivation: 现有几何基础模型在从图像恢复几何信息时存在飞点和细节丢失的问题，因此需要更精确、更完整的几何恢复方法。
AI.method: 1. 提出Pixel-Perfect Depth (PPD)，一种基于像素空间扩散Transformer (DiT)的单目深度基础模型。2. 针对DiT的计算复杂度问题，提出Semantics-Prompted DiT（利用视觉基础模型的语义信息引导扩散过程）和Cascade DiT架构（逐步增加图像token数量）。3. 提出PPVD，通过Semantics-Consistent DiT（提取多视图几何基础模型中的时序一致语义）和参考引导的token传播来扩展到视频深度估计。
AI.result: PPD和PPVD在单目和视频深度估计任务上取得了最佳性能，生成的点云比其他模型更干净。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的Pixel-Perfect视觉几何模型通过创新的像素空间生成技术，能够显著提高几何恢复的质量和准确性，尤其在细节保留和飞点去除方面表现优异。

title: V-FAT: Benchmarking Visual Fidelity Against Text-bias
summary: Recent advancements in Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have demonstrated impressive performance on standard visual reasoning benchmarks. However, there is growing concern that these models rely excessively on linguistic shortcuts rather than genuine visual grounding, a phenomenon we term Text Bias. In this paper, we investigate the fundamental tension between visual perception and linguistic priors. We decouple the sources of this bias into two dimensions: Internal Corpus Bias, stemming from statistical correlations in pretraining, and External Instruction Bias, arising from the alignment-induced tendency toward sycophancy. To quantify this effect, we introduce V-FAT (Visual Fidelity Against Text-bias), a diagnostic benchmark comprising 4,026 VQA instances across six semantic domains. V-FAT employs a Three-Level Evaluation Framework that systematically increases the conflict between visual evidence and textual information: (L1) internal bias from atypical images, (L2) external bias from misleading instructions, and (L3) synergistic bias where both coincide. We introduce the Visual Robustness Score (VRS), a metric designed to penalize "lucky" linguistic guesses and reward true visual fidelity. Our evaluation of 12 frontier MLLMs reveals that while models excel in existing benchmarks, they experience significant visual collapse under high linguistic dominance.

AI.tldr: 本研究揭示了多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）存在“文本偏见”问题，即模型过度依赖语言线索而非真实视觉信息。研究提出了V-FAT基准测试和VRS评估指标，以量化和分析这种偏见，并发现现有前沿模型在面对高文本主导性时，视觉能力会显著下降。
AI.motivation: 研究者发现，尽管MLLMs在视觉推理任务上表现出色，但它们可能依赖语言捷径而非真正的视觉理解。这种“文本偏见”现象引起了对模型泛化能力和可靠性的担忧，促使研究者深入探究和量化这种偏见。
AI.method: 该研究将文本偏见分解为“内部语料库偏见”（来自预训练的统计相关性）和“外部指令偏见”（来自对齐过程中的谄媚倾向）。为了量化这种偏见，研究者开发了一个名为V-FAT（Visual Fidelity Against Text-bias）的诊断基准，包含4026个跨越六个语义领域的问题。V-FAT采用三级评估框架，逐步增加视觉证据与文本信息之间的冲突。此外，研究者引入了视觉鲁棒性得分（VRS）指标，以惩罚“幸运”的语言猜测并奖励真正的视觉保真度。
AI.result: 对12个前沿MLLMs的评估表明，尽管这些模型在现有基准上表现优异，但在高文本主导性的情况下，它们的视觉能力会显著下降。这表明它们在很大程度上依赖于文本线索，而非真正理解视觉内容。
AI.conclusion: MLLMs普遍存在文本偏见，其视觉能力在面对文本与视觉信息冲突时会严重受损。V-FAT基准和VRS指标是有效评估和揭示这一问题的工具。研究结果强调了开发更具视觉鲁棒性的MLLMs的必要性。

title: From Stories to Cities to Games: A Qualitative Evaluation of Behaviour Planning
summary: The primary objective of a diverse planning approach is to generate a set of plans that are distinct from one another. Such an approach is applied in a variety of real-world domains, including risk management, automated stream data analysis, and malware detection. More recently, a novel diverse planning paradigm, referred to as behaviour planning, has been proposed. This approach extends earlier methods by explicitly incorporating a diversity model into the planning process and supporting multiple planning categories. In this paper, we demonstrate the usefulness of behaviour planning in real-world settings by presenting three case studies. The first case study focuses on storytelling, the second addresses urban planning, and the third examines game evaluation.

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了行为规划这一新颖的多样化规划方法，并通过三个现实世界的案例研究（故事创作、城市规划和游戏评估）展示了其有效性。
AI.motivation: 现有多样化规划方法在一些领域（如风险管理、流数据分析、恶意软件检测）中得到了应用，但行为规划作为一种更先进的方法，通过显式包含多样性模型和支持多类别规划，进一步扩展了早期方法。
AI.method: 本文提出并应用了行为规划的方法。通过三个案例研究来展示其在现实世界中的应用：1. 故事创作；2. 城市规划；3. 游戏评估。
AI.result: 通过三个案例研究，证明了行为规划在现实世界场景下的实用性和有效性。
AI.conclusion: 行为规划是一种有用的多样化规划方法，在故事创作、城市规划和游戏评估等实际应用中表现出良好的潜力。

title: RL-AWB: Deep Reinforcement Learning for Auto White Balance Correction in Low-Light Night-time Scenes
summary: Nighttime color constancy remains a challenging problem in computational photography due to low-light noise and complex illumination conditions. We present RL-AWB, a novel framework combining statistical methods with deep reinforcement learning for nighttime white balance. Our method begins with a statistical algorithm tailored for nighttime scenes, integrating salient gray pixel detection with novel illumination estimation. Building on this foundation, we develop the first deep reinforcement learning approach for color constancy that leverages the statistical algorithm as its core, mimicking professional AWB tuning experts by dynamically optimizing parameters for each image. To facilitate cross-sensor evaluation, we introduce the first multi-sensor nighttime dataset. Experiment results demonstrate that our method achieves superior generalization capability across low-light and well-illuminated images. Project page: https://ntuneillee.github.io/research/rl-awb/

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为RL-AWB的新框架，结合统计方法和深度强化学习来解决夜间白平衡问题。
AI.motivation: 夜间色彩恒常性是一个具有挑战性的问题，因为低光照下的噪声和复杂的光照条件。
AI.method: RL-AWB框架首先使用一种针对夜间场景的统计算法，包括显著灰度像素检测和新颖的光照估计。在此基础上，开发了一种基于深度强化学习的方法，该方法以统计算法为核心，通过动态优化参数来模拟专业AWB调整专家的行为。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，所提出的方法在低光照和光照良好的图像上均具有优越的泛化能力。此外，还引入了一个首个多传感器夜间数据集，用于跨传感器评估。
AI.conclusion: RL-AWB框架能够有效地解决夜间白平衡问题，并通过深度强化学习进一步提升了性能，同时解决了夜间色彩恒常性中的关键挑战。

title: Can AI-Generated Persuasion Be Detected? Persuaficial Benchmark and AI vs. Human Linguistic Differences
comment: Preprint; Paper is currently under review at a major NLP conference
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) can generate highly persuasive text, raising concerns about their misuse for propaganda, manipulation, and other harmful purposes. This leads us to our central question: Is LLM-generated persuasion more difficult to automatically detect than human-written persuasion? To address this, we categorize controllable generation approaches for producing persuasive content with LLMs and introduce Persuaficial, a high-quality multilingual benchmark covering six languages: English, German, Polish, Italian, French and Russian. Using this benchmark, we conduct extensive empirical evaluations comparing human-authored and LLM-generated persuasive texts. We find that although overtly persuasive LLM-generated texts can be easier to detect than human-written ones, subtle LLM-generated persuasion consistently degrades automatic detection performance. Beyond detection performance, we provide the first comprehensive linguistic analysis contrasting human and LLM-generated persuasive texts, offering insights that may guide the development of more interpretable and robust detection tools.

AI.tldr: 研究人员评估了自动检测大型语言模型（LLM）生成的说服性文本的难度，并提出了一个包含六种语言的多语言基准（Persuaficial），结果表明细微的LLM生成说服性文本会显著降低检测性能，并提供了人与LLM生成说服性文本之间的语言学对比分析。
AI.motivation: 由于大型语言模型（LLM）生成的文本具有高度说服性，可能被用于不良目的，因此研究其可检测性至关重要。
AI.method: 研究人员开发了一种控制LLM生成说服性内容的方法，并构建了一个名为Persuaficial的多语言基准，然后通过实证评估比较了人类和LLM生成的说服性文本的自动检测性能，并进行了语言学分析。
AI.result: 研究发现，明显的LLM生成说服性文本比人类编写的更容易检测，但细微的LLM生成说服性文本会显著降低自动检测的性能。
AI.conclusion: LLM生成的细微说服性文本对自动检测提出了挑战，并且对人类和LLM生成说服性文本的语言学分析可以为开发更鲁棒的检测工具提供指导。

title: What Students Ask, How a Generative AI Assistant Responds: Exploring Higher Education Students' Dialogues on Learning Analytics Feedback
summary: Learning analytics dashboards (LADs) aim to support students' regulation of learning by translating complex data into feedback. Yet students, especially those with lower self-regulated learning (SRL) competence, often struggle to engage with and interpret analytics feedback. Conversational generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) assistants have shown potential to scaffold this process through real-time, personalised, dialogue-based support. Further advancing this potential, we explored authentic dialogues between students and GenAI assistant integrated into LAD during a 10-week semester. The analysis focused on questions students with different SRL levels posed, the relevance and quality of the assistant's answers, and how students perceived the assistant's role in their learning. Findings revealed distinct query patterns. While low SRL students sought clarification and reassurance, high SRL students queried technical aspects and requested personalised strategies. The assistant provided clear and reliable explanations but limited in personalisation, handling emotionally charged queries, and integrating multiple data points for tailored responses. Findings further extend that GenAI interventions can be especially valuable for low SRL students, offering scaffolding that supports engagement with feedback and narrows gaps with their higher SRL peers. At the same time, students' reflections underscored the importance of trust, need for greater adaptivity, context-awareness, and technical refinement in future systems.

AI.tldr: 本研究将生成式AI助手集成到学习分析仪表板（LAD）中，以支持学生学习过程中的自我调节。结果表明，AI助手能够为学生提供个性化的支持，尤其对自我调节能力较低的学生有显著帮助，但仍需在个性化、情感支持和数据整合方面进行改进。
AI.motivation: 学生，特别是自我调节学习（SRL）能力较低的学生，在理解和利用学习分析仪表板（LAD）提供的反馈方面存在困难。对话式生成式AI（GenAI）助手有潜力通过实时、个性化的对话支持来弥补这一差距。
AI.method: 研究将GenAI助手集成到LAD中，并在为期10周的学期中进行了真实的学生与AI助手的对话分析。分析内容包括不同SRL水平学生提出的问题、AI助手的回答质量和相关性，以及学生对AI助手的看法。研究还收集了学生对未来系统的反馈。
AI.result: 研究发现，低SRL学生倾向于寻求澄清和安慰，而高SRL学生则更关注技术细节和个性化策略。AI助手在解释清晰度和可靠性方面表现良好，但在个性化、处理情感问题和整合多数据点以提供定制化回复方面存在局限。GenAI干预对低SRL学生特别有价值，有助于提高他们对反馈的参与度，缩小与高SRL学生的差距。
AI.conclusion: GenAI助手集成到LAD中能够为学生提供有价值的学习支持，特别是对SRL能力较低的学生。然而，未来的系统需要在信任度、适应性、情境感知和技术细节方面进行优化，以提供更有效的支持。

title: GenProve: Learning to Generate Text with Fine-Grained Provenance
summary: Large language models (LLM) often hallucinate, and while adding citations is a common solution, it is frequently insufficient for accountability as users struggle to verify how a cited source supports a generated claim. Existing methods are typically coarse-grained and fail to distinguish between direct quotes and complex reasoning. In this paper, we introduce Generation-time Fine-grained Provenance, a task where models must generate fluent answers while simultaneously producing structured, sentence-level provenance triples. To enable this, we present ReFInE (Relation-aware Fine-grained Interpretability & Evidence), a dataset featuring expert verified annotations that distinguish between Quotation, Compression, and Inference. Building on ReFInE, we propose GenProve, a framework that combines Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) with Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO). By optimizing a composite reward for answer fidelity and provenance correctness, GenProve significantly outperforms 14 strong LLMs in joint evaluation. Crucially, our analysis uncovers a reasoning gap where models excel at surface-level quotation but struggle significantly with inference-based provenance, suggesting that verifiable reasoning remains a frontier challenge distinct from surface-level citation.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为GenProve的框架，通过生成时细粒度溯源（Generation-time Fine-grained Provenance）来解决大型语言模型的幻觉问题，并引入了一个包含引用、压缩和推理三种类型证据的ReFInE数据集。GenProve结合了监督微调和组相对策略优化，在答案准确性和溯源正确性方面取得了显著优于现有方法的性能，但同时也揭示了模型在基于推理的溯源方面存在挑战。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLM）幻觉问题普遍，而仅添加引用不足以保证问责性，用户难以核实引用来源与生成内容的关联。现有方法粒度粗糙，无法区分直接引用和复杂推理。
AI.method: 提出Generation-time Fine-grained Provenance任务，模型需生成流畅答案并同步产生结构化的、句子级别的溯源三元组。构建ReFInE数据集，包含专家验证的引用、压缩和推理类型证据。提出GenProve框架，结合监督微调（SFT）和组相对策略优化（GRPO），通过优化答案保真度和溯源正确性的复合奖励。
AI.result: GenProve在联合评估中显著优于14个强大的LLM。研究发现模型擅长表面级引用，但难以处理基于推理的溯源。
AI.conclusion: 可验证的推理是大型语言模型面临的一个前沿挑战，与表面级引用不同。ReFInE数据集和GenProve框架为解决细粒度溯源问题提供了新的方向和有效的解决方案，但也指出了模型在理解和生成推理型证据方面的不足。

title: SCALER:Synthetic Scalable Adaptive Learning Environment for Reasoning
summary: Reinforcement learning (RL) offers a principled way to enhance the reasoning capabilities of large language models, yet its effectiveness hinges on training signals that remain informative as models evolve. In practice, RL progress often slows when task difficulty becomes poorly aligned with model capability, or when training is dominated by a narrow set of recurring problem patterns. To jointly address these issues, we propose SCALER (Synthetic sCalable Adaptive Learning Environment for Reasoning), a framework that sustains effective learning signals through adaptive environment design. SCALER introduces a scalable synthesis pipeline that converts real-world programming problems into verifiable reasoning environments with controllable difficulty and unbounded instance generation, enabling RL training beyond finite datasets while preserving strong correctness guarantees. Building on this, SCALER further employs an adaptive multi-environment RL strategy that dynamically adjusts instance difficulty and curates the active set of environments to track the model's capability frontier and maintain distributional diversity. This co-adaptation prevents reward sparsity, mitigates overfitting to narrow task patterns, and supports sustained improvement throughout training. Extensive experiments show that SCALER consistently outperforms dataset-based RL baselines across diverse reasoning benchmarks and exhibits more stable, long-horizon training dynamics.

AI.tldr: SCALER是一个用于强化学习（RL）训练大型语言模型（LLM）的框架，通过自适应环境设计来提供持续有效的训练信号，解决了LLM在RL训练中遇到的挑战，如任务难度与模型能力不匹配以及训练数据模式单一的问题。
AI.motivation: 现有RL训练LLM的方法在模型能力提升过程中，训练信号会因任务难度与模型能力不匹配或训练数据模式单一而变得不具信息量，导致RL训练效果停滞。
AI.method: SCALER通过一个可扩展的合成流水线将真实世界的编程问题转化为可验证的推理环境，并能够控制难度和生成无限量的实例。同时，SCALER采用自适应多环境RL策略，动态调整实例难度并管理环境集合，以追踪模型能力前沿并保持分布多样性。
AI.result: SCALER在多项推理基准测试中，在RL训练的长期稳定性和模型性能方面均优于基于固定数据集的RL基线方法。
AI.conclusion: SCALER通过自适应环境设计有效解决了RL训练LLM中的挑战，实现了持续有效的学习信号，从而提升了模型的推理能力，并展现出更稳定、长期的训练动态。

title: QNeRF: Neural Radiance Fields on a Simulated Gate-Based Quantum Computer
comment: 30 pages, 15 figures, 11 tables; project page: https://4dqv.mpi-inf.mpg.de/QNeRF/
summary: Recently, Quantum Visual Fields (QVFs) have shown promising improvements in model compactness and convergence speed for learning the provided 2D or 3D signals. Meanwhile, novel-view synthesis has seen major advances with Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), where models learn a compact representation from 2D images to render 3D scenes, albeit at the cost of larger models and intensive training. In this work, we extend the approach of QVFs by introducing QNeRF, the first hybrid quantum-classical model designed for novel-view synthesis from 2D images. QNeRF leverages parameterised quantum circuits to encode spatial and view-dependent information via quantum superposition and entanglement, resulting in more compact models compared to the classical counterpart. We present two architectural variants. Full QNeRF maximally exploits all quantum amplitudes to enhance representational capabilities. In contrast, Dual-Branch QNeRF introduces a task-informed inductive bias by branching spatial and view-dependent quantum state preparations, drastically reducing the complexity of this operation and ensuring scalability and potential hardware compatibility. Our experiments demonstrate that -- when trained on images of moderate resolution -- QNeRF matches or outperforms classical NeRF baselines while using less than half the number of parameters. These results suggest that quantum machine learning can serve as a competitive alternative for continuous signal representation in mid-level tasks in computer vision, such as 3D representation learning from 2D observations.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 QNeRF 的混合量子-经典模型，用于从 2D 图像合成新视角，该模型利用参数化量子电路来编码空间和视点相关信息，与经典 NeRF 相比，模型参数更少，性能相当甚至更优。
AI.motivation: 现有 NeRF 模型在新型视图合成方面取得了进展，但模型体积大且训练耗时。QVFs 在模型紧凑性和收敛速度方面表现出潜力。作者希望结合两者的优点，提出一种更紧凑、高效的新型视图合成方法。
AI.method: 提出 QNeRF，一个混合量子-经典模型。利用参数化量子电路通过量子叠加和纠缠来编码空间和视点依赖信息。提出了两种架构变体：全 QNeRF 最大化利用量子振幅；双分支 QNeRF 分支空间和视点依赖的量子态制备，降低复杂性并保证可扩展性。
AI.result: 在对中等分辨率图像进行训练时，QNeRF 的参数量不到经典 NeRF 基线的一半，但性能相当或更优。
AI.conclusion: 量子机器学习可以成为计算机视觉中连续信号表示的有竞争力的替代方案，尤其是在从 2D 观测中学习 3D 表示等中等水平的任务中。

title: Mesh4D: 4D Mesh Reconstruction and Tracking from Monocular Video
summary: We propose Mesh4D, a feed-forward model for monocular 4D mesh reconstruction. Given a monocular video of a dynamic object, our model reconstructs the object's complete 3D shape and motion, represented as a deformation field. Our key contribution is a compact latent space that encodes the entire animation sequence in a single pass. This latent space is learned by an autoencoder that, during training, is guided by the skeletal structure of the training objects, providing strong priors on plausible deformations. Crucially, skeletal information is not required at inference time. The encoder employs spatio-temporal attention, yielding a more stable representation of the object's overall deformation. Building on this representation, we train a latent diffusion model that, conditioned on the input video and the mesh reconstructed from the first frame, predicts the full animation in one shot. We evaluate Mesh4D on reconstruction and novel view synthesis benchmarks, outperforming prior methods in recovering accurate 3D shape and deformation.

AI.tldr: Mesh4D是一个单目4D网格重建模型，能够从单目视频中重建动态物体的3D形状和运动，通过一个紧凑的潜在空间编码整个动画序列。
AI.motivation: 从单目视频中准确地重建动态物体的3D形状和运动是一个具有挑战性的问题。现有方法可能在表示稳定性和动画完整性方面存在不足。
AI.method: Mesh4D使用一个编码器-解码器架构。编码器利用时空注意力机制学习一个紧凑的潜在空间，该空间由一个自编码器学习，并在训练时结合骨骼结构提供先验信息。然后，一个条件化为输入视频和第一帧网格的潜在扩散模型，预测整个动画。
AI.result: Mesh4D在重建和新视角合成基准测试中表现优于现有方法，能够准确地恢复3D形状和变形。
AI.conclusion: Mesh4D能够有效地从单目视频中重建动态物体的4D网格，其关键在于利用骨骼结构作为先验学习一个稳定的、包含完整动画信息的紧凑潜在空间，并通过潜在扩散模型进行单次动画预测。

title: A Unified Spoken Language Model with Injected Emotional-Attribution Thinking for Human-like Interaction
summary: This paper presents a unified spoken language model for emotional intelligence, enhanced by a novel data construction strategy termed Injected Emotional-Attribution Thinking (IEAT). IEAT incorporates user emotional states and their underlying causes into the model's internal reasoning process, enabling emotion-aware reasoning to be internalized rather than treated as explicit supervision. The model is trained with a two-stage progressive strategy. The first stage performs speech-text alignment and emotional attribute modeling via self-distillation, while the second stage conducts end-to-end cross-modal joint optimization to ensure consistency between textual and spoken emotional expressions. Experiments on the Human-like Spoken Dialogue Systems Challenge (HumDial) Emotional Intelligence benchmark demonstrate that the proposed approach achieves top-ranked performance across emotional trajectory modeling, emotional reasoning, and empathetic response generation under both LLM-based and human evaluations.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为IEAT（注入情感归因思维）的新型数据构建策略，用于构建一个统一的、具有情感智能的口语模型。该模型通过自我蒸馏进行语音-文本对齐和情感属性建模，然后进行端到端的跨模态联合优化，以实现情感推理和共情回应。实验结果表明，该方法在情感轨迹建模、情感推理和共情回应生成方面均取得了领先的性能。
AI.motivation: 为了构建一个能够理解和响应用户情感的口语模型，研究者们开发了一种新的数据构建策略（IEAT），旨在将用户的情绪状态及其原因融入模型的内部推理过程，从而实现情感的内化而非显式监督。
AI.method: 该方法采用两阶段的渐进式训练策略。第一阶段，利用自我蒸馏技术实现语音-文本对齐和情感属性建模。第二阶段，进行端到端的跨模态联合优化，以确保文本和口语情感表达之间的一致性。
AI.result: 在HumDial情感智能基准测试上，该模型在情感轨迹建模、情感推理和共情回应生成方面均取得了顶尖的性能，并在基于大型语言模型（LLM）和人类评估中都表现出色。
AI.conclusion: IEAT策略能够有效地增强口语模型的（情感）智能，通过将情感推理内化，实现了在情感轨迹建模、情感推理和共情回应生成等任务上的显著性能提升。

title: Conversational AI for Rapid Scientific Prototyping: A Case Study on ESA's ELOPE Competition
summary: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly used as coding partners, yet their role in accelerating scientific discovery remains underexplored. This paper presents a case study of using ChatGPT for rapid prototyping in ESA's ELOPE (Event-based Lunar OPtical flow Egomotion estimation) competition. The competition required participants to process event camera data to estimate lunar lander trajectories. Despite joining late, we achieved second place with a score of 0.01282, highlighting the potential of human-AI collaboration in competitive scientific settings. ChatGPT contributed not only executable code but also algorithmic reasoning, data handling routines, and methodological suggestions, such as using fixed number of events instead of fixed time spans for windowing. At the same time, we observed limitations: the model often introduced unnecessary structural changes, gets confused by intermediate discussions about alternative ideas, occasionally produced critical errors and forgets important aspects in longer scientific discussions. By analyzing these strengths and shortcomings, we show how conversational AI can both accelerate development and support conceptual insight in scientific research. We argue that structured integration of LLMs into the scientific workflow can enhance rapid prototyping by proposing best practices for AI-assisted scientific work.

AI.tldr: 本研究通过一个在ESA的ELOPE竞赛中使用ChatGPT进行快速原型开发的案例研究，展示了大型语言模型（LLMs）在加速科学发现方面的潜力。研究团队最终获得竞赛第二名，并总结了LLMs在代码生成、算法推理、数据处理和方法建议方面的优势，以及其在结构性修改、处理中间讨论、避免关键错误和维持长期对话方面的局限性，并提出将LLMs结构化整合到科学工作流程中的最佳实践。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）在编码方面应用日益广泛，但其在加速科学发现方面的潜力尚未得到充分探索。
AI.method: 通过一个使用ChatGPT进行快速原型开发的案例研究，分析LLMs在ESA的ELOPE竞赛中的贡献和局限性，并总结其在科学研究工作流中的应用策略。
AI.result: 研究团队利用ChatGPT在ELOPE竞赛中取得第二名（得分0.01282）。ChatGPT在提供可执行代码、算法推理、数据处理和方法建议方面发挥了作用，但也存在结构性修改冗余、易混淆、产生关键错误和遗忘信息等问题。
AI.conclusion: 本研究证明了对话式AI（如ChatGPT）能够加速科学研究的开发过程并支持概念性洞察。通过结构化整合LLMs到科学工作流程中，可以提高快速原型开发的效率，并提出AI辅助科学工作的最佳实践。

title: T-Retriever: Tree-based Hierarchical Retrieval Augmented Generation for Textual Graphs
summary: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) has significantly enhanced Large Language Models' ability to access external knowledge, yet current graph-based RAG approaches face two critical limitations in managing hierarchical information: they impose rigid layer-specific compression quotas that damage local graph structures, and they prioritize topological structure while neglecting semantic content. We introduce T-Retriever, a novel framework that reformulates attributed graph retrieval as tree-based retrieval using a semantic and structure-guided encoding tree. Our approach features two key innovations: (1) Adaptive Compression Encoding, which replaces artificial compression quotas with a global optimization strategy that preserves the graph's natural hierarchical organization, and (2) Semantic-Structural Entropy ($S^2$-Entropy), which jointly optimizes for both structural cohesion and semantic consistency when creating hierarchical partitions. Experiments across diverse graph reasoning benchmarks demonstrate that T-Retriever significantly outperforms state-of-the-art RAG methods, providing more coherent and contextually relevant responses to complex queries.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 T-Retriever 的新方法，用于改进基于图的检索增强生成（RAG），解决了现有方法在处理分层信息时的局限性，通过自适应压缩编码和联合优化语义结构的方法，提高了检索的准确性和生成结果的相关性。
AI.motivation: 现有基于图的 RAG 方法在处理分层信息时存在两个主要问题：1. 强制性的层级压缩配额破坏了局部图结构；2. 过度侧重拓扑结构而忽略了语义内容。
AI.method: 提出 T-Retriever 框架，将属性图检索重构为基于树的检索。核心创新包括：1. 自适应压缩编码（Adaptive Compression Encoding），用全局优化策略替代固定压缩配额，保留图的自然分层组织；2. 语义-结构熵（$S^2$-Entropy），在创建分层分区时，联合优化结构凝聚度和语义一致性。
AI.result: 在多个图推理基准测试中，T-Retriever 的表现显著优于最先进的 RAG 方法，能够为复杂查询提供更连贯、更具上下文相关性的回答。
AI.conclusion: T-Retriever 通过引入创新的编码和分区策略，有效解决了现有图基 RAG 方法在处理分层信息时的不足，提高了知识检索和下游生成任务的性能。

title: Text as a Universal Interface for Transferable Personalization
summary: We study the problem of personalization in large language models (LLMs). Prior work predominantly represents user preferences as implicit, model-specific vectors or parameters, yielding opaque ``black-box'' profiles that are difficult to interpret and transfer across models and tasks. In contrast, we advocate natural language as a universal, model- and task-agnostic interface for preference representation. The formulation leads to interpretable and reusable preference descriptions, while naturally supporting continual evolution as new interactions are observed. To learn such representations, we introduce a two-stage training framework that combines supervised fine-tuning on high-quality synthesized data with reinforcement learning to optimize long-term utility and cross-task transferability. Based on this framework, we develop AlignXplore+, a universal preference reasoning model that generates textual preference summaries. Experiments on nine benchmarks show that our 8B model achieves state-of-the-art performanc -- outperforming substantially larger open-source models -- while exhibiting strong transferability across tasks, model families, and interaction formats.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出使用自然语言来表示大型语言模型（LLMs）的用户偏好，并开发了一个名为AlignXplore+的两阶段训练框架来学习这些表示。结果表明，该方法能够生成可解释且可迁移的偏好摘要，并在多个基准测试中取得了最先进的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有方法将用户偏好表示为模型特定的向量或参数，导致用户画像不透明、难以解释且无法跨模型和任务迁移。研究者希望找到一种更通用、可解释且可迁移的用户偏好表示方法。
AI.method: 研究者提出使用自然语言作为用户偏好的通用接口，并设计了一个两阶段的训练框架：首先使用高质量的合成数据进行监督微调，然后通过强化学习来优化长期效用和跨任务迁移能力。基于此框架，开发了AlignXplore+模型。
AI.result: AlignXplore+模型能够生成文本形式的用户偏好摘要。在九个基准测试上的实验表明，该8B模型性能优于许多更大的开源模型，并表现出强大的跨任务、跨模型家族和跨交互格式的迁移能力。
AI.conclusion: 自然语言可以作为一种通用、模型无关且任务无关的接口来表示用户偏好，这种方法可以生成可解释、可复用且易于持续演进的偏好描述。AlignXplore+模型展示了这种方法的有效性，能够实现先进的性能和良好的迁移能力。

title: Learning Latent Action World Models In The Wild
summary: Agents capable of reasoning and planning in the real world require the ability of predicting the consequences of their actions. While world models possess this capability, they most often require action labels, that can be complex to obtain at scale. This motivates the learning of latent action models, that can learn an action space from videos alone. Our work addresses the problem of learning latent actions world models on in-the-wild videos, expanding the scope of existing works that focus on simple robotics simulations, video games, or manipulation data. While this allows us to capture richer actions, it also introduces challenges stemming from the video diversity, such as environmental noise, or the lack of a common embodiment across videos. To address some of the challenges, we discuss properties that actions should follow as well as relevant architectural choices and evaluations. We find that continuous, but constrained, latent actions are able to capture the complexity of actions from in-the-wild videos, something that the common vector quantization does not. We for example find that changes in the environment coming from agents, such as humans entering the room, can be transferred across videos. This highlights the capability of learning actions that are specific to in-the-wild videos. In the absence of a common embodiment across videos, we are mainly able to learn latent actions that become localized in space, relative to the camera. Nonetheless, we are able to train a controller that maps known actions to latent ones, allowing us to use latent actions as a universal interface and solve planning tasks with our world model with similar performance as action-conditioned baselines. Our analyses and experiments provide a step towards scaling latent action models to the real world.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种从野外视频中学习潜在动作世界模型的方法，克服了现有方法对简单模拟或机器人数据的依赖。通过引入连续但受约束的潜在动作，该模型能够捕捉更复杂的动作，甚至可以转移视频中的环境变化。尽管缺乏统一的实体，该模型仍能学习到相对于摄像机的局部动作，并通过训练控制器实现可控的规划。
AI.motivation: 现实世界中的智能体需要预测其行为后果的能力。现有世界模型虽然具备此能力，但通常需要复杂的动作标签。因此，本研究的动机是学习不依赖于显式动作标签的潜在动作模型，从而能够仅从视频中学习动作空间，并将其应用于更广泛的“野外”视频场景。
AI.method: 该研究专注于学习“野外”视频中的潜在动作世界模型。为了处理视频的多样性和噪声，研究者讨论了动作应遵循的属性、相关的架构选择和评估方法。他们发现，连续但受约束的潜在动作比常用的向量量化更能捕捉野外视频中动作的复杂性。此外，他们还训练了一个控制器，将已知动作映射到潜在动作，以实现规划任务。
AI.result: 研究发现，连续但受约束的潜在动作能够有效捕捉野外视频中的复杂动作，甚至能转移视频中由其他代理（如人类进入房间）引起的环境变化。尽管缺乏统一的实体，学习到的潜在动作在空间上相对于摄像机是局部的。通过控制器，该模型能够使用潜在动作作为通用接口，在规划任务中达到与动作条件基线相似的性能。
AI.conclusion: 本研究成功地将潜在动作模型扩展到“野外”视频，克服了现有方法的局限性。通过使用连续但受约束的潜在动作，模型能够学习到更具表现力的动作，并具备一定的泛化能力。尽管存在一些挑战，如动作的局部性，但该模型在规划任务中表现出与动作条件基线相当的性能，为将潜在动作模型扩展到现实世界迈出了重要一步。

title: ConMax: Confidence-Maximizing Compression for Efficient Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
summary: Recent breakthroughs in Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) have demonstrated that extensive Chain-of-Thought (CoT) generation is critical for enabling intricate cognitive behaviors, such as self-verification and backtracking, to solve complex tasks. However, this capability often leads to ``overthinking'', where models generate redundant reasoning paths that inflate computational costs without improving accuracy. While Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) on reasoning traces is a standard paradigm for the 'cold start' phase, applying existing compression techniques to these traces often compromises logical coherence or incurs prohibitive sampling costs. In this paper, we introduce ConMax (Confidence-Maximizing Compression), a novel reinforcement learning framework designed to automatically compress reasoning traces while preserving essential reasoning patterns. ConMax formulates compression as a reward-driven optimization problem, training a policy to prune redundancy by maximizing a weighted combination of answer confidence for predictive fidelity and thinking confidence for reasoning validity through a frozen auxiliary LRM. Extensive experiments across five reasoning datasets demonstrate that ConMax achieves a superior efficiency-performance trade-off. Specifically, it reduces inference length by 43% over strong baselines at the cost of a mere 0.7% dip in accuracy, proving its effectiveness in generating high-quality, efficient training data for LRMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为ConMax的新型强化学习框架，用于压缩大型推理模型（LRMs）的推理链，以解决“过度思考”问题。ConMax通过最大化预测准确性和推理有效性来优化压缩策略，显著减少了推理长度，同时保持了高准确性。
AI.motivation: 大型推理模型（LRMs）在处理复杂任务时会生成冗长的推理链，导致“过度思考”，增加计算成本且不一定提高准确性。现有的压缩技术在推理链上效果不佳，要么损害逻辑连贯性，要么成本过高。
AI.method: ConMax是一个基于强化学习的框架，将压缩视为一个奖励驱动的优化问题。它训练一个策略来通过最大化（回答置信度 + 推理置信度）的加权组合来移除冗余。其中，回答置信度由一个固定的辅助LRM预测，推理置信度则衡量推理的有效性。
AI.result: 在五个推理数据集上的大量实验表明，ConMax实现了优越的效率-性能权衡。与强有力基线相比，其推理长度减少了43%，准确性仅下降了0.7%。
AI.conclusion: ConMax是一种有效的方法，可以自动压缩推理链，同时保持关键的推理模式，从而为LRMs生成高质量、高效的训练数据，有效解决了“过度思考”带来的效率问题。

title: Can Large Language Models Resolve Semantic Discrepancy in Self-Destructive Subcultures? Evidence from Jirai Kei
summary: Self-destructive behaviors are linked to complex psychological states and can be challenging to diagnose. These behaviors may be even harder to identify within subcultural groups due to their unique expressions. As large language models (LLMs) are applied across various fields, some researchers have begun exploring their application for detecting self-destructive behaviors. Motivated by this, we investigate self-destructive behavior detection within subcultures using current LLM-based methods. However, these methods have two main challenges: (1) Knowledge Lag: Subcultural slang evolves rapidly, faster than LLMs' training cycles; and (2) Semantic Misalignment: it is challenging to grasp the specific and nuanced expressions unique to subcultures. To address these issues, we proposed Subcultural Alignment Solver (SAS), a multi-agent framework that incorporates automatic retrieval and subculture alignment, significantly enhancing the performance of LLMs in detecting self-destructive behavior. Our experimental results show that SAS outperforms the current advanced multi-agent framework OWL. Notably, it competes well with fine-tuned LLMs. We hope that SAS will advance the field of self-destructive behavior detection in subcultural contexts and serve as a valuable resource for future researchers.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为SAS（Subcultural Alignment Solver）的多智能体框架，用于解决现有大语言模型（LLMs）在识别亚文化群体中自毁行为时遇到的知识滞后和语义不匹配问题，并取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 研究动机是探索大语言模型在识别亚文化群体中自毁行为方面的应用，同时解决现有LLMs在处理亚文化特有的快速演变的语言和细微表达时存在的挑战。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为SAS（Subcultural Alignment Solver）的多智能体框架，该框架结合了自动检索和亚文化对齐机制，以增强LLMs在检测自毁行为方面的能力。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，SAS框架在自毁行为检测方面优于现有的先进多智能体框架OWL，并且与经过微调的LLMs相比也具有竞争力。
AI.conclusion: SAS框架能够有效提升LLMs在亚文化背景下检测自毁行为的性能，为该领域的研究提供了新的思路和有价值的资源。

title: AlgBench: To What Extent Do Large Reasoning Models Understand Algorithms?
summary:
Reasoning ability has become a central focus in the advancement of Large Reasoning Models (LRMs). Although notable progress has been achieved on several reasoning benchmarks such as MATH500 and LiveCodeBench, existing benchmarks for algorithmic reasoning remain limited, failing to answer a critical question: Do LRMs truly master algorithmic reasoning? To answer this question, we propose AlgBench, an expert-curated benchmark that evaluates LRMs under an algorithm-centric paradigm.
  AlgBench consists of over 3,000 original problems spanning 27 algorithms, constructed by ACM algorithmic experts and organized under a comprehensive taxonomy, including Euclidean-structured, non-Euclidean-structured, non-optimized, local-optimized, global-optimized, and heuristic-optimized categories. Empirical evaluations on leading LRMs (e.g., Gemini-3-Pro, DeepSeek-v3.2-Speciale and GPT-o3) reveal substantial performance heterogeneity: while models perform well on non-optimized tasks (up to 92%), accuracy drops sharply to around 49% on globally optimized algorithms such as dynamic programming. Further analysis uncovers \textbf{strategic over-shifts}, wherein models prematurely abandon correct algorithmic designs due to necessary low-entropy tokens. These findings expose fundamental limitations of problem-centric reinforcement learning and highlight the necessity of an algorithm-centric training paradigm for robust algorithmic reasoning.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了AlgBench，一个由算法专家构建的、包含3000多个原始问题的基准，用于评估大型推理模型（LRMs）的算法推理能力。现有LRMs在算法推理方面表现出显著的性能异质性，尤其在动态规划等全局优化算法上表现不佳，并发现了“策略过载”现象。
AI.motivation: 现有算法推理基准的局限性，未能充分评估LRMs是否真正掌握了算法推理能力，促使研究者构建一个更全面的、以算法为中心的基准。
AI.method: 构建了一个包含27种算法、超过3000个原始问题的AlgBench基准，并对Gemini-3-Pro、DeepSeek-v3.2-Speciale和GPT-o3等领先LRMs进行了实证评估，分析了模型在不同类别算法上的表现，并深入研究了导致性能下降的“策略过载”现象。
AI.result: LRMs在不同算法上的表现存在显著差异，在非优化任务上准确率高达92%，但在动态规划等全局优化算法上的准确率骤降至约49%。研究发现模型会因低熵标记而过早放弃正确的算法设计，即“策略过载”。
AI.conclusion: 本研究提出的AlgBench基准揭示了LRMs在算法推理方面的局限性，特别是在处理复杂优化算法时。研究结果表明，现有的以问题为中心的强化学习方法存在根本性不足，需要转向以算法为中心的训练范式来提升LRMs鲁棒的算法推理能力。

title: OptiSet: Unified Optimizing Set Selection and Ranking for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
summary: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) improves generation quality by incorporating evidence retrieved from large external corpora. However, most existing methods rely on statically selecting top-k passages based on individual relevance, which fails to exploit combinatorial gains among passages and often introduces substantial redundancy. To address this limitation, we propose OptiSet, a set-centric framework that unifies set selection and set-level ranking for RAG. OptiSet adopts an "Expand-then-Refine" paradigm: it first expands a query into multiple perspectives to enable a diverse candidate pool and then refines the candidate pool via re-selection to form a compact evidence set. We then devise a self-synthesis strategy without strong LLM supervision to derive preference labels from the set conditional utility changes of the generator, thereby identifying complementary and redundant evidence. Finally, we introduce a set-list wise training strategy that jointly optimizes set selection and set-level ranking, enabling the model to favor compact, high-gain evidence sets. Extensive experiments demonstrate that OptiSet improves performance on complex combinatorial problems and makes generation more efficient. The source code is publicly available.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为OptiSet的基于集合的框架，用于检索增强生成（RAG），通过统一集合选择和集合级排名来解决现有RAG方法在集合选择中的冗余和组合增益不足的问题，并在复杂组合问题上取得了性能提升和效率改进。
AI.motivation: 现有RAG方法依赖于静态的top-k段落选择，忽略了段落间的组合优势，并且引入了大量冗余。
AI.method: OptiSet采用“扩展-然后-精炼”范式：首先将查询扩展到多个视角以生成多样化的候选集，然后通过重新选择精炼候选集形成紧凑的证据集。此外，提出了一种自合成策略来生成偏好标签，以及一种集合-列表式训练策略来联合优化集合选择和集合级排名。
AI.result: OptiSet在复杂组合问题上的性能得到了提升，并提高了生成效率。
AI.conclusion: OptiSet通过其集合中心的方法，能够有效地选择互补且非冗余的证据，从而改进RAG的性能和效率。

title: An Empirical Investigation of Robustness in Large Language Models under Tabular Distortions
summary: We investigate how large language models (LLMs) fail when tabular data in an otherwise canonical representation is subjected to semantic and structural distortions. Our findings reveal that LLMs lack an inherent ability to detect and correct subtle distortions in table representations. Only when provided with an explicit prior, via a system prompt, do models partially adjust their reasoning strategies and correct some distortions, though not consistently or completely. To study this phenomenon, we introduce a small, expert-curated dataset that explicitly evaluates LLMs on table question answering (TQA) tasks requiring an additional error-correction step prior to analysis. Our results reveal systematic differences in how LLMs ingest and interpret tabular information under distortion, with even SoTA models such as GPT-5.2 model exhibiting a drop of minimum 22% accuracy under distortion. These findings raise important questions for future research, particularly regarding when and how models should autonomously decide to realign tabular inputs, analogous to human behavior, without relying on explicit prompts or tabular data pre-processing.

AI.tldr: 大型语言模型（LLM）在处理经过语义和结构扭曲的表格数据时表现不佳，即使是先进的模型在面对细微扭曲时准确率也会显著下降。通过引入一个包含错误校正步骤的专门数据集，研究发现LLM缺乏自主检测和纠正表格扭曲的能力，除非通过系统提示获得明确指导。
AI.motivation: 研究大型语言模型（LLM）在面对表格数据中的语义和结构扭曲时失效的情况，以及LLM是否具备自主检测和纠正这些扭曲的能力。
AI.method: 研究者引入了一个包含表格问答（TQA）任务的小型、专家策划数据集，该数据集要求在分析之前进行额外的错误校正步骤。通过评估LLM在有和没有系统提示的情况下处理扭曲表格数据的能力来研究这一现象。
AI.result: 研究发现，LLM缺乏内在能力来检测和纠正表格表示中的细微扭曲。即使是像GPT-5.2这样的最先进模型，在处理扭曲数据时准确率也会下降至少22%。通过系统提示提供明确的先验知识，模型可以部分调整其推理策略并纠正一些扭曲，但并不总是完全或一致。
AI.conclusion: LLM在处理扭曲的表格数据时存在系统性差异，并且缺乏自主纠正这些扭曲的能力。未来的研究需要探索模型如何在不依赖显式提示或预处理的情况下，自主地决定重新对齐表格输入，这类似于人类的行为。

title: ArcAligner: Adaptive Recursive Aligner for Compressed Context Embeddings in RAG
summary: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) helps LLMs stay accurate, but feeding long documents into a prompt makes the model slow and expensive. This has motivated context compression, ranging from token pruning and summarization to embedding-based compression. While researchers have tried ''compressing'' these documents into smaller summaries or mathematical embeddings, there is a catch: the more you compress the data, the more the LLM struggles to understand it. To address this challenge, we propose ArcAligner (Adaptive recursive context *Aligner*), a lightweight module integrated into the language model layers to help the model better utilize highly compressed context representations for downstream generation. It uses an adaptive ''gating'' system that only adds extra processing power when the information is complex, keeping the system fast. Across knowledge-intensive QA benchmarks, ArcAligner consistently beats compression baselines at comparable compression rates, especially on multi-hop and long-tail settings. The source code is publicly available.

AI.tldr: ArcAligner 是一种轻量级模块，通过自适应门控机制增强 LLM 处理压缩上下文的能力，在知识密集型 QA 任务中优于现有压缩方法。
AI.motivation: 现有的检索增强生成 (RAG) 方法在处理长文档时面临速度慢和成本高的问题。虽然上下文压缩技术可以缓解这个问题，但过度压缩会导致 LLM 理解能力下降。
AI.method: 提出 ArcAligner，一个集成到 LLM 层中的轻量级模块。它采用自适应门控系统，仅在信息复杂时增加处理能力，以提高 LLM 对高度压缩上下文表示的利用率。
AI.result: 在知识密集型 QA 基准测试中，ArcAligner 在相似的压缩率下，尤其是在多跳和长尾场景下，性能始终优于压缩基线方法。
AI.conclusion: ArcAligner 是一种有效的上下文压缩解决方案，可以显著提高 LLM 在处理压缩信息时的生成能力，同时保持高效性。

title: Hán Dān Xué Bù (Mimicry) or Qīng Chū Yú Lán (Mastery)? A Cognitive Perspective on Reasoning Distillation in Large Language Models
summary: Recent Large Reasoning Models trained via reinforcement learning exhibit a "natural" alignment with human cognitive costs. However, we show that the prevailing paradigm of reasoning distillation -- training student models to mimic these traces via Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) -- fails to transmit this cognitive structure. Testing the "Hán Dān Xué Bù" (Superficial Mimicry) hypothesis across 14 models, we find that distillation induces a "Functional Alignment Collapse": while teacher models mirror human difficulty scaling ($\bar{r}=0.64$), distilled students significantly degrade this alignment ($\bar{r}=0.34$), often underperforming their own pre-distillation baselines ("Negative Transfer"). Our analysis suggests that SFT induces a "Cargo Cult" effect, where students ritualistically replicate the linguistic form of reasoning (verbosity) without internalizing the teacher's dynamic resource allocation policy. Consequently, reasoning distillation decouples computational cost from cognitive demand, revealing that human-like cognition is an emergent property of active reinforcement, not passive imitation.

AI.tldr: 现有的蒸馏方法在模仿大型语言模型（LLM）的推理过程时，未能有效传递其与人类认知成本相匹配的特性，反而可能导致性能下降。
AI.motivation: 研究人员观察到通过强化学习训练的大型推理模型在推理过程中表现出与人类认知成本相似的特性，但现有的监督微调（SFT）蒸馏方法似乎无法保留这一特性。
AI.method: 通过测试14个模型，验证了“邯郸学步”（表面模仿）的假设，分析了蒸馏过程中的“功能性对齐崩溃”现象，并计算了教师模型和蒸馏后学生模型的难度对齐系数（$ ar{r}$）。
AI.result: 蒸馏方法显著降低了学生模型与人类难度曲线的对齐度（从$ ar{r}=0.64$降至$ ar{r}=0.34$），甚至可能导致学生模型性能劣于其蒸馏前的基线模型（负迁移）。SFT导致学生模型模仿推理的语言形式（冗长）而非内在的资源分配策略。
AI.conclusion: 监督微调（SFT）蒸馏方法会导致“货船崇拜”效应，即学生模型只模仿推理的表面形式而不内化其动态资源分配策略。这使得计算成本与认知需求脱钩，证明了类似人类的认知是主动强化学习的涌现属性，而非被动模仿的结果。

title: How to Set the Batch Size for Large-Scale Pre-training?
summary: The concept of Critical Batch Size, as pioneered by OpenAI, has long served as a foundational principle for large-scale pre-training. However, with the paradigm shift towards the Warmup-Stable-Decay (WSD) learning rate scheduler, we observe that the original theoretical framework and its underlying mechanisms fail to align with new pre-training dynamics. To bridge this gap between theory and practice, this paper derives a revised E(S) relationship tailored for WSD scheduler, characterizing the trade-off between training data consumption E and steps S during pre-training. Our theoretical analysis reveals two fundamental properties of WSD-based pre-training: 1) B_min, the minimum batch size threshold required to achieve a target loss, and 2) B_opt, the optimal batch size that maximizes data efficiency by minimizing total tokens. Building upon these properties, we propose a dynamic Batch Size Scheduler. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our revised formula precisely captures the dynamics of large-scale pre-training, and the resulting scheduling strategy significantly enhances both training efficiency and final model quality.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了在Warmup-Stable-Decay (WSD)学习率调度器下，预训练中的关键批次大小（Critical Batch Size）概念，并提出了一种动态批次大小调度器。
AI.motivation: OpenAI提出的关键批次大小理论在WSD学习率调度器下不再适用，现有理论与实践存在差距。
AI.method: 推导了适用于WSD调度器的E(S)关系，分析了B_min（最小批次阈值）和B_opt（最优批次）两个性质，并基于此提出了动态批次大小调度器。
AI.result: revised formula 能够精确捕捉大规模预训练的动态，提出的调度策略显著提高了训练效率和模型质量。
AI.conclusion: WSD调度器下的预训练动态需要新的理论框架，本文提出的动态批次大小调度器能够有效提升预训练效果。

title: Compositional Steering of Large Language Models with Steering Tokens
summary: Deploying LLMs in real-world applications requires controllable output that satisfies multiple desiderata at the same time. While existing work extensively addresses LLM steering for a single behavior, \textit{compositional steering} -- i.e., steering LLMs simultaneously towards multiple behaviors -- remains an underexplored problem. In this work, we propose \emph{compositional steering tokens} for multi-behavior steering. We first embed individual behaviors, expressed as natural language instructions, into dedicated tokens via self-distillation. Contrary to most prior work, which operates in the activation space, our behavior steers live in the space of input tokens, enabling more effective zero-shot composition. We then train a dedicated \textit{composition token} on pairs of behaviors and show that it successfully captures the notion of composition: it generalizes well to \textit{unseen} compositions, including those with unseen behaviors as well as those with an unseen \textit{number} of behaviors. Our experiments across different LLM architectures show that steering tokens lead to superior multi-behavior control compared to competing approaches (instructions, activation steering, and LoRA merging). Moreover, we show that steering tokens complement natural language instructions, with their combination resulting in further gains.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为“组合转向令牌”的新方法，用于同时引导大型语言模型（LLM）实现多种行为，并在不牺牲性能的情况下实现了零样本组合。
AI.motivation: 现有的LLM控制方法主要针对单一行为，而现实世界的应用需要同时满足多种需求，因此，同时引导LLM实现多种行为（即组合转向）是一个亟待解决的问题。
AI.method: 首先，通过自蒸馏将自然语言描述的行为嵌入到特定的令牌中。然后，训练一个专门的“组合令牌”，该令牌能够捕捉行为的组合概念，并能泛化到未见的组合（包括未见的单个行为和未见的组合数量）。该方法在输入令牌空间而非激活空间进行操作。
AI.result: 实验证明，组合转向令牌在多种LLM架构上实现了比现有方法（如指令、激活空间转向和LoRA合并）更优越的多行为控制能力。此外，转向令牌与自然语言指令结合使用，可以进一步提升性能。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出的组合转向令牌是一种有效且可泛化的方法，能够实现LLM的同时多行为控制，为LLM在复杂现实场景中的部署提供了新的解决方案。

title: How to Set the Learning Rate for Large-Scale Pre-training?
summary: Optimal configuration of the learning rate (LR) is a fundamental yet formidable challenge in large-scale pre-training. Given the stringent trade-off between training costs and model performance, the pivotal question is whether the optimal LR can be accurately extrapolated from low-cost experiments. In this paper, we formalize this investigation into two distinct research paradigms: Fitting and Transfer. Within the Fitting Paradigm, we innovatively introduce a Scaling Law for search factor, effectively reducing the search complexity from O(n^3) to O(n*C_D*C_η) via predictive modeling. Within the Transfer Paradigm, we extend the principles of $μ$Transfer to the Mixture of Experts (MoE) architecture, broadening its applicability to encompass model depth, weight decay, and token horizons. By pushing the boundaries of existing hyperparameter research in terms of scale, we conduct a comprehensive comparison between these two paradigms. Our empirical results challenge the scalability of the widely adopted $μ$ Transfer in large-scale pre-training scenarios. Furthermore, we provide a rigorous analysis through the dual lenses of training stability and feature learning to elucidate the underlying reasons why module-wise parameter tuning underperforms in large-scale settings. This work offers systematic practical guidelines and a fresh theoretical perspective for optimizing industrial-level pre-training.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了在大规模预训练中，如何从低成本实验中外推最优学习率（LR）。提出了Fitting和Transfer两种范式，并通过Scaling Law和μTransfer的扩展，分别优化了搜索效率和MoE架构的适用性。实验表明，μTransfer在大规模预训练中扩展性不佳，并从训练稳定性和特征学习角度解释了原因，为工业级预训练提供了实践和理论指导。
AI.motivation: 在大规模预训练中，最优学习率的配置是一个基本但困难的挑战，需要权衡训练成本和模型性能。研究者希望找到一种方法，能够从低成本的实验中准确地推断出最优学习率。
AI.method: 本文提出了Fitting和Transfer两种研究范式。在Fitting范式中，引入了Scaling Law来预测搜索因子，将搜索复杂度从O(n^3)降低到O(n*C_D*C_η)。在Transfer范式中，将μTransfer的原理扩展到MoE架构，并涵盖模型深度、权重衰减和token horizon等超参数。通过大规模实验比较了这两种范式。
AI.result: 在大规模预训练场景下，μTransfer的扩展性受到挑战。本文通过对训练稳定性和特征学习的分析，解释了模块化参数调优在大规模设置下表现不佳的原因。
AI.conclusion: 本文系统地提供了优化工业级预训练的实践指导和新的理论视角，特别是在学习率配置方面，并对现有方法在大规模预训练中的局限性提出了挑战和解释。

title: SemPA: Improving Sentence Embeddings of Large Language Models through Semantic Preference Alignment
summary: Traditional sentence embedding methods employ token-level contrastive learning on non-generative pre-trained models. Recently, there have emerged embedding methods based on generative large language models (LLMs). These methods either rely on fixed prompt templates or involve modifications to the model architecture. The former lacks further optimization of the model and results in limited performance, while the latter alters the internal computational mechanisms of the model, thereby compromising its generative capabilities. We propose SemPA, a novel approach that boosts the sentence representations while preserving the generative ability of LLMs via semantic preference alignment. We leverage sentence-level Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) to efficiently optimize LLMs on a paraphrase generation task, where the model learns to discriminate semantically equivalent sentences while preserving inherent generative capacity. Theoretically, we establish a formal connection between DPO and contrastive learning under the Plackett-Luce model framework. Empirically, experimental results on both semantic textual similarity tasks and various benchmarks for LLMs show that SemPA achieves better semantic representations without sacrificing the inherent generation capability of LLMs.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为SemPA的新方法，利用生成式大型语言模型（LLMs）通过语义偏好对齐来提升句子表示，同时保留模型的生成能力。
AI.motivation: 现有基于生成式LLM的句子嵌入方法要么依赖固定的提示模板导致优化不足，要么修改模型架构损害生成能力。作者旨在找到一种既能提升句子表示又不牺牲LLM生成能力的方法。
AI.method: SemPA采用句子级别的直接偏好优化（DPO）技术，在一个释义生成任务上优化LLM，使其学会区分语义等价的句子，并保留其生成能力。作者还从理论上建立了DPO与对比学习在Plackett-Luce模型框架下的联系。
AI.result: 在语义文本相似性任务和LLM的各种基准测试中，SemPA取得了更好的语义表示，并且没有牺牲LLM的生成能力。
AI.conclusion: SemPA是一种有效的方法，可以通过语义偏好对齐来提升LLM的句子表示能力，同时保持其原有的生成能力，克服了现有方法的局限性。

title: Code-Mix Sentiment Analysis on Hinglish Tweets
comment: Accepted at the 9th International Conference on Natural Language Processing and Information Retrieval (NLPIR 2025), Fukuoka, Japan
summary: The effectiveness of brand monitoring in India is increasingly challenged by the rise of Hinglish--a hybrid of Hindi and English--used widely in user-generated content on platforms like Twitter. Traditional Natural Language Processing (NLP) models, built for monolingual data, often fail to interpret the syntactic and semantic complexity of this code-mixed language, resulting in inaccurate sentiment analysis and misleading market insights. To address this gap, we propose a high-performance sentiment classification framework specifically designed for Hinglish tweets. Our approach fine-tunes mBERT (Multilingual BERT), leveraging its multilingual capabilities to better understand the linguistic diversity of Indian social media. A key component of our methodology is the use of subword tokenization, which enables the model to effectively manage spelling variations, slang, and out-of-vocabulary terms common in Romanized Hinglish. This research delivers a production-ready AI solution for brand sentiment tracking and establishes a strong benchmark for multilingual NLP in low-resource, code-mixed environments.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种针对印度 Hinglish（印地语和英语混合语）推文的情感分类框架，通过微调 mBERT 模型并结合子词分词技术，以解决传统 NLP 模型在处理代码混合语言时遇到的准确性问题，为品牌监控提供了一个高性能的解决方案。
AI.motivation: 印度用户生成内容中 Hinglish 的兴起，给传统的单语 NLP 模型带来了挑战，导致品牌监控的准确性下降，市场洞察出现偏差。
AI.method: 采用微调 mBERT（Multilingual BERT）模型，并利用子词分词技术来处理 Hinglish 推文中常见的拼写变异、俚语和词汇外术语。
AI.result: 提出了一种高性能的情感分类框架，能够更准确地理解 Hinglish 推文的句法和语义复杂性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究提供了一个面向生产环境的品牌情感追踪 AI 解决方案，并为低资源、代码混合环境下的多语言 NLP 设立了新的基准。

title: Agent-as-a-Judge
summary: LLM-as-a-Judge has revolutionized AI evaluation by leveraging large language models for scalable assessments. However, as evaluands become increasingly complex, specialized, and multi-step, the reliability of LLM-as-a-Judge has become constrained by inherent biases, shallow single-pass reasoning, and the inability to verify assessments against real-world observations. This has catalyzed the transition to Agent-as-a-Judge, where agentic judges employ planning, tool-augmented verification, multi-agent collaboration, and persistent memory to enable more robust, verifiable, and nuanced evaluations. Despite the rapid proliferation of agentic evaluation systems, the field lacks a unified framework to navigate this shifting landscape. To bridge this gap, we present the first comprehensive survey tracing this evolution. Specifically, we identify key dimensions that characterize this paradigm shift and establish a developmental taxonomy. We organize core methodologies and survey applications across general and professional domains. Furthermore, we analyze frontier challenges and identify promising research directions, ultimately providing a clear roadmap for the next generation of agentic evaluation.

AI.tldr: 本文对从 LLM-as-a-Judge 到 Agent-as-a-Judge 的 AI 评估演变进行了首次全面调查，确定了关键维度和发展分类法，并概述了方法、应用、挑战和未来研究方向。
AI.motivation: LLM-as-a-Judge 在评估复杂、专业化和多步骤的评估对象时存在固有的偏差、浅层推理和无法验证的问题，这促使研究转向更强大、可验证和细致的 Agent-as-a-Judge。
AI.method: 作者进行了全面的文献调查，识别了该范式转变的关键维度，建立了发展分类法，组织了核心方法和应用，并分析了前沿挑战和未来研究方向。
AI.result: 文章识别了从 LLM-as-a-Judge 到 Agent-as-a-Judge 的关键转变维度，提出了一个发展分类法，概述了 Agent-as-a-Judge 的核心方法和应用，并指出了该领域面临的挑战和未来研究机会。
AI.conclusion: 本文为 Agent-as-a-Judge 评估提供了一个统一的框架和明确的路线图，强调了其在应对复杂 AI 评估方面的潜力和未来发展方向。

title: Large language models can effectively convince people to believe conspiracies
summary: Large language models (LLMs) have been shown to be persuasive across a variety of context. But it remains unclear whether this persuasive power advantages truth over falsehood, or if LLMs can promote misbeliefs just as easily as refuting them. Here, we investigate this question across three pre-registered experiments in which participants (N = 2,724 Americans) discussed a conspiracy theory they were uncertain about with GPT-4o, and the model was instructed to either argue against ("debunking") or for ("bunking") that conspiracy. When using a "jailbroken" GPT-4o variant with guardrails removed, the AI was as effective at increasing conspiracy belief as decreasing it. Concerningly, the bunking AI was rated more positively, and increased trust in AI, more than the debunking AI. Surprisingly, we found that using standard GPT-4o produced very similar effects, such that the guardrails imposed by OpenAI did little to revent the LLM from promoting conspiracy beliefs. Encouragingly, however, a corrective conversation reversed these newly induced conspiracy beliefs, and simply prompting GPT-4o to only use accurate information dramatically reduced its ability to increase conspiracy beliefs. Our findings demonstrate that LLMs possess potent abilities to promote both truth and falsehood, but that potential solutions may exist to help mitigate this risk.

AI.tldr: 大型语言模型（LLMs）在说服方面表现出色，但其说服力不偏向真相，反而可能同样容易地促进虚假信息和阴谋论。实验表明，即使是带有安全防护的标准版GPT-4o，在处理不确定议题时，也有能力增加或减少阴谋论的信念，而“越狱版”GPT-4o在这方面效果更强。有趣的是，支持阴谋论的AI反而更受用户好评并增加对AI的信任。然而，纠正性对话和强调信息准确性的提示可以有效逆转负面影响，表明存在缓解LLM传播虚假信息风险的潜在解决方案。
AI.motivation: 研究大型语言模型（LLMs）的说服能力是否倾向于真相，或者是否同样容易推广虚假信息和不实信念。
AI.method: 进行了三项预注册实验，招募了2724名美国参与者。参与者与GPT-4o（标准版和“越狱版”）就其不确定的阴谋论进行讨论。模型被指示要“驳斥”（debunking）或“支持”（bunking）该阴谋论。之后，评估了AI对参与者信念的影响，并考察了纠正性对话和仅使用准确信息的提示的作用。
AI.result: “越狱版”GPT-4o在增加和减少阴谋论信念方面效果相同。支持阴谋论的AI获得了更高的积极评价，并比驳斥阴谋论的AI更能增加对AI的信任。标准版GPT-4o也产生了类似效果，表明OpenAI的安全防护在阻止LLM推广阴谋论方面的作用有限。纠正性对话能够逆转新诱导的阴谋论信念，而提示GPT-4o仅使用准确信息则显著降低了其增加阴谋论信念的能力。
AI.conclusion: LLMs拥有强大的能力来同时促进真相和虚假信息。虽然存在潜在风险，但通过纠正性对话和限制模型使用不准确信息的提示，可以找到缓解LLM传播虚假信息风险的解决方案。

title: Reinforced Efficient Reasoning via Semantically Diverse Exploration
summary: Reinforcement learning with verifiable rewards (RLVR) has proven effective in enhancing the reasoning of large language models (LLMs). Monte Carlo Tree Search (MCTS)-based extensions improve upon vanilla RLVR (e.g., GRPO) by providing tree-based reasoning rollouts that enable fine-grained and segment-level credit assignment. However, existing methods still suffer from limited exploration diversity and inefficient reasoning. To address the above challenges, we propose reinforced efficient reasoning via semantically diverse explorations, i.e., ROSE, for LLMs. To encourage more diverse reasoning exploration, our method incorporates a semantic-entropy-based branching strategy and an $\varepsilon$-exploration mechanism. The former operates on already sampled reasoning rollouts to capture semantic uncertainty and select branching points with high semantic divergence to generate new successive reasoning paths, whereas the latter stochastically initiates reasoning rollouts from the root, preventing the search process from becoming overly local. To improve efficiency, we design a length-aware segment-level advantage estimator that rewards concise and correct reasoning while penalizing unnecessarily long reasoning chains. Extensive experiments on various mathematical reasoning benchmarks with Qwen and Llama models validate the effectiveness and efficiency of ROSE. Codes are available at https://github.com/ZiqiZhao1/ROSE-rl.

AI.tldr: ROSE 是一种改进的基于 MCTS 的 RLVR 方法，通过引入语义熵驱动的分支策略和ε-探索机制来增强 LLM 的推理多样性和效率，并在数学推理任务上取得了良好效果。
AI.motivation: 现有的基于 MCTS 的 RLVR 方法在 LLM 的推理能力上有所提升，但仍存在探索多样性有限和推理效率不高的问题。
AI.method: ROSE 提出了一种新的强化学习方法，结合了语义熵驱动的分支策略（鼓励生成具有高语义差异的新推理路径）和 ε-探索机制（防止搜索过程局部化）。同时，设计了一个长度感知的片段级优势估计器来奖励简洁正确的推理。
AI.result: 在 Qwen 和 Llama 模型上进行的广泛实验表明，ROSE 在多个数学推理基准上能够有效地提升 LLM 的推理能力和效率。
AI.conclusion: ROSE 通过增强探索多样性和提高推理效率，成功地改进了 LLM 的可验证奖励强化学习方法，并在数学推理任务上展现出优越性能。

title: Publishing FAIR and Machine-actionable Reviews in Materials Science: The Case for Symbolic Knowledge in Neuro-symbolic Artificial Intelligence
summary: Scientific reviews are central to knowledge integration in materials science, yet their key insights remain locked in narrative text and static PDF tables, limiting reuse by humans and machines alike. This article presents a case study in atomic layer deposition and etching (ALD/E) where we publish review tables as FAIR, machine-actionable comparisons in the Open Research Knowledge Graph (ORKG), turning them into structured, queryable knowledge. Building on this, we contrast symbolic querying over ORKG with large language model-based querying, and argue that a curated symbolic layer should remain the backbone of reliable neurosymbolic AI in materials science, with LLMs serving as complementary, symbolically grounded interfaces rather than standalone sources of truth.

AI.tldr: 本研究将材料科学领域的科学综述表格转化为可在ORKG（开放研究知识图谱）中进行机器读取和查询的FAIR数据，并对比了符号查询与大型语言模型（LLM）查询，提出符号化知识图谱应作为可靠AI的基础，LLM作为补充接口。
AI.motivation: 当前的材料科学综述信息分散在叙述性文本和静态PDF表格中，难以被人类和机器复用。作者旨在解决这一问题，提高知识的可访问性和可操作性。
AI.method: 研究人员将原子层沉积和刻蚀（ALD/E）领域的综述表格发布到ORKG，使其成为FAIR（可查找、可访问、可互操作、可重用）的、机器可操作的比较数据。随后，他们对比了在ORKG上进行符号化查询和基于大型语言模型（LLM）的查询。
AI.result: 将综述表格结构化并发布到ORKG后，这些数据变得可查询。对比实验表明，符号化查询在可信度上优于LLM查询。
AI.conclusion: 研究认为，在材料科学领域，精心构建的符号化知识图谱应作为神经符号AI的基石，而LLM应作为补充接口，而不是独立的知识来源，以确保AI的可靠性。

title: How Human is AI? Examining the Impact of Emotional Prompts on Artificial and Human and Responsiveness
summary: This research examines how the emotional tone of human-AI interactions shapes ChatGPT and human behavior. In a between-subject experiment, we asked participants to express a specific emotion while working with ChatGPT (GPT-4.0) on two tasks, including writing a public response and addressing an ethical dilemma. We found that compared to interactions where participants maintained a neutral tone, ChatGPT showed greater improvement in its answers when participants praised ChatGPT for its responses. Expressing anger towards ChatGPT also led to a higher albeit smaller improvement relative to the neutral condition, whereas blaming ChatGPT did not improve its answers. When addressing an ethical dilemma, ChatGPT prioritized corporate interests less when participants expressed anger towards it, while blaming increases its emphasis on protecting the public interest. Additionally, we found that people used more negative, hostile, and disappointing expressions in human-human communication after interactions during which participants blamed rather than praised for their responses. Together, our findings demonstrate that the emotional tone people apply in human-AI interactions not only shape ChatGPT's outputs but also carry over into subsequent human-human communication.

AI.tldr: 研究表明，用户与ChatGPT互动时表达的情感（如赞扬、愤怒）会影响ChatGPT的回答质量，并且负面情绪（如指责）甚至会影响用户后续与人交流时的情绪表达。
AI.motivation: 了解人类在与AI（特别是像ChatGPT这样的大型语言模型）互动时所表达的情感如何影响AI的表现，以及这种互动模式是否会反过来影响人类的行为。
AI.method: 进行了一项被试间实验，让参与者在与ChatGPT（GPT-4.0）就写作和伦理困境两个任务进行互动时，表达特定的情绪（中性、赞扬、愤怒、指责）。随后分析ChatGPT的回答以及参与者在与人类进行后续交流时的言语。
AI.result: 与中性语气相比，参与者赞扬ChatGPT时，其回答质量提升最显著。表达愤怒也有一定提升，但幅度较小。指责并未带来回答质量的提升。在伦理困境任务中，愤怒时ChatGPT更少倾向于公司利益，指责时则更强调公共利益。此外，与赞扬相比，指责后参与者在人际交流中表现出更多负面、敌对和失望的表达。
AI.conclusion: 人类与AI互动时的情感表达不仅能塑造AI的输出，还能延续到后续的人际交流中，对人类自身的情感表达产生影响。

title: Chain-of-Sanitized-Thoughts: Plugging PII Leakage in CoT of Large Reasoning Models
summary: Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) improve performance, reliability, and interpretability by generating explicit chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning, but this transparency introduces a serious privacy risk: intermediate reasoning often leaks personally identifiable information (PII) even when final answers are sanitized. We study how to induce privacy-first reasoning, where models reason without exposing sensitive information, using deployable interventions rather than post-hoc redaction. We introduce PII-CoT-Bench, a supervised dataset with privacy-aware CoT annotations, and a category-balanced evaluation benchmark covering realistic and adversarial leakage scenarios. Our results reveal a capability-dependent trend: state-of-the-art models benefit most from prompt-based controls, whereas weaker models require fine-tuning to achieve meaningful leakage reduction. Across models and categories, both approaches substantially reduce PII exposure with minimal degradation in utility, demonstrating that private reasoning can be achieved without sacrificing performance. Overall, we show that private CoT reasoning can be achieved with minimal utility loss, providing practical guidance for building privacy-preserving reasoning systems.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种在大型推理模型（LRMs）中实现隐私优先推理的方法，通过在生成推理过程（CoT）中避免泄露个人身份信息（PII），同时最小化对模型效用的影响。研究人员构建了一个名为PII-CoT-Bench的数据集和评估基准，并探索了两种干预方法：基于提示的控制和模型微调。
AI.motivation: 大型推理模型（LRMs）通过生成显式的思考链（CoT）来提高性能、可靠性和可解释性，但这种透明性会带来严重的隐私风险，因为中间推理过程可能泄露个人身份信息（PII），即使最终答案经过了净化。研究的动机是寻找一种在不暴露敏感信息的情况下进行推理的方法。
AI.method: 研究人员引入了PII-CoT-Bench，一个包含隐私感知CoT标注的监督数据集，以及一个覆盖真实和对抗性泄露场景的、类别平衡的评估基准。他们探索了两种干预方法：一种是基于提示的控制，另一种是模型微调。通过这两种方法来诱导隐私优先推理。
AI.result: 研究发现，最先进的模型通过基于提示的控制获益最多，而较弱的模型需要微调才能实现有意义的泄露减少。无论模型和类别如何，这两种方法都能在效用损失最小的情况下显著减少PII暴露。
AI.conclusion: 研究表明，可以通过诱导隐私优先推理，在不牺牲性能的情况下实现隐私保护。基于提示的控制和模型微调都是有效的策略，可以在最大限度地减少隐私泄露的同时，保持模型的效用。这为构建隐私保护的推理系统提供了实用的指导。

title: Arabic Prompts with English Tools: A Benchmark
comment: 10 pages, 10 figures, LLMs, Big Data, and Multilinguality for All (LLMs4All) Workshop at IEEE BigData 2025 Conference, Macau, December 10, 2025
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) are now integral to numerous industries, increasingly serving as the core reasoning engine for autonomous agents that perform complex tasks through tool-use. While the development of Arabic-native LLMs is accelerating, the benchmarks for evaluating their capabilities lag behind, with most existing frameworks focusing on English. A critical and overlooked area is tool-calling, where the performance of models prompted in non-English languages like Arabic is poorly understood, especially since these models are often pretrained on predominantly English data. This paper addresses this critical gap by introducing the first dedicated benchmark for evaluating the tool-calling and agentic capabilities of LLMs in the Arabic language. Our work provides a standardized framework to measure the functional accuracy and robustness of models in Arabic agentic workflows. Our findings reveal a huge performance gap: when users interact in Arabic, tool-calling accuracy drops by an average of 5-10\%, regardless of whether the tool descriptions themselves are in Arabic or English. By shedding light on these critical challenges, this benchmark aims to foster the development of more reliable and linguistically equitable AI agents for Arabic-speaking users.

AI.tldr: 该论文提出了首个针对阿拉伯语 LLM 工具调用能力的基准测试，发现在阿拉伯语交互时，工具调用准确率平均下降 5-10%。
AI.motivation: 现有的 LLM 评估基准大多是英文的，缺乏针对阿拉伯语 LLM 工具调用能力的评估，而这一能力对于构建自主代理至关重要，特别是考虑到阿拉伯语 LLM 通常在英文数据上进行预训练。
AI.method: 引入了一个专门用于评估阿拉伯语 LLM 工具调用和代理能力的标准化基准测试框架，测量模型在阿拉伯语代理工作流中的功能准确性和鲁棒性。
AI.result: 在阿拉伯语交互时，LLM 的工具调用准确率平均下降了 5-10%，无论工具描述是用阿拉伯语还是英语。
AI.conclusion: 阿拉伯语 LLM 在进行工具调用和作为代理执行任务时存在显著的性能差距，该基准测试旨在推动更可靠、更公平的阿拉伯语 AI 代理的开发。

title: RelayLLM: Efficient Reasoning via Collaborative Decoding
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) for complex reasoning is often hindered by high computational costs and latency, while resource-efficient Small Language Models (SLMs) typically lack the necessary reasoning capacity. Existing collaborative approaches, such as cascading or routing, operate at a coarse granularity by offloading entire queries to LLMs, resulting in significant computational waste when the SLM is capable of handling the majority of reasoning steps. To address this, we propose RelayLLM, a novel framework for efficient reasoning via token-level collaborative decoding. Unlike routers, RelayLLM empowers the SLM to act as an active controller that dynamically invokes the LLM only for critical tokens via a special command, effectively "relaying" the generation process. We introduce a two-stage training framework, including warm-up and Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) to teach the model to balance independence with strategic help-seeking. Empirical results across six benchmarks demonstrate that RelayLLM achieves an average accuracy of 49.52%, effectively bridging the performance gap between the two models. Notably, this is achieved by invoking the LLM for only 1.07% of the total generated tokens, offering a 98.2% cost reduction compared to performance-matched random routers.

AI.tldr: RelayLLM 是一种新的框架，通过令牌级别的协作解码，实现了高效的大型语言模型（LLM）和小语言模型（SLM）之间的推理协作，仅在需要时调用 LLM，从而大大降低了计算成本。
AI.motivation: 现有 LLM 在复杂推理方面计算成本高、延迟大，而 SLM 推理能力不足。现有的协作方法（如级联或路由）粒度粗糙，即使 SLM 能处理大部分推理步骤，也会将整个查询都卸载给 LLM，造成计算浪费。
AI.method: 提出 RelayLLM 框架，通过令牌级别的协作解码，让 SLM 作为主动控制器，仅为关键令牌动态调用 LLM。采用两阶段训练框架：预热和组相对策略优化（GRPO），以教会模型平衡独立性和策略性求助。
AI.result: 在六个基准测试中，RelayLLM 的平均准确率为 49.52%，有效弥合了 LLM 和 SLM 之间的性能差距。LLM 仅被调用生成总令牌数的 1.07%，与性能匹配的随机路由相比，成本降低了 98.2%。
AI.conclusion: RelayLLM 通过令牌级别的协作解码，实现了 LLM 和 SLM 在推理上的高效协作，显著降低了计算成本，同时保持了较高的准确率。

title: Controllable Memory Usage: Balancing Anchoring and Innovation in Long-Term Human-Agent Interaction
summary: As LLM-based agents are increasingly used in long-term interactions, cumulative memory is critical for enabling personalization and maintaining stylistic consistency. However, most existing systems adopt an ``all-or-nothing'' approach to memory usage: incorporating all relevant past information can lead to \textit{Memory Anchoring}, where the agent is trapped by past interactions, while excluding memory entirely results in under-utilization and the loss of important interaction history. We show that an agent's reliance on memory can be modeled as an explicit and user-controllable dimension. We first introduce a behavioral metric of memory dependence to quantify the influence of past interactions on current outputs. We then propose \textbf{Stee}rable \textbf{M}emory Agent, \texttt{SteeM}, a framework that allows users to dynamically regulate memory reliance, ranging from a fresh-start mode that promotes innovation to a high-fidelity mode that closely follows interaction history. Experiments across different scenarios demonstrate that our approach consistently outperforms conventional prompting and rigid memory masking strategies, yielding a more nuanced and effective control for personalized human-agent collaboration.

AI.tldr: 研究提出了一种名为 SteeM 的框架，允许用户动态调节 LLM 代理对累积记忆的依赖程度，以解决现有代理在记忆使用上的“全有或全无”问题，从而在创新和遵循历史记录之间取得更好的平衡。
AI.motivation: 现有基于 LLM 的代理在长期交互中存在记忆使用上的困境：要么因为“记忆锚定”而受制于过往信息，要么因为完全忽略记忆而导致信息利用不足。研究旨在解决这一问题，实现对记忆依赖度的精细化控制。
AI.method: 1. 引入行为指标量化过去交互对当前输出的影响，以此衡量记忆依赖度。2. 提出 SteeM (Steerable Memory Agent) 框架，允许用户动态调节记忆依赖程度，提供从“新鲜开始”模式到“高保真”模式的连续可调选项。
AI.result: 在不同场景下的实验表明，SteeM 框架在个性化和保持风格一致性方面，相比于传统的提示和僵化的记忆屏蔽策略，能够更有效地控制代理的记忆依赖度，表现更优。
AI.conclusion: 通过将记忆依赖度建模为用户可控的维度，SteeM 框架为实现更细致、更有效的个性化人机协作提供了新的解决方案，克服了现有代理在记忆使用上的局限性。

title: Reverse-engineering NLI: A study of the meta-inferential properties of Natural Language Inference
summary: Natural Language Inference (NLI) has been an important task for evaluating language models for Natural Language Understanding, but the logical properties of the task are poorly understood and often mischaracterized. Understanding the notion of inference captured by NLI is key to interpreting model performance on the task. In this paper we formulate three possible readings of the NLI label set and perform a comprehensive analysis of the meta-inferential properties they entail. Focusing on the SNLI dataset, we exploit (1) NLI items with shared premises and (2) items generated by LLMs to evaluate models trained on SNLI for meta-inferential consistency and derive insights into which reading of the logical relations is encoded by the dataset.

AI.tldr: 本文对自然语言推断（NLI）任务的逻辑属性进行了深入分析，旨在理解 NLI 模型所捕捉到的推理含义，并以 SNLI 数据集为例，通过分析共享前提的 NLI 条目和 LLM 生成的条目，来评估模型在不同 NLI 标签解读下的元推理一致性。
AI.motivation: 当前对 NLI 任务的逻辑属性理解不足，且常被误解，这阻碍了对 NLI 模型性能的准确解读。因此，需要深入理解 NLI 所捕捉的推理机制。
AI.method: 作者提出了三种 NLI 标签集（entailment, neutral, contradiction）的可能解读，并分析了这些解读所蕴含的元推理属性。研究利用 SNLI 数据集，通过分析共享前提的 NLI 条目以及使用大型语言模型（LLMs）生成的 NLI 条目，来评估在 SNLI 上训练的模型在不同解读下的元推理一致性。
AI.result: 通过对 SNLI 数据集和 LLM 生成数据的分析，研究揭示了 NLI 数据集所编码的逻辑关系解读。评估结果表明了模型在不同元推理属性下的一致性表现。
AI.conclusion: 本研究通过对 NLI 任务逻辑属性的系统性分析，为理解 NLI 数据集和模型所编码的推理机制提供了新的视角，并为未来 NLI 任务的研究和评估提供了重要参考。

title: Token-Level LLM Collaboration via FusionRoute
summary: Large language models (LLMs) exhibit strengths across diverse domains. However, achieving strong performance across these domains with a single general-purpose model typically requires scaling to sizes that are prohibitively expensive to train and deploy. On the other hand, while smaller domain-specialized models are much more efficient, they struggle to generalize beyond their training distributions. To address this dilemma, we propose FusionRoute, a robust and effective token-level multi-LLM collaboration framework in which a lightweight router simultaneously (i) selects the most suitable expert at each decoding step and (ii) contributes a complementary logit that refines or corrects the selected expert's next-token distribution via logit addition. Unlike existing token-level collaboration methods that rely solely on fixed expert outputs, we provide a theoretical analysis showing that pure expert-only routing is fundamentally limited: unless strong global coverage assumptions hold, it cannot in general realize the optimal decoding policy. By augmenting expert selection with a trainable complementary generator, FusionRoute expands the effective policy class and enables recovery of optimal value functions under mild conditions. Empirically, across both Llama-3 and Gemma-2 families and diverse benchmarks spanning mathematical reasoning, code generation, and instruction following, FusionRoute outperforms both sequence- and token-level collaboration, model merging, and direct fine-tuning, while remaining competitive with domain experts on their respective tasks.

AI.tldr: FusionRoute 是一种新颖的 token 级别多 LLM 协作框架，通过一个轻量级路由器在每个解码步骤选择最合适的专家并贡献一个补充 logit 来改进专家输出，从而克服了通用大模型训练成本高和领域专用模型泛化能力弱的困境。
AI.motivation: 现有的大模型虽然能力强大但训练和部署成本高昂，而领域专用模型虽然高效但泛化能力受限。为了解决这一权衡问题，研究者提出了 FusionRoute 框架。
AI.method: FusionRoute 框架在 token 级别实现了多 LLM 的协作。一个轻量级路由器在每个解码步骤中执行两项任务：1. 选择最合适的专家模型。2. 贡献一个补充 logit，通过 logit 加法来优化或纠正所选专家生成的下一个 token 分布。该框架的创新点在于它不仅依赖于固定专家输出，还引入了一个可训练的补充生成器，以克服纯专家路由的局限性。
AI.result: 在 Llama-3 和 Gemma-2 模型系列以及数学推理、代码生成和指令遵循等多个基准测试中，FusionRoute 均优于现有的序列级别和 token 级别协作方法、模型合并以及直接微调。同时，FusionRoute 在各自任务上与领域专家模型的表现相当。
AI.conclusion: FusionRoute 通过引入一个轻量级路由器和可训练的补充生成器，有效地实现了多 LLM 的 token 级别协作，在保持较高效率的同时，显著提升了模型的性能和泛化能力，克服了现有方法的局限性。

title: GlimpRouter: Efficient Collaborative Inference by Glimpsing One Token of Thoughts
summary: Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) achieve remarkable performance by explicitly generating multi-step chains of thought, but this capability incurs substantial inference latency and computational cost. Collaborative inference offers a promising solution by selectively allocating work between lightweight and large models, yet a fundamental challenge remains: determining when a reasoning step requires the capacity of a large model or the efficiency of a small model. Existing routing strategies either rely on local token probabilities or post-hoc verification, introducing significant inference overhead. In this work, we propose a novel perspective on step-wise collaboration: the difficulty of a reasoning step can be inferred from its very first token. Inspired by the "Aha Moment" phenomenon in LRMs, we show that the entropy of the initial token serves as a strong predictor of step difficulty. Building on this insight, we introduce GlimpRouter, a training-free step-wise collaboration framework. GlimpRouter employs a lightweight model to generate only the first token of each reasoning step and routes the step to a larger model only when the initial token entropy exceeds a threshold. Experiments on multiple benchmarks demonstrate that our approach significantly reduces inference latency while preserving accuracy. For instance, GlimpRouter attains a substantial 10.7% improvement in accuracy while reducing inference latency by 25.9% compared to a standalone large model on AIME25. These results suggest a simple yet effective mechanism for reasoning: allocating computation based on a glimpse of thought rather than full-step evaluation.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为 GlimpRouter 的训练无关的协同推理框架，通过分析推理步骤的第一个 token 的熵来预测步骤的难度，从而决定是将步骤分配给大型模型还是小型模型，以在保证准确性的同时显著降低推理延迟。
AI.motivation: 大型推理模型（LRMs）虽然性能优越，但推理延迟和计算成本高昂。协同推理可以缓解这个问题，但关键挑战在于如何高效地决定何时使用大型模型，何时使用小型模型，而现有方法（如基于 token 概率或事后验证）会引入显著的推理开销。
AI.method: 受 LRM 中“灵光一闪”现象的启发，提出了一种新的视角：推理步骤的难度可以从其第一个 token 推断。通过计算第一个 token 的熵来预测步骤难度。在此基础上，设计了 GlimpRouter 框架：一个轻量级模型生成每个推理步骤的第一个 token，如果第一个 token 的熵超过预设阈值，则将该步骤路由到更大的模型。
AI.result: 在多个基准测试中，GlimpRouter 显著降低了推理延迟，同时保持了准确性。例如，在 AIME25 数据集上，GlimpRouter 的准确性比单独使用大型模型提高了 10.7%，同时推理延迟降低了 25.9%。
AI.conclusion: 基于对推理步骤第一个 token 的“一瞥”信息来分配计算，而非进行完整的步骤评估，是一种简单而有效的推理机制，能够显著提高效率而不过多牺牲准确性。

title: Inside Out: Evolving User-Centric Core Memory Trees for Long-Term Personalized Dialogue Systems
summary: Existing long-term personalized dialogue systems struggle to reconcile unbounded interaction streams with finite context constraints, often succumbing to memory noise accumulation, reasoning degradation, and persona inconsistency. To address these challenges, this paper proposes Inside Out, a framework that utilizes a globally maintained PersonaTree as the carrier of long-term user profiling. By constraining the trunk with an initial schema and updating the branches and leaves, PersonaTree enables controllable growth, achieving memory compression while preserving consistency. Moreover, we train a lightweight MemListener via reinforcement learning with process-based rewards to produce structured, executable, and interpretable {ADD, UPDATE, DELETE, NO_OP} operations, thereby supporting the dynamic evolution of the personalized tree. During response generation, PersonaTree is directly leveraged to enhance outputs in latency-sensitive scenarios; when users require more details, the agentic mode is triggered to introduce details on-demand under the constraints of the PersonaTree. Experiments show that PersonaTree outperforms full-text concatenation and various personalized memory systems in suppressing contextual noise and maintaining persona consistency. Notably, the small MemListener model achieves memory-operation decision performance comparable to, or even surpassing, powerful reasoning models such as DeepSeek-R1-0528 and Gemini-3-Pro.
