AI.tldr: 本文提出了Inside Out框架，通过PersonaTree来管理长期用户画像，解决了现有对话系统在长对话中遇到的记忆噪声、推理退化和个性不一致问题。PersonaTree通过受控增长来压缩记忆并保持一致性，同时训练了一个轻量级的MemListener来动态更新PersonaTree。PersonaTree可以直接用于响应生成，也可用于按需生成细节。实验表明，PersonaTree在抑制噪声和保持个性一致性方面优于现有方法，且MemListener在记忆操作决策方面表现出色。
AI.motivation: 现有长期个性化对话系统难以处理无限的交互信息流和有限的上下文约束，导致记忆噪声累积、推理能力下降和个性不一致。作者旨在解决这些问题，提高对话系统的长期记忆和个性化能力。
AI.method: 提出Inside Out框架，核心是PersonaTree，用于承载长期用户画像。PersonaTree通过初始化模式约束其主干，并通过更新分支和叶子实现可控生长、记忆压缩和一致性保持。训练了一个轻量级的MemListener，利用基于过程的奖励进行强化学习，以生成结构化的、可执行的、可解释的内存操作（ADD, UPDATE, DELETE, NO_OP），以支持PersonaTree的动态演化。在响应生成时，直接利用PersonaTree；需要更多细节时，则触发代理模式。
AI.result: PersonaTree在抑制上下文噪声和保持个性一致性方面优于全文本拼接和各种个性化记忆系统。轻量级的MemListener模型在记忆操作决策方面的表现与DeepSeek-R1-0528和Gemini-3-Pro等强大的推理模型相当，甚至更优。
AI.conclusion: Inside Out框架及其核心组件PersonaTree和MemListener能够有效解决长期个性化对话系统面临的挑战，实现了记忆压缩、个性一致性保持和动态内存更新，并在实验中展现出优越的性能。

title: LELA: an LLM-based Entity Linking Approach with Zero-Shot Domain Adaptation
summary: Entity linking (mapping ambiguous mentions in text to entities in a knowledge base) is a foundational step in tasks such as knowledge graph construction, question-answering, and information extraction. Our method, LELA, is a modular coarse-to-fine approach that leverages the capabilities of large language models (LLMs), and works with different target domains, knowledge bases and LLMs, without any fine-tuning phase. Our experiments across various entity linking settings show that LELA is highly competitive with fine-tuned approaches, and substantially outperforms the non-fine-tuned ones.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为LELA的模块化粗粒度到细粒度实体链接方法，该方法无需微调即可利用大型语言模型（LLMs）的能力，并在各种实体链接场景下表现出竞争力。
AI.motivation: 现有的实体链接方法通常需要针对特定领域和知识库进行微调，而LLMs在实体链接任务中展现出潜力，但如何有效地利用LLMs来解决跨领域、跨知识库的实体链接问题，同时避免微调的成本，是研究的动机。
AI.method: LELA采用模块化、粗粒度到细粒度的策略，首先进行粗粒度的候选实体生成，然后利用LLMs进行细粒度的消歧，整个过程无需对LLMs进行微调，支持不同的目标领域、知识库和LLMs。
AI.result: 在多个实体链接实验设置中，LELA的表现与微调方法相比具有很强的竞争力，并且显著优于非微调方法。
AI.conclusion: LELA是一种高效、灵活且无需微调的实体链接方法，能够有效地利用LLMs的能力，在各种场景下取得优异的性能，为实际应用提供了新的解决方案。

title: Evaluative Fingerprints: Stable and Systematic Differences in LLM Evaluator Behavior
comment: 23 pages, 6 figures, code and artifacts at : https://github.com/wajid-nasser/evaluative-fingerprints
summary: LLM-as-judge systems promise scalable, consistent evaluation. We find the opposite: judges are consistent, but not with each other; they are consistent with themselves. Across 3,240 evaluations (9 judges x 120 unique video x pack items x 3 independent runs), inter-judge agreement is near-zero (Krippendorff's α = 0.042). On two dimensions, judges disagree more than random noise would predict (α < 0). Yet this disagreement isn't chaos; it's structured. A classifier identifies which judge produced an evaluation with 77.1% accuracy from rubric scores alone, rising to 89.9% with disposition features. Within model families, the signal is even stronger: GPT-4.1 and GPT-5.2 are distinguishable with 99.6% accuracy. We call this the reliability paradox: judges cannot agree on what constitutes quality, yet their disagreement patterns are so stable they function as fingerprints. Each judge implements a distinct, stable theory of quality: an "evaluative disposition" that shapes how it interprets any rubric. We characterize these dispositions along multiple axes: harshness/leniency, dimension emphasis, within-judge stability (ICC), and evidence behavior (receipt validity, semantic linkage via NLI, and shotgun index). The implication is stark: LLM judges are not interchangeable instruments measuring a shared construct. They are distinct measurement devices, each encoding its own implicit theory of quality. Averaging their scores produces a synthetic verdict that corresponds to no judge's actual values.

AI.tldr: 大型语言模型（LLM）作为评判者在评估中表现出高度的内部一致性，但不同评判者之间缺乏一致性，每个评判者都遵循其独特的、稳定的“评价倾向”。
AI.motivation: 研究人员希望利用 LLM 作为评判者来实现可扩展、一致的评估，但现有研究未能充分验证其可靠性。
AI.method: 通过对 9 个 LLM 评判者对 120 个视频进行 3 次独立评估（共 3240 次评估）来检验评判者间的一致性。使用 Krippendorff's α 系数衡量一致性，并训练分类器以识别评判者。进一步分析了评判者的“评价倾向”，包括严厉/宽容度、维度侧重、内部稳定性（ICC）和证据行为（收据效度、NLI 语义关联、霰弹枪指数）。
AI.result: 评判者间的一致性接近零（Krippendorff's α = 0.042），甚至在某些维度上低于随机水平（α < 0）。然而，这种不一致性具有结构性，仅凭评分即可以 77.1% 的准确率识别出评判者，结合其他特征可达 89.9%。模型家族内部（如 GPT-4.1 和 GPT-5.2）区分度极高（99.6%）。
AI.conclusion: LLM 评判者并非可互换的测量工具，而是拥有各自独特且稳定的“评价倾向”，它们独立解释质量标准。简单地平均其分数会产生一个与任何单一评判者价值都不匹配的合成结果。

title: Distilling the Thought, Watermarking the Answer: A Principle Semantic Guided Watermark for Large Reasoning Models
summary: Reasoning Large Language Models (RLLMs) excelling in complex tasks present unique challenges for digital watermarking, as existing methods often disrupt logical coherence or incur high computational costs. Token-based watermarking techniques can corrupt the reasoning flow by applying pseudo-random biases, while semantic-aware approaches improve quality but introduce significant latency or require auxiliary models. This paper introduces ReasonMark, a novel watermarking framework specifically designed for reasoning-intensive LLMs. Our approach decouples generation into an undisturbed Thinking Phase and a watermarked Answering Phase. We propose a Criticality Score to identify semantically pivotal tokens from the reasoning trace, which are distilled into a Principal Semantic Vector (PSV). The PSV then guides a semantically-adaptive mechanism that modulates watermark strength based on token-PSV alignment, ensuring robustness without compromising logical integrity. Extensive experiments show ReasonMark surpasses state-of-the-art methods by reducing text Perplexity by 0.35, increasing translation BLEU score by 0.164, and raising mathematical accuracy by 0.67 points. These advancements are achieved alongside a 0.34% higher watermark detection AUC and stronger robustness to attacks, all with a negligible increase in latency. This work enables the traceable and trustworthy deployment of reasoning LLMs in real-world applications.

AI.tldr: ReasonMark 是一种新颖的大语言模型数字水印框架，通过解耦生成过程、识别关键 token 并根据 token-PSV 对齐来调整水印强度，从而在不损害推理逻辑的情况下实现可靠的水印，并在多项指标上超越现有技术。
AI.motivation: 现有数字水印技术在处理擅长复杂任务的推理大语言模型（RLLMs）时面临挑战，容易破坏逻辑连贯性或产生高计算成本。Token 级水印会引入伪随机偏差，损害推理流程；语义感知方法虽能提高质量，但会增加延迟或需要辅助模型。
AI.method: ReasonMark 将生成过程分为独立的“思考阶段”和水印“回答阶段”。提出“关键度得分”识别推理过程中的语义关键 token，并将其提炼成“主语义向量”（PSV）。PSV 用于指导一个语义自适应机制，根据 token 与 PSV 的对齐程度来调整水印强度，以保证鲁棒性且不影响逻辑完整性。
AI.result: ReasonMark 在文本困惑度上降低了 0.35，翻译 BLEU 分数提高了 0.164，数学准确率提高了 0.67。同时，水印检测 AUC 提高了 0.34%，对攻击的鲁棒性更强，且延迟增加极小。
AI.conclusion: ReasonMark 是一种专为推理大语言模型设计的数字水印框架，能够有效抵抗攻击、保持水印鲁棒性并保留推理的逻辑完整性，从而实现可追溯和可信赖的推理大语言模型部署。

title: Measuring and Fostering Peace through Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
summary: We used machine learning and artificial intelligence: 1) to measure levels of peace in countries from news and social media and 2) to develop on-line tools that promote peace by helping users better understand their own media diet. For news media, we used neural networks to measure levels of peace from text embeddings of on-line news sources. The model, trained on one news media dataset also showed high accuracy when used to analyze a different news dataset. For social media, such as YouTube, we developed other models to measure levels of social dimensions important in peace using word level (GoEmotions) and context level (Large Language Model) methods. To promote peace, we note that 71% of people 20-40 years old daily view most of their news through short videos on social media. Content creators of these videos are biased towards creating videos with emotional activation, making you angry to engage you, to increase clicks. We developed and tested a Chrome extension, MirrorMirror, which provides real-time feedback to YouTube viewers about the peacefulness of the media they are watching. Our long term goal is for MirrorMirror to evolve into an open-source tool for content creators, journalists, researchers, platforms, and individual users to better understand the tone of their media creation and consumption and its effects on viewers. Moving beyond simple engagement metrics, we hope to encourage more respectful, nuanced, and informative communication.

AI.tldr: 该研究利用机器学习和人工智能技术，通过分析新闻和社交媒体数据来衡量国家和平水平，并开发了名为 MirrorMirror 的在线工具，旨在通过提供媒体内容的和平度实时反馈，帮助用户理解和改善他们的媒体消费习惯，最终促进更具建设性的沟通。
AI.motivation: 研究动机在于，当前社交媒体内容（特别是短视频）常倾向于煽动情绪以吸引点击，而大部分年轻人（20-40岁）日常通过此类媒体获取信息。作者希望找到一种方法来衡量和提升媒体内容的和平性，并帮助用户认识到其媒体消费的影响。
AI.method: 该研究使用了机器学习和人工智能方法。对于新闻媒体，采用了神经网络和文本嵌入技术来衡量和平水平。对于社交媒体（如YouTube），开发了基于词汇级别（GoEmotions）和上下文级别（大型语言模型）的模型来衡量与和平相关的社会维度。此外，开发了一个名为 MirrorMirror 的Chrome扩展程序，为YouTube用户提供所观看媒体内容的和平度实时反馈。
AI.result: 新闻媒体分析模型在不同数据集上表现出高准确性。MirrorMirror Chrome扩展程序已被开发并进行了测试，能为YouTube用户提供媒体内容的和平度反馈。研究表明，71%的20-40岁人群日常主要通过社交媒体短视频获取新闻。
AI.conclusion: 该研究成功地利用AI和ML技术量化了媒体的和平性，并开发了一个工具MirrorMirror来促进更平和的媒体消费。作者期望MirrorMirror能进一步发展成为一个开源工具，帮助内容创作者、记者、平台和用户理解媒体内容及其消费对观众的影响，鼓励更尊重、细致和信息丰富的沟通。

title: Stock Market Price Prediction using Neural Prophet with Deep Neural Network
summary: Stock market price prediction is a significant interdisciplinary research domain that depends at the intersection of finance, statistics, and economics. Forecasting Accurately predicting stock prices has always been a focal point for various researchers. However, existing statistical approaches for time-series prediction often fail to effectively forecast the probability range of future stock prices. Hence, to solve this problem, the Neural Prophet with a Deep Neural Network (NP-DNN) is proposed to predict stock market prices. The preprocessing technique used in this research is Z-score normalization, which normalizes stock price data by removing scale differences, making patterns easier to detect. Missing value imputation fills gaps in historical data, enhancing the models use of complete information for more accurate predictions. The Multi-Layer Perceptron (MLP) learns complex nonlinear relationships among stock market prices and extracts hidden patterns from the input data, thereby creating meaningful feature representations for better prediction accuracy. The proposed NP-DNN model achieved an accuracy of 99.21% compared with other approaches using the Fused Large Language Model. Keywords: deep neural network, forecasting stock prices, multi-layer perceptron, neural prophet, stock market price prediction.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为NP-DNN（Neural Prophet with Deep Neural Network）的新模型，用于更准确地预测股票市场价格，通过Z分数标准化和多层感知器（MLP）来处理数据并学习复杂关系，实验结果显示其准确率高达99.21%。
AI.motivation: 现有的时间序列预测统计方法在预测未来股票价格的概率范围方面存在不足，因此需要一种更有效的方法来解决这个问题。
AI.method: 采用Z分数标准化技术进行数据预处理，并结合多层感知器（MLP）来学习股票价格中的非线性关系和提取隐藏模式，最终构建了Neural Prophet与深度神经网络（NP-DNN）模型。
AI.result: 提出的NP-DNN模型在股票价格预测方面取得了99.21%的准确率，优于其他使用融合大型语言模型的预测方法。
AI.conclusion: NP-DNN模型通过结合Neural Prophet和深度神经网络，并采用有效的预处理技术（Z分数标准化）和特征提取方法（MLP），能够显著提高股票市场价格预测的准确性。

title: GDPO: Group reward-Decoupled Normalization Policy Optimization for Multi-reward RL Optimization
summary: As language models become increasingly capable, users expect them to provide not only accurate responses but also behaviors aligned with diverse human preferences across a variety of scenarios. To achieve this, Reinforcement learning (RL) pipelines have begun incorporating multiple rewards, each capturing a distinct preference, to guide models toward these desired behaviors. However, recent work has defaulted to apply Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) under multi-reward setting without examining its suitability. In this paper, we demonstrate that directly applying GRPO to normalize distinct rollout reward combinations causes them to collapse into identical advantage values, reducing the resolution of the training signal and resulting in suboptimal convergence and, in some cases, early training failure. We then introduce Group reward-Decoupled Normalization Policy Optimization (GDPO), a new policy optimization method to resolve these issues by decoupling the normalization of individual rewards, more faithfully preserving their relative differences and enabling more accurate multi-reward optimization, along with substantially improved training stability. We compare GDPO with GRPO across three tasks: tool calling, math reasoning, and coding reasoning, evaluating both correctness metrics (accuracy, bug ratio) and constraint adherence metrics (format, length). Across all settings, GDPO consistently outperforms GRPO, demonstrating its effectiveness and generalizability for multi-reward reinforcement learning optimization.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为GDPO的新型多奖励强化学习优化方法，用于解决现有GRPO方法在多奖励设置下可能导致的奖励信号模糊和训练不稳定的问题。GDPO通过解耦奖励的归一化，能更准确地保留奖励间的相对差异，从而在工具调用、数学推理和代码推理等任务上显著优于GRPO。
AI.motivation: 用户期望语言模型在提供准确信息的同时，还能遵循不同场景下的多样化人类偏好。在多奖励强化学习中，现有GRPO方法在实际应用中存在问题，例如导致奖励信号归一化后模糊不清，影响模型收敛和训练稳定性。
AI.method: 本文首先分析了GRPO在多奖励设置下可能存在的缺点，即导致不同奖励组合的优势值塌陷。然后，作者提出了一种名为GDPO（Group reward-Decoupled Normalization Policy Optimization）的新方法，该方法通过解耦（decoupling）各个奖励的归一化过程，以更精确地保留奖励间的相对差异，从而实现更准确的多奖励优化。
AI.result: 在工具调用、数学推理和代码推理三个任务上，GDPO相比GRPO在准确率、bug率、格式和长度等多个评估指标上都取得了更好的表现。实验结果表明GDPO具有更高的有效性和泛化能力。
AI.conclusion: GDPO是一种有效且通用的多奖励强化学习优化方法，它通过解耦奖励归一化成功解决了GRPO在多奖励设置下的不足，能够更稳定、更精确地训练语言模型以满足多样化的人类偏好。

title: Observations and Remedies for Large Language Model Bias in Self-Consuming Performative Loop
summary: The rapid advancement of large language models (LLMs) has led to growing interest in using synthetic data to train future models. However, this creates a self-consuming retraining loop, where models are trained on their own outputs and may cause performance drops and induce emerging biases. In real-world applications, previously deployed LLMs may influence the data they generate, leading to a dynamic system driven by user feedback. For example, if a model continues to underserve users from a group, less query data will be collected from this particular demographic of users. In this study, we introduce the concept of \textbf{S}elf-\textbf{C}onsuming \textbf{P}erformative \textbf{L}oop (\textbf{SCPL}) and investigate the role of synthetic data in shaping bias during these dynamic iterative training processes under controlled performative feedback. This controlled setting is motivated by the inaccessibility of real-world user preference data from dynamic production systems, and enables us to isolate and analyze feedback-driven bias evolution in a principled manner. We focus on two types of loops, including the typical retraining setting and the incremental fine-tuning setting, which is largely underexplored. Through experiments on three real-world tasks, we find that the performative loop increases preference bias and decreases disparate bias. We design a reward-based rejection sampling strategy to mitigate the bias, moving towards more trustworthy self-improving systems.

AI.tldr: 研究提出“自消费表演性循环”（SCPL）概念，分析了在受控表演性反馈下，合成数据如何影响迭代训练过程中偏见的演变，并提出一种基于奖励的拒绝采样策略来缓解偏见。
AI.motivation: 现有研究对LLM使用合成数据进行训练的“自消费”现象及其可能导致的性能下降和偏见累积表示担忧。在实际应用中，已部署的LLM会影响生成的数据，形成受用户反馈驱动的动态系统。本研究旨在模拟并分析这种由合成数据和动态反馈引起的偏见演变。
AI.method: 提出“自消费表演性循环”（SCPL）的概念，并设计了一个受控的实验设置来隔离和分析反馈驱动的偏见演变。实验考虑了两种循环类型：典型再训练和增量微调。通过在三个真实世界任务上进行实验来评估偏见的变化，并设计了一种基于奖励的拒绝采样策略来减轻偏见。
AI.result: 研究发现在表演性循环中，偏好偏见会增加，而分布内偏见会减少。所提出的基于奖励的拒绝采样策略能够有效缓解偏见。
AI.conclusion: 合成数据在LLM的迭代训练过程中可能导致偏见的累积，尤其是在存在表演性反馈的情况下。增量微调作为一种常见但未被充分探索的循环形式，也对偏见产生影响。提出的奖励驱动的拒绝采样策略为构建更可信赖的自改进系统提供了一种有效的方法。

title: SimuAgent: An LLM-Based Simulink Modeling Assistant Enhanced with Reinforcement Learning
summary: Large language models (LLMs) have revolutionized text-based code automation, but their potential in graph-oriented engineering workflows remains under-explored. We introduce SimuAgent, an LLM-powered modeling and simulation agent tailored for Simulink. SimuAgent replaces verbose XML with a concise, dictionary-style Python representation, dramatically cutting token counts, improving interpretability, and enabling fast, in-process simulation. A lightweight plan-execute architecture, trained in two stages, equips the agent with both low-level tool skills and high-level design reasoning. To tackle sparse rewards in long-horizon tasks, we propose Reflection-GRPO (ReGRPO), which augments Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) with self-reflection traces that supply rich intermediate feedback, accelerating convergence and boosting robustness. Experiments on SimuBench, our newly released benchmark comprising 5300 multi-domain modeling tasks, show that a Qwen2.5-7B model fine-tuned with SimuAgent converges faster and achieves higher modeling accuracy than standard RL baselines, and even surpasses GPT-4o when evaluated with few-shot prompting on the same benchmark. Ablations confirm that the two-stage curriculum and abstract-reconstruct data augmentation further enhance generalization. SimuAgent trains and runs entirely on-premise with modest hardware, delivering a privacy-preserving, cost-effective solution for industrial model-driven engineering. SimuAgent bridges the gap between LLMs and graphical modeling environments, offering a practical solution for AI-assisted engineering design in industrial settings.

AI.tldr: SimuAgent 是一个利用大型语言模型（LLM）驱动的 Simulink 建模和仿真代理，它通过简洁的 Python 表示替代了 XML，加速了仿真过程，并引入了 Reflection-GRPO（ReGRPO）来解决长期任务中的稀疏奖励问题。在 SimuBench 基准测试中，SimuAgent 表现优于标准 RL 基线，甚至在少样本提示下优于 GPT-4o，并且支持本地部署，成本效益高。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型在文本代码自动化方面取得了巨大成功，但在图式工程工作流中的潜力尚未得到充分探索。研究者希望将 LLM 的能力扩展到 Simulink 这样的图形化建模环境中，以提高建模和仿真的效率和准确性。
AI.method: SimuAgent 采用 LLM 技术，将 Simulink 的 XML 表示转换为简洁的 Python 字典格式，以减少 token 数量并提高可解释性。它使用一个两阶段训练的轻量级“规划-执行”架构。为了处理长期任务中的稀疏奖励问题，研究者提出了 Reflection-GRPO（ReGRPO），该方法通过引入自反思（self-reflection）来增强 Group Relative Policy Optimization（GRPO），提供丰富的中间反馈。此外，还使用了抽象-重构（abstract-reconstruct）数据增强技术。
AI.result: 在包含 5300 个多领域建模任务的 SimuBench 基准测试中，经过 SimuAgent 微调的 Qwen2.5-7B 模型比标准 RL 基线收敛更快，建模准确率更高。在少样本提示下，SimuAgent 的表现甚至优于 GPT-4o。实验表明，两阶段课程学习和抽象-重构数据增强能够进一步提升泛化能力。SimuAgent 可以在本地硬件上运行，无需昂贵的计算资源。
AI.conclusion: SimuAgent 成功地将大型语言模型的能力与 Simulink 图形化建模环境相结合，为工业模型驱动工程提供了一个高效、可解释、成本效益高且注重隐私的解决方案，促进了 AI 辅助工程设计的发展。

title: Learning from Mistakes: Negative Reasoning Samples Enhance Out-of-Domain Generalization
comment: Code and data are available at https://github.com/Eureka-Maggie/GLOW
summary: Supervised fine-tuning (SFT) on chain-of-thought (CoT) trajectories demonstrations is a common approach for enabling reasoning in large language models. Standard practices typically only retain trajectories with correct final answers (positives) while ignoring the rest (negatives). We argue that this paradigm discards substantial supervision and exacerbates overfitting, limiting out-of-domain (OOD) generalization. Specifically, we surprisingly find that incorporating negative trajectories into SFT yields substantial OOD generalization gains over positive-only training, as these trajectories often retain valid intermediate reasoning despite incorrect final answers. To understand this effect in depth, we systematically analyze data, training dynamics, and inference behavior, identifying 22 recurring patterns in negative chains that serve a dual role: they moderate loss descent to mitigate overfitting during training and boost policy entropy by 35.67% during inference to facilitate exploration. Motivated by these observations, we further propose Gain-based LOss Weighting (GLOW), an adaptive, sample-aware scheme that exploits such distinctive training dynamics by rescaling per-sample loss based on inter-epoch progress. Empirically, GLOW efficiently leverages unfiltered trajectories, yielding a 5.51% OOD gain over positive-only SFT on Qwen2.5-7B and boosting MMLU from 72.82% to 76.47% as an RL initialization.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了在监督微调（SFT）中使用错误最终答案但包含有效中间推理的“负面”链式思考（CoT）轨迹，发现这可以显著提高模型在未见过数据上的泛化能力。作者提出了GLOW（Gain-based LOss Weighting）方法，通过自适应地调整样本损失权重来利用这些负面轨迹，并在Qwen2.5-7B模型上取得了显著的OOD泛化提升。
AI.motivation: 现有SFT方法通常只保留最终答案正确的“正面”CoT轨迹，忽略了其他轨迹，这可能导致丢失有用的监督信息并加剧过拟合，限制模型在未见过数据上的泛化能力。作者希望探索纳入“负面”轨迹的可能性，以提升模型的OOD泛化能力。
AI.method: 作者首先通过实验发现，将包含错误最终答案但具有有效中间推理的“负面”CoT轨迹纳入SFT，能够带来OOD泛化增益。他们进一步分析了负面轨迹在训练动态和推理行为中的作用，识别出22种模式，并提出了GLOW（Gain-based LOss Weighting）方法，一种根据样本在不同训练轮次间的损失变化来动态调整样本损失权重的自适应方案。
AI.result: GLOW方法能够有效地利用未经过滤的CoT轨迹，在Qwen2.5-7B模型上相比仅使用正面轨迹的SFT，OOD泛化能力提升了5.51%。同时，作为强化学习的初始化，GLOW将MMLU的得分从72.82%提升到76.47%。
AI.conclusion: 将包含有效中间推理但最终答案错误的“负面”CoT轨迹纳入SFT，是提升大型语言模型OOD泛化能力的一种有效途径。GLOW方法通过自适应地利用这些轨迹的独特训练动态，能够更有效地提升模型性能，减少过拟合，并促进推理时的探索。

title: Internal Representations as Indicators of Hallucinations in Agent Tool Selection
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown remarkable capabilities in tool calling and tool usage, but suffer from hallucinations where they choose incorrect tools, provide malformed parameters and exhibit 'tool bypass' behavior by performing simulations and generating outputs instead of invoking specialized tools or external systems. This undermines the reliability of LLM based agents in production systems as it leads to inconsistent results, and bypasses security and audit controls. Such hallucinations in agent tool selection require early detection and error handling. Unlike existing hallucination detection methods that require multiple forward passes or external validation, we present a computationally efficient framework that detects tool-calling hallucinations in real-time by leveraging LLMs' internal representations during the same forward pass used for generation. We evaluate this approach on reasoning tasks across multiple domains, demonstrating strong detection performance (up to 86.4\% accuracy) while maintaining real-time inference capabilities with minimal computational overhead, particularly excelling at detecting parameter-level hallucinations and inappropriate tool selections, critical for reliable agent deployment.

AI.tldr: 研究提出了一种计算高效的框架，通过利用LLM内部表征，在生成的同时实时检测工具调用中的幻觉，提高了LLM代理的可靠性。
AI.motivation: LLM在工具调用中存在幻觉问题（如选择错误工具、参数格式错误、绕过工具调用），这降低了其在生产系统中的可靠性，并绕过了安全和审计控制。需要一种能及早检测和处理这些错误的机制。
AI.method: 提出了一种计算高效的框架，通过在生成过程中利用LLM的内部表征来实时检测工具调用中的幻觉，无需额外的计算。
AI.result: 在多个领域的推理任务上进行了评估，该方法展示了强大的检测性能（最高可达86.4%的准确率），同时保持了实时推理能力和极低的计算开销。特别擅长检测参数级幻觉和不当的工具选择。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的框架能够高效地实时检测LLM代理中的工具调用幻觉，对于构建可靠的LLM代理至关重要。

title: DocDancer: Towards Agentic Document-Grounded Information Seeking
summary: Document Question Answering (DocQA) focuses on answering questions grounded in given documents, yet existing DocQA agents lack effective tool utilization and largely rely on closed-source models. In this work, we introduce DocDancer, an end-to-end trained open-source Doc agent. We formulate DocQA as an information-seeking problem and propose a tool-driven agent framework that explicitly models document exploration and comprehension. To enable end-to-end training of such agents, we introduce an Exploration-then-Synthesis data synthesis pipeline that addresses the scarcity of high-quality training data for DocQA. Training on the synthesized data, the trained models on two long-context document understanding benchmarks, MMLongBench-Doc and DocBench, show their effectiveness. Further analysis provides valuable insights for the agentic tool design and synthetic data.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了DocDancer，一个端到端训练的开源文档问答（DocQA）智能体，通过信息检索方法解决现有DocQA智能体工具利用不足和依赖闭源模型的问题。
AI.motivation: 现有DocQA智能体在工具利用和对闭源模型的依赖方面存在不足，缺乏一个有效的开源解决方案。
AI.method: 将DocQA建模为信息检索问题，提出一个由工具驱动的智能体框架，显式地模拟文档探索和理解过程。为了解决高质量训练数据稀缺的问题，引入了Exploration-then-Synthesis数据合成流水线，并在此合成数据上进行端到端训练。
AI.result: 在MMLongBench-Doc和DocBench两个长上下文文档理解基准测试中，训练好的模型表现出了有效性。
AI.conclusion: DocDancer是一个有效的开源DocQA智能体，其信息检索方法和数据合成流水线在处理长上下文文档理解任务上取得了良好效果，并为智能体工具设计和合成数据提供了有价值的见解。

title: MineNPC-Task: Task Suite for Memory-Aware Minecraft Agents
summary:
We present \textsc{MineNPC-Task}, a user-authored benchmark and evaluation harness for testing memory-aware, mixed-initiative LLM agents in open-world \emph{Minecraft}. Rather than relying on synthetic prompts, tasks are elicited from formative and summative co-play with expert players, normalized into parametric templates with explicit preconditions and dependency structure, and paired with machine-checkable validators under a bounded-knowledge policy that forbids out-of-world shortcuts. The harness captures plan/act/memory events-including plan previews, targeted clarifications, memory reads and writes, precondition checks, and repair attempts and reports outcomes relative to the total number of attempted subtasks, derived from in-world evidence.
  As an initial snapshot, we instantiate the framework with GPT-4o and evaluate \textbf{216} subtasks across \textbf{8} experienced players. We observe recurring breakdown patterns in code execution, inventory/tool handling, referencing, and navigation, alongside recoveries supported by mixed-initiative clarifications and lightweight memory. Participants rated interaction quality and interface usability positively, while highlighting the need for stronger memory persistence across tasks. We release the complete task suite, validators, logs, and harness to support transparent, reproducible evaluation of future memory-aware embodied agents.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了 MineNPC-Task，一个用于评估 Minecraft 中记忆感知、混合式 LLM 代理的基准和评估框架。该框架由专家玩家共同创建任务，并包含机器可检查的验证器，以限制代理使用游戏外捷径。通过在 GPT-4o 上进行的初步评估，发现了代码执行、物品/工具处理、引用和导航方面的常见故障模式，并强调了增强跨任务记忆持久性的需求。
AI.motivation: 现有 LLM 代理的评估方法往往依赖于合成提示，无法充分捕捉在开放世界环境中与人类进行混合式交互时遇到的复杂性和记忆需求。作者希望创建一个更具挑战性、更贴近实际的评估环境，以测试和改进 LLM 代理的记忆能力和与人类合作的能力。
AI.method: 作者创建了一个名为 MineNPC-Task 的用户创作基准和评估框架。该框架包含由专家玩家共同生成的参数化任务模板，这些模板具有明确的前提条件和依赖结构。此外，还提供了机器可检查的验证器，并在“有限知识策略”下运行，该策略禁止代理使用游戏外的捷径。该框架记录了计划、行动和记忆事件，并根据总尝试子任务数评估结果。
AI.result: 使用 GPT-4o 在 8 位专家玩家身上进行了 216 个子任务的初步评估。研究发现了代码执行、物品/工具处理、引用和导航等方面的反复出现的故障模式。评估也显示了混合式澄清和轻量级记忆对恢复的积极作用。玩家对交互质量和界面可用性评价较高，但认为跨任务的记忆持久性需要加强。
AI.conclusion: MineNPC-Task 提供了一个有价值的框架，用于透明和可重复地评估记忆感知和混合式 LLM 代理。初步结果表明，虽然 LLM 代理在某些方面存在不足，但通过混合式交互和一定的记忆能力可以得到改善，并且玩家对交互的体验是积极的。然而，增强代理的记忆持久性是未来研究的重要方向。
